loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy various goods such as beans, potatoes, rice, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Nelson Raul

texts.es: Nelson vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Tiene 36 años de edad está casado tiene 1 hijo de 7 años que asiste a una escuela fiscal.La falta de empleo en el país lo llevo a  tomar  la decisión de trabajar como maestro albañil. En la actualidad Nelson trabaja por contrato. El hace paredes, loza, pisos. Nelson trabaja cuando lo contratan desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.Con el préstamo quiere comprar picos, cascos, cemento etc. Su meta es tener una propia empresa en la que se venda materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Nelson lives in Las Orquídeas, an area north of the city of Guayaquil. He is 36 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old son who attends a state school. Due to the lack of jobs in the country, Nelson made the decision to work on his own as a master bricklayer. He currently works on a contract basis. He builds walls, installs tiles, and lays down floors. Whenever he has a contract, he works from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M.

With this loan, Nelson will buy picks, safety helmets, cement, and other supplies. His goal is to have his own business in which he sells construction materials.

loans.use: to buy picks, safety helmets, cement, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old, married to Charles, and blessed with four children, aged 13, 10, 8 and 6 years. She sells fruits and vegetables, a business she started three years ago, and she earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES. 

Ruth has requested a second loan, of 20,000 KES, to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell. She will reinvest the profits in her business and hopes to become a successful business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is from Maguikay, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old and married, with 3 children. To make a living, Mary Ann cultivates coconut for sale. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Mary Ann is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is a married woman who has five children. She is 49 years old and lives in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Merlyn owns and operates a nipa-making (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials) business venture to earn a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. In 2011, Merlyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Merlyn wants to make improvements to her house and expand/improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a 32-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for two years. He started the business to supplement his meager salary as a government worker. Like most traders in a developing country, he faces challenges of price fluctuation and high taxes. Despite these challenges, he has dreams of owning a wholesale shop and buying land to grow crops. Jimmy intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap, soda, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, soda, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Oreke

texts.en: Oreke, who is 33, lives in West Point with her husband and four children. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 15, and are currently in school. Oreke has a cook shop (restaurant) in her community where she has been selling food for the past five years. She sells six days a week, and prepares cassava leaf, potato grains, fufu and soup to meet her customers' desires. She makes a profit when she sells because of the good service she renders to her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for the business. Her plan is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a 38-year-old, married man, who has three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years he has been a security guard, working with a private security company in the country. His inspiration is derived from the desire to protect the people, after he suffered the loss of his relatives during the rebel insurgency in 2001. After realizing that the meager salary he earns cannot meet his basic needs and those of his family, he set up a retail shop. His desire is to educate his children up to the university and to own a wholesale shop. Jacob is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 42 years old and married; she has four children. Three of her children are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda runs a variety store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF, to purchase more grocery items to resell in her store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to resell in her store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 59, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Isidro and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosario operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Rosario also sells ice cream. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosario is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosario dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 24 years old. He lives in Khoni District with his mother and brother. The family runs a small dairy business of a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products. They sell their dairy products locally. Mamuka has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Mamuka requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan programs extend business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor. These families do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Mamuka will purchase grapes and sugar to produce wine. After the products are purchased, the family will be able to sell a good quality wine at a high price. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Mamuka awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase grapes and sugar for producing wine

loans.name: Phiona's Group

texts.en:
Phiona's group is comprised of hard-working women. Phiona is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Phiona has been working hard to manage her soft drinks business, which sells lemonade and juice. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more lemonade and juice for resale, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and to pay fees for her younger brother. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more lemonade and juice for resale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has had a grocery shop for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, bread, tea leaves and cooking oil. She sells on a retail basis and works six days a week. She works at the market. She generates additional income from rental rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked grocery shop and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, bread, tea leaves and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his daughter's school expenses

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: John Bosco is a 32-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. After realizing the need for more capital to live a modest life, he started a motorcycle spare-parts shop. His personal goals are buying a plot and building a good residential house. His business plan is diversifying the business to include motor vehicle spare parts. John Bosco is requesting for a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a 41-year-old, married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 16 while the youngest is 4. 

Gaudiosa is engaged in basket weaving. She sells native baskets and earns 2,400 pesos a month by doing the basket weaving. She has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase buri (palm) wicker- it is a hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture. Gaudiosa would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures to support her family and at the same time to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy buri (palm) wicker

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen, 56, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Efren and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carmen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Carmen also sells ice cream. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Carmen is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Carmen simply wants to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 41 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She owns a cereals store and has been in operation for a period of four years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has applied for her second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to purchase five bags of dry maize and beans for resale.  

The anticipated amount will be used to repay the loan and diversify to another business. She hopes to own a retail shop and educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of dry maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Nfonika Veronica

texts.en:
She is married and has four children, one of them below 15 years of age. The family lives in a three-room apartment house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some problems in life, among which are the death of one of her family members, illness, and inadequate capital to start up a business. 
 
She plans to use the loan she requested as follows: Buy coca yams in bags, buy palm oil in tins, buy fish in bulk. Also, part of the loan will be used to invest in all the spices that will be used in cooking the food. She believes that her restaurant business will succeed, because she has being cooking and selling food for a long time. Her existing, regular customers provide an available market for her food. Also, the increasing number of schools in the town of Bamenda greatly act as a market for prepared food, which is another reason to expect the business to succeed. From this restaurant business, the community will be able to consume good-quality, always-ready cooked food. They also will not need to go long distances to buy cooked food.
 
With the profit from the loan, she will educate her children, pay rent for their home, and provide all the basic needs for her children, like medical care.   She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates on loans and the training that is given by GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy coca yams, palm oil, fish, and spices, for cooking meals.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married to Paul and blessed with two children, ages 15 and 10 years, respectively. Irene runs a retail shop, a business she started 4 years ago. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

Irene has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES to purchase 10 bales of baking flour, cooking oil, five sacks of sugar and two sacks of rice.

The profit earned from the business will help her save and buy a matatu (a mini-bus for public transportation). Her dream is to see this business grow into a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bales of baking flour, cooking oil, five sacks of sugar and two sacks of rice.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 42-year-old, married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in agriculture for 21 years and with the income earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming. Wilson also sells secondhand clothes so as to supplement his farming activities which are seasonal. 

Wilson suffered the loss of his plantation when there was an outbreak of banana wilt disease in the country coupled with soil erosion due to the torrential rains, thus leading to poor yields this year. Wilson is requesting a loan to buy manure for his banana plantation.

His dreams are educating his children up to the university and rehabilitating his banana plantation through modern farming methods since farming has always been his major source of income.

loans.use: to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 34, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danny, a farmer, and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alma is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Alma also sells different vegetables. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Alma is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Alma dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fish and vegetables that she sells to customers.

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les sept femmes du groupe Kotognogotala ont  en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments de tous genres. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe  décident  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,  Mélanie (1 ère debout avec un foulard jaune) excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 paquets de maggi 1 boite de concentrée de tomate, 1/2 sac de sel de cuisine et une grande quantité de condiments.  Elle s’approvisionne à la foire de KIMPARANA et effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Mélanie  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 7000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and living mainly in traditional extended families, the seven women in the group Kotognogotala have a mean age of 36 years and an average of four children. They all live in the village of Niazekan in the region of Ségou (located in the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of vicinity, commerce and kinship. Their main business is the sale of vegetable-based sauces.

In order to satisfy the demands of their ever-growing clientele, the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are currently on their first group loan cycle.

Mélanie (shown standing on the far left and wearing a yellow scarf in the photo) is a superior sauce-maker. She is very sought after as a businesswoman. Mélanie plans to use her loan to purchase three packets of Maggi (a brand of bouillon base), one carton of tomato paste, half a sack of cooking salt, and a large number of sauce vegetables. She purchases her supplies from the market in Kimparana and sells her goods for cash at retail to a diverse and varied clientele.

With this loan, Mélanie hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 7,000 FCFA. She will use this income to reinvest in her business and to help her husband in paying for their household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase the supplies to make vegetable-based sauces for selling.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a 44-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest child is twenty-four and the youngest is nine. She is engaged in food vending. She sells snack foods and fruit juice to the nearby school. She has been in the food vending business for five years. Aside from food vending, she raises pigs.

She has requested a loan of 4,000PHP to buy more merchandise like fruit juice, feed for her pigs and additional piglets. In the future, Paz would like to expand her business by investing in other ventures to support her family and at the same time send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruit juice, feed and piglets.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is 30 years old and an active and diligent, married woman. She is a responsible mother of two sons, and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. Her husband is a hard-working taxi driver. She faced a really difficult time, because her husband's income is inadequate to provide for his family. So, to help her husband, Shabana initiated a hand-embroidery business in 2010, because she knew she had excellent embroidery skills. Her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. She serves her customers well and gets a lot of appreciation from them.

To continue her business and to respond to the increasing demand of customers, Shabana wants to purchase a variety of embroidery materials, like beads, hoops, and thread in various colors. To do that, she has requested a loan as a member of a six-person group, from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She dreams of providing the best education to her children, so from her profit she will put aside some savings, for their higher education expenses. 

Note: In the picture, the borrower named Yasmeen is shown with her children (a daughter and a son). And Shabana is holding a pass book in her hands.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials such as beads, hoops and thread in many colors, to continue developing her embroidery business.

loans.name: Izoldi

texts.en:
Izoldi is 45 years old and from a small village of the Gurjaani district, East Georgia. She lives with her 49-year-old husband and her two sons (20- and 15-years-old). Her husband works as a brick-layer and gets a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 45 persimmon roots; they harvest them and sell them locally. 

Izoldi has a 0.20 hectare vineyard and she produces Churchkhela (traditional sausage-shaped candies; the main ingredients are grape must, nuts and flour) and sells them in the village at the local open market. She is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business.

Izoldi has requested a loan to purchase a stock of nuts for her Churchkhela. After the stock of nuts is purchased, she will be able to produce more Churchkhela and increase her sales. This will significantly increase the income of her family and thus, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Izoldi awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a shock of nuts to make more Churchkhela to sell.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is a single yet business-oriented man. He is 29 years of age and living with his auntie. Ariel is a farmer and at the same time a hog-raiser within his local community. By this time, he manages his half hectare of a corn field and raises three hogs to be fattened for sale. 

He planed to buy four piglets and some hog feed, but due to insufficient funds he is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP25,000. He knows that this loan will keep his business growing continuously and make it more profitable because he always sees to it that he provides the necessary hog feed for his hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and more livestock feed for his hog-raising.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is 53 years old, married and has two children. He is from Nablus.
He has a bachelor's degree and has owned a blacksmith shop since 2000.
Imad has asked Ryada for this loan to buy a welding machine, electrical scissors, and a grinding machine.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase his work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine, electrical scissors, and a grinding machine..

loans.name: Maria Fermina

texts.es:
María Fermina es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos menores. Tiene casa propia en la que vive con su familia en el sector Monteverde, en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope. Su comunidad cuenta aproximadamente con 150 familias.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio y a la crianza y comercialización de animales, los cuales una vez alcanzado su peso y talla ideal, los vende en el mercado local. Las dos actividades mencionadas las realiza en su domicilio, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de labores en agricultura.

Su bodega es de mucha ayuda para sus vecinos ya que, debido a que la zona en la que residen se encuentra lejos del pueblo central, su negocio les provee de los artículos de primera necesidad que necesitan.

Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un crédito brindado a través de Kiva, se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad. Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2300 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros artículos de primera necesidad, para implementar su bodega, así como en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales.
texts.en:
María Fermina, 40, is a married woman with two minor children.  She has a house of her own and lives with her family in the Monteverde sector, a rural zone in Mórrope District.  Her community has approximately 150 families.

Her activity is selling groceries at home and raising animals to sell; when they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the local market.  She does both mentioned activities at home and has more than three years’ experience in the line of work.  She earns extra income working in agriculture.

Her store is of much benefit to her neighbors because the zone they live in is far from the main town and her store provides basic staples they need.

She’s worked with a Kiva loan previously and she’s quite grateful to the people who supported her on that occasion.  She’s currently requesting a 2,300 new sol loan to buy more groceries like rice, sugar, oil and other basic staples to stock her store and also to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her stor and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 35 years old and married with two children. His two children are still studying. Rodolfo is engaged in the hog-raising and farming business. He has run his hog-raising business for one year. Rodolfo would like to buy feed and vitamins for his livestock and plans to prepare his corn farm plot so he can ensure proper care of his corn farming business.

To make his goal attainable, he is borrowing a loan of PHP40,000. He believes this will keep his hogs healthier and fatter because he will sustain them with proper nutrition upon reaching their optimum growth. He just hopes that the lenders will continue to support him financially so he can educate his two children and improve his financial status.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs and prepare the land of his corn field.

loans.name: Reneh

texts.en: Reneh, 54 years old, is a married woman and resident of Lebanon. With her husband and three adorable children, she decided to carry on her life despite some difficult circumstances. At this time, she’s cooperating with her husband and expecting a shiny future for their children. Reneh decided to start her own business in 1995. She’s specialized in knitting handmade table covers. Her husband is a carpenter working at a local company. She wants to better develop her business and improve her work as well. She decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added yarn and other knitting supplies that can speed up her work and make it much easier. This Kiva loan will also allow her to offer a greater quality of products and thus improve her income by minimum of 20 percent. This is how she works every day to make her greatest dream a reality and expand her profession.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and other supplies for knitting

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, two attending school. Three years ago, she started her own business of shop keeping on a small scale. She sells various goods of daily use such as soaps, lotions and grocery items in her general store. Samina operates from 8 a.m. till 10 p.m. every day except Sundays. Her son assists her in his free time so she can manage to perform house activities as well.  

She has gradually improved her business and now she has requested a loan of Rs.10000 to buy more packs of cleaning products and beverages. This will enable her to cater to more customers time after time.  She dreams to renovate her house and build another room for her children.

loans.use: to buy more packs of cleaning products and beverages.

loans.name: Dina Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señorita Dina del Rosario esta soltera, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó su estudio como secretaria de oficina, actualmente se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa: chumpas, playeras, camisas, pañuelos, etc. inicio este negocio gracias a su familia, hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para la venta, consistente en Chumpas para así tener mas posibilidades de tener mas ventas y ganancias. En el futuro espera tener una venta mayor.
texts.en: Dina del Rosario’s single.  She’s 25-years-old and studied to become an office secretary.  She currently works in commerce selling clothes like sweaters, t-shirts, shirts, handkerchiefs, etc.  She started this business thanks to her family and to date has five years’ experience.  She’s requesting a loan that she’ll use to buy merchandise consisting of sweaters to sell and thus have more sales and profit possibilities.  She hopes her future sales will be higher.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nancy Yanine

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven madre de familia que reside junto a su menor hija en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizada principalmente por producir frutas como el mango, las cuales son exportadas a otros países. La zona pertenece a la región Piura y actualmente cuenta solo con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Ella se ha dedicado desde hace varios años a la venta itinerante de prendas de vestir y gracias a otros créditos financiados a través de Kiva anteriormente pudo ampliar su negocio hacia la venta de artículos confeccionados en plástico. Actualmente cuenta con bastante clientela establecida en la zona debido al empeño que le ha puesto a las labores que realiza.

Recientemente fue contratada por un fundo de la zona especializado en el cultivo de frutas para exportación en donde trabaja como operaria. Ella trabaja por las mañanas en este lugar y por las tardes se dedica a su negocio original.

Nancy se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le han ayudado en anteriores oportunidades a través de Kiva y, debido a la buena experiencia por la que paso, se encuentra solicitando nuevamente un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más prendas de vestir y artículos de plástico con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio.

Ella agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyen en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Nancy is a young mother living with her minor daughter in one of the settlements that make up the rural zone of Tambogrande District, a tropical zone noted primarily for growing mangoes that are exported to other countries.  The zone belongs to the Piura Region and currently only has electricity.

She’s been working selling clothes from place to place for several years and thanks to other previous loans financed through Kiva she was able to expand the business into selling plastic ware.  She currently has quite a large clientele in the zone thanks to the effort she’s put into the work she does.

She was recently hired by a large agricultural estate specializing in fruit production where she works as a laborer.  She works mornings in this place and spends afternoons in her original business.

Nancy is very grateful to people who have helped her through Kiva in past occasions and because of the good experience she had she’s now asking for a 2,000 new sol loan to buy more articles of clothing and plastic ware she can use to expand her business with.  She gives thanks in advance to all the people who will support her on this occasion.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and plastic items to expand the business.

loans.name: Soledad Yesenia

texts.es:
Soledad es una joven de 23 años vive al lado de sus padres a quienes apoya mucho en la ciudad de Pisco, soledad es una joven muy alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio y le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser enfermera. Día a día Soledad trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 hora sal día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes al día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes.

Soledad está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz pro sacos, azúcar al por mayor, fideos, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y poder seguir esforzándose por  conseguir lograr su mas grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble y tener otro negocio”.
texts.en:
Soledad is a young woman who's 23 years old. She lives in the town of Pisco with her parents, to whom she provides much support. Soledad is a very cheerful young woman with a great deal of drive to get ahead. In her free time, she very much enjoys playing volleyball with her neighbors and friends from her neighborhood. She also loves to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, the delicious "arroz con pollo" (rice with chicken). Because of her scarce financial resources, she could only study up to the fifth grade of middle school. However, she would have liked to have studied to become a nurse.
Soledad works everyday on her small business of selling groceries. She works about 10 hours a day and may serve up to 10 customers a day. She believes that her business is doing well because she's friendly towards the customers.
Soledad is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she'll be able to purchase merchandise for her business such as sacks of rice, wholesale sugar, noodles, etc. That way she'll have a wider variety of products to offer. She'll also be able to keep on working hard in order to accomplish her biggest dream: finishing the construction of her house with noble materials and owning another business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business such as sacks of rice, wholesale sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some goods for her store like Fanta, cakes, sugar, etc and to buy some materials and machines for her sewing business to get more profits.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling firewood for the last six years and also does farming. She hopes to build a house, educate her children and expand her business to new areas despite challenges of inadequate capital to meet the demand. She says that if she had enough money, she would diversify to other fuel sources such as cook stoves and solar, which has no negative impact on the environment. Oliver intends to use the loan facility to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
Roderick manages his 1-hectare corn field and a livestock business. He has operated his livestock business for three years. Roderick is married with three children. While he is busy cultivating his corn farm, his wife also enjoys feeding his hogs. They work together to gain a good income for the family's well being, children's education and have a comfortable living condition.

Roderick is now seeking additional working capital of PHP 19,000 that would allow him to buy necessary feed. Some of the loan amount will be used for land preparation of his corn field. He believes that his business will further grow because of his patience and determination in life.

loans.use: to buy necessary feed and for land preparation of his corn field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Lourdes vive en una comunidad donde la gente habla la lengua mazahua, cuenta que tiene 36 años de edad por el momento está viviendo en unión libre con el señor Carlos juntos han formado una familia con sus cuatro hijos que van a la escuela anteriormente doña Lourdes ya habia estado en uno grupo grande esta vez ha solicitado un crédito individual para invertirlo en su negocio de venta y compra de pollos  vivos y muertos ya que tienen un pedido demasiado grande y cree no poder con todo el gasto platica que con el crédito comprara mas pollos y algunos duces ya que además del negocio de la venta de pollos también tiene una tienda de abarrotes pero además hace comida para los maestros que se encuentran dando clases en la comunidad, la cantidad no sabe porque comprar poco poco. Doña Lourdes lleva ya 7 años en su negocio ella comprar el pollo vivo a un menor precio para luego venderlo ella a domicilio a un precio más alto ya casi siempre tiene muchos pedido ya está en casa o en las localidades más cercanas. Platica que inicio su negocio porque quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar para poder mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y su familia, sin embrago la dificultad más grande a la que se presenta doña Lourdes es cuando no hay ningún evento y casi no hay ventas y peor aun si encargo muchos pollos se quedaran ahí sin vender, pero esto no la desanima ya que sabe que si hoy no vendió mañana le irá mejor. Una de las metas de doña Lourdes es mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia más que nada para mejorar la educación de sus hijos quiere que terminen una carrera para que tengan una mejor vida. Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con el crédito ya que con sus ganancias podrá comprarles zapatos, alimento, ropa a los niños.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in a community where the people speak the language Mazahua. She is 36 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Carlos. Together they have formed a family with their four children who go to school.

Previously, Lourdes was in a large group. This time, she has asked for an individual loan to invest in her business selling live and butchered chickens, as they have an order too big and she believes she can’t cover the expenses, so she says with the loan she will buy more chickens and also some sweets to sell in her chicken business.

She also has a grocery store but also makes food for the teachers who are giving classes in the community. She doesn’t know the amount because she buys little by little.

Lourdes has been in the business seven years buying live chickens at a low price and later selling them from home at a higher price and almost always she has many orders from home or in the nearby communities.

She says that she began her business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses in order to improve the quality of life for her and her family. However, the biggest difficulty that Lourdes faces is when there is no activity, and almost no sales, and even worse when she has many chickens not sold, but this does not discourage her as she knows that if not sold today, tomorrow will be better.

One of Lourdes goals is to improve the quality of life for her and her family and more than anything to improve the education of her children who she wants to finish school in order to have a better life. She is very happy and grateful for the loan as with her earnings she can buy shoes, food, and clothing for the children.

loans.use: to buy chickens and sweets for her business, selling from home and in the nearby communities

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina es una mujer de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella tiene 2 hijos ya mayores, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, por diversas razones Angelina se separó de su esposo desde hace muchos años, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madres para sus hijos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora, que tiene muchos deseos por salir adelante; lamentablemente Angelina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en alguna de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para engreírlos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angelina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Angelina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como gaseosas, agua mineral, cervezas, entre otros; de esta manera Angelina tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ampliar su negocio y convertirse en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Angelina is a 51-year-old woman living in the city of Pucallpa.  She has two adult children who she loves and are her main reason for living.  For various reasons, Angelina separated from her husband many years ago and since then she’s been both father and mother to her children.  She’s a very kind, hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Unfortunately, Angelina was unable to study nursing because she had to go to work very young but she would have loved to have done so.  In her free time she enjoys spending pleasant time with her family and sometimes cooks a delicious Chicken with Rice to pamper them with.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Angelina works in her small business selling beverages.  She starts work every day very early in the morning and can work up to 12 hours daily.  She thinks she does well because of the good prices she offers her customers.

Angelina is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy merchandise like soft-drinks, mineral water and beer, among others for her business.  In this way, Angelina will have the business well-stocked and will be able to increase sales and income this way that will help her to gradually expand the business and become a distributorship.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Efrain esta soltero, tiene 48 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educacion primaria, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo gracia al apoyo de sus familiares y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia,.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de insumos en la elaboración de tejidos, espera en el futuro tener una mejor producción, empleados, y así seguir apoyando a sus padres.
texts.en: Efraín, 48, is single.  He completed elementary school and works as a weaver.  He started this work thanks to support from his parents and to date has six years’ experience.  he requests a loan to buy supplies for his work. He hopes in future to produce more, hire staff and continue supporting his parents.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Zuliyata's Group

texts.en:
Zuliyata's group is comprised of 2 hard-working women. Zuliyata is 23 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Zuliyata has been working hard to manage her fruit business which sells fruits. 

To help expand her business, Zuliyata has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to get other varieties of fruits to sell and will help Zuliyata to generate greater profits and support her family. Zuliyata hopes that in the future she will be able to get her business to grow. 

Zuliyata is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to get other varieties of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in the Malindi area of Coast province in Kenya. She is married and a mother of four children that attend school.  She owns a green grocery stall which she has been operating for ten years. In this business, Martha sells greens, fruits, vegetables, cereals etc. She also has rental houses.
Martha learned about Milango through a friend and joined in hopes of obtaining credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are bad debts and lack of enough capital to expand her business.  She feels this issue will be helped in part by this new application/loan.
Martha is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables in wholesale and retail stock of e.g. soap, sugar etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and pay for her children's school fees. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy vegetable in wholesale and retail stock of e.g. soap, sugar etc.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, con 5 hijos con carga familiar directa, vive en casa propia junto a su familia. Su vivienda se encuentra situada en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona de Lambayeque, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50 familias.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza y  comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Los ingresos que obtienen de estas actividades le sirven para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Adicionalmente cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de actividades relacionadas a la agricultura

El se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de cerdos y pavos para su posterior venta en navidad.
texts.en:
Valentín, 39, is married and has five children who are dependent on him.  He lives in his own house with his family.  His house is located in one of the settlements making up the Lambayeque zone; it’s a small community of about 50 families.

The activity he carries out is raising and selling animals.  He’s been doing this for ten years.  The business is home-based.  He learned it from his parents, that is, he knows it to perfection.  Income earned from these activities are used to cover family expenses.  He has competition but he also has a wide market to sell in.  In addition, he earns extra income from tasks related to agriculture.

He’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000 new sol loan to buy pigs and turkeys to sell later for Christmas.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys to sell for Christmas.

loans.name: Ciria Eufemia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Ciria, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, uno ya es mayor y tres de 16, 11 y 9  de edad los  mismos que estudian  dos en colegio y el menor en escuela, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es trabajador municipal.

Doña Ciria tiene una tienda en su casa en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes entre otras cosas, además de ciertos productos de basar y papelería que hace poco surtió y que también le está dejando buenos beneficios, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados de sus tareas. Tiene su tienda por más de 13  años y  fue con el primer crédito que hizo que empezó con su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y ciertos artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 13 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Quiroga” communal bank meets every two weeks in Quiroga Parish in the city of Calceta, a location where people for the most part work in agriculture, animal husbandry and selling their products.  Ciria, 40, lives here.  She’s married and has four children.   One of them is an adult already and the other three are 16, 11 and 9 years of age.  The older two attend secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.  All of them still live with her and her husband is a municipal employee.

Ciria has a store at home where she sells basic staples like rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among other things.  She also sells certain kitchen items and stationery supplies she stocked recently and which are also producing good profits.  She works every day from 6am until 9pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her when they aren’t busy with homework.  She’s had the store for more than 13 years and used her initial loan to start it.

She’s going to use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and certain kitchen items.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 13 years and likes it because she started her business with her initial loan.  Her goals are to stay in business so that it will grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mitzy

texts.es:
Mitzy, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Está casada con Carlos quien es empleado y padre de su único hijo Fabrizzio de 3 años de edad. Vive en compañía de su esposo, y su pequeño hijo, a los que quiere mucho, habitando su casa propia que lograron comprar gracias a bastante esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Mitzy es la venta de ropa y accesorios femeninos, para lo cual cuenta con una boutique que logró abrir en un espacio que acondiciono en su propia casa, de ésta manera  ahorra gastos de alquiler, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes. Ésta actividad la realiza hace más de 3 años y hasta el momento se dedica ella sola.
Le gusta  su actividad el poder tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces no les alcanzaba con el sueldo de empleado en una empresa privada, así como contar con tiempo libre para atender a su pequeño hijo.  Se siente a gusto al hacer lo que le gusta, y  sentirse una pequeña empresaria. Lo considera rentable por que ha logrado ganarse cliente regular y el tener una regular demanda, hace que cuente con ingresos permanentes, tiene planes de abrir otro negocio de venta de parrillas y comidas los sábados y domingos en sociedad con su madre. Este sería el  préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar con el apoyo de la institución, desea poder seguir contando con este apoyo, seguirá siendo puntual en sus pagos, así poder tener acceso a más préstamos.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos  soles, lo invertirá la mitad en la compra de ropa de diversos modelos traídos desde la capital,  y la otra mitad lo usará como capital de trabajo para su nuevo negocio de parrillas.
texts.en:
Mitzy, 27, is an enterprising and very hardworking woman.  She's married to Carlos, who's an employee and the father of her only child, Fabrizzio, age 3.  She lives with her husband and her young son, whom she loves a lot, in her own house, which they managed to buy with a lot of effort.

Mitzy's work is selling women's clothing and accessories in a boutique she opened in a space she set up in her house (so she saves on rent), where she very pleasantly waits on all her customers.  She has done this work for more than three years and up to the present she works alone.  She likes her work and being able to have an income to help her husband with the household expenses.  Sometimes his salary as an employee of a private business isn't enough.  She also likes to be able to have free time to take care of her young son.

She's comfortable doing what she likes, and she feels like a small business entrepreneur.  She considers it profitable because she has managed to attract regular customers and have regular demand, which gives her permanent income.  She plans to open another business, selling grilled food with her mother on Saturday and Sunday.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She's happy to be able to have the institution's help.  She wants to be able to continue having this support.  She'll continue being punctual with her payments so she'll have access to more loans.

With the requested loan of 3000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll use half to buy various styles of clothing in the capital and the other half as working capital for her new grilled food business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marita Rosario

texts.es:
Marita tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos dependientes, vive junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en una de las comunidades rurales que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical que se ha hecho conocida por dedicarse a exportar diversas frutas a otros países. Se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas y al alquiler de cabinas de internet, hace aproximadamente más de 2 años en un local que tiene acondicionado en su domicilio. Ella atiende al público todos los días y actualmente cuenta con clientela establecida siendo bastante conocida en la zona. Los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Marita se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería en abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc. para surtir su bodega.

Ella agradece de antemano a los prestamistas de Kiva que le apoyen en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Marita is 36 years old and married. She has three children who are independent. She lives with her husband and her underage children in one of the rural communities that comprise the rural district of Tambogrande. It's an area of tropical climate and it's known for exporting various types of fruit to other countries. It's located in the region of Piura.
Her business is selling groceries, beverages and snacks, and renting out internet booths. She has done this for over two years approximately, in a store she has set up in her house. She opens everyday and she currently has a well-established clientele. She's very well-known in the area. She uses the profits she gets from her business to help her husband support their family's finances.
Marita is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. It is for 700 nuevos soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as rice, sugar, olive oil, etc., in order to stock up her grocery store.
She gives thanks in advance to Kiva lenders for supporting her at this time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, olive oil, etc., in order to stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Isaias Smith

texts.es:
Isaías es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus familia, Isaías se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en alguna de estas ocasiones aprovechan la oportunidad para comer unos deliciosos Chicharrones de Chincha.
Por iniciativa propia con mucho empeño y dedicación, Isaías trabaja como obrero en una empresa de construcción de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Isaías se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, la cual utilizará para brindar servicios de transporte; de esta manera Isaías espera poder generar mayor ingresos económicos, los cuales le servir de mucho para poder culminar sus estudios profesionales, así pues Isaías seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Isaías, 21, lives in the city of Ica in Santiago District with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to his efforts and support from his family he’s studying a professional career.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and sometimes they take advantage of the opportunity to enjoy some delicious “Chicharrones de Chincha.” [fried pork with manioc]

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Isaías works as a laborer in a firm in his city.  He starts work every day very early and can work about 8 hours daily.  He thinks he does well because of the good way he works and the kind way he treats others.

Isaías is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy a mototaxi he’ll use to provide transportation services.  In this way, Isaías hopes to generate higher income that he can use to complete his professional studies and he can continue working and striving to get ahead and reach his dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin and his wife work hard to have a stable source of income. The couple has been blessed with only one child who is currently studying. Edwin raises hogs and has for more than three years up to this time. His goal is to increase his income so he can send his child into a higher level of education and so he can have a better way of living.

Edwin would like to borrow a loan of PHP20,000 which will be used to buy three piglets and hog feed for the daily maintenance of his hog-raising business. He and his wife are thankful to the lenders for their unending financial support which they provide to make his farming and livestock more profitable and productive. He knows that his goals in life will be obtained someday.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and hog feed for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin plans to improve the weight of his raised hogs to earn greater income.  But due to shortage of capital, he is seeking a loan amounting to PHP30,000.  This loan amount will be utilized by buying necessary feed and vitamins.  Some of it will be used for land preparation on his corn farm. 

Agustin is married and has been blessed with four children.  Three of his children are studying while his youngest child is still an infant.  He is thankful because his wife is supportive in making his corn field and hog raising business more profitable and a viable source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and to pay for maintenance of his corn farming business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 44 years old and a single parent with three children between the ages of 12 and 20. Two of the children stay with her in Airport, while the other child lives with his father.  For the past six years she has been selling imported ladies' blouses and dresses at the general market. She earns a profit because she sells items made from quality material and has a good interaction with her customers. She has requested a loan to purchase more imported ladies' blouses and dresses.  She hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more imported ladies' blouses and dresses.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pareja, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Mery no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de su madre, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mery trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de12 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Mery se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un mostrador y mercadería, tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, gaseosas, atún, golosinas, entre otros; de esta manera Mery tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poco a poco poder ampliar su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir sus sueños de tener su casa propia y un local de ventas propio en el centro de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Mery, 23, is a woman living in the city of Pisco with her life partner.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the need to work to cover her expenses, Mery was unable to study nursing like she wanted to but she would have liked to have done so very much.  In her free time she enjoys playing sports and sometimes cooks a delicious Duck with Rice to share with her family.

Thanks to her mother’s support and with much effort and dedication, Mery works in her small business selling groceries.  She starts work every day very early and can work about 12 hours daily.  She thinks she does well because of the variety of products and the kind customer service she provides.

Mery is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a display case and merchandise like rice, sugar, oil, milk, soft-drinks, tuna and snacks, among others.  In this way, Mery will have the business better-stocked and furnished.  She hopes this way to increase sales and income that will be very useful for her to gradually expand the business.  She will thus continue working and striving to reach her greatest dream of owning a house and a store of her own in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy a display case and groceries.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a twenty-eight year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the motorcycle business for three years.  He started by riding someone else's motorcycle and remitting 80% of the daily earnings to the owner.   Later, he bought his own motorcycle.  High fuel costs and license fees are his major challenge.  His dream is to have land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Elsa Irene

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 49 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tubo d trabajar desde muy joven para ayuda a sus padres, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo.   
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Elsa puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella asiste a su puesto en un pequeño mercado de su ciudad para realizar sus ventas, Elsa puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Elsa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de vivienda, ya que desea poder hacer tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de pisto de su habitación; de esta manera Elsa contará con un ambiente más adecuado, seguro, que le brinde mayor bienestar, así pues Elsa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y cumplir su sueño de terminar la construcción de su casa propia.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 49-year-old single woman.  She lives in the city of Ica.  She's a very pleasant, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a big desire to improve herself.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and having to work from a young age to help her parents, she wasn't able to study to be a nurse as she would have liked.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Elsa set up her small business selling fruits.  From an early hour every day she tends her stall in a small market in the city, working approximately 12 hours a day.  She thinks it's going well for her because of the friendly service she gives her customers.

Elsa's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to improve her house.  She wants to be able to plaster, paint, and put in the floor in her room.  This way Elsa will have a suitable and safe environment that will give her greater well-being.

Elsa will continue to work and make the effort to achieve her goals and realize her dream, to finish building her own house.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house

loans.name: Selmith

texts.es:
Selmith, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy alegre.  Es viuda y vive en compañía de sus tres hijos mayores de edad, más sus 05 nietos a los que quiere y engríe mucho.  Viviendo en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Selmith es la venta de ropas de diversas calidades y para todos los  gustos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, los cuales compra localmente en la ciudad  y en ocasiones trae a pedido de la capital, y los lleva  a vender en zonas alejadas de la ciudad, como caseríos ubicados a los márgenes del río, a donde realiza viajes cortos, siendo muy conocida por esas zonas, en la mayoría de los casos entrega a pedido.
Lleva dedicándose a ésta actividad hace más de 3 años, realizándolo en ocasiones por el apoyo y de algunos de sus hijos, que la acompañan en sus viajes por el río.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su actividad por tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos propios y darse algunos gustos, cómprales  regalos a sus nietos. Este sería el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, espera seguir contando con el apoyo de la institución, se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de 2600 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropas de diversos modelos y para todos los géneros, y comprará una máquina de coser valorizada en 500 nuevos soles para incursionar en la costura, además de materiales de costura.
texts.en:
Selmith is 60 years old. She is a fighting woman, hardworking and happy. She is a widow and lives with her three adult children, plus five grandchildren whom she loves and spoils. They are living in their own home.

Selmith sells clothing of various qualities and for all tastes, both women and men, and children, which she buys locally in the city and sometimes she brings an order from the capital, and takes them to sell in remote areas of the city, including some villages located along the river, where she makes short trips, being well known in these areas, the majority of times delivering an order.

She has been in this work for more than three years, doing it sometimes with the help of some of her children, who accompany her on the river trips. She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings it gives her.

She likes her work because she has an income with which she can support herself and give some pleasure to her grandchildren by buying them presents. This will be her sixth loan with MFP. She likes working with the communal bank, and hopes to continue counting on the support of the institution, promising to continue being punctual with her payments.

With the 2600 soles she has requested, she will fully invest it in buying various types of clothing and fabrics, she will buy a sewing machine valued at 500 soles in order to explore sewing, and sewing materials.

loans.use: to buy clothing and a sewing machine for her buiness

loans.name: German Salvador

texts.es:
El señor German Salvador esta soltero, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educacion secundaria, se dedica actualmente a ala tejeduría, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus familiares y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia. 

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varias clases y colores, y si mejorar su producción de tejidos, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y seguir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
German Salvador is a single 24-year-old man.  He is currently in college and supports himself through the activity of weaving.  He started this business with the support of his relatives and has six years of experience.

He is seeking a loan in order to buy yarn of various types and colors, and thereby improve his production of fabrics.  He hopes to have a large business in the future and continue to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 33, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joel, and a mother to her child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Mary Jane oversees the operation of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one jeepney with a capacity of 14 - 16 persons, which generates a boundary payment (a daily rental fee paid by the driver) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in her local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and to maintain the jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Jane dreams of giving her family a good life and hopes to give her child a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is now 49 years old and still practicing mixed crop farming. She has been in the farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 13,000 which she uses to support her family. She bought fertilizer and seedlings with the previous loan and her farm did well and made profit out of it. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. Susan will use the loan to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for use on the farm. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will support her grandchildren. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farmed produce.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is from the Gurjaani district of the Kakheti region. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children (5 and 9 years old). The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they own a vineyard and pick the grapes in the early autumn. Also, Luiza is running an animal husbandry business and has 3 pigs. The family sells grapes and piglets at the local market. Luiza works hard to ensure a good quality harvest and takes good care of her livestock.

She has requested credit for purchasing fuel for tilling the land, in order to get a good harvest of grapes next season. Also, part of the loan will be used for purchasing pigs. Luiza will keep the pigs in the shed, located in their yard, and raise and sell them in autumn for a higher price. This will significantly increase the family income and Luiza will reinvest the increased profit in expanding her animal husbandry business. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to cultivate her land for a good grape harvest and to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a twenty-seven-year-old single mother of three children living in Kasese,Uganda. For four years she has been operating a restaurant and is also a farmer. She faces challenges of inflation and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand.

She hopes to build a permanent house for residence and expand her business to new areas. Oliver is requesting a loan to buy additional food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Erita Argentina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Erita, tiene 51 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad y solo uno de ellos vive en su casa. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Erita es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado ganar su propio sustento a través de su trabajo, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de dulces en el centro de Calceta, trabaja junto al kiosco que tiene su marido, él se dedica a vender ricos refrescos de varios sabores, ella tiene una vitrina donde ofrece sus productos que son muy solicitados en especial por las personas que viajan a otras ciudades. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 17h00, los dulces los compra en Junín. Ella lleva más de 25 años con su negocio y le gusta porque siempre está junto a su querido esposo.

Este crédito lo va a compartir la mitad para comprar dulces para su negocio y la otra parte para el negocio de  su marido para que compre frutas y jarabe para los refrescos. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es gozar de salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
In the Quiroga district of the city of Calceta, the majority of people work in agriculture, farming, raising animals and selling their goods in town. The Quiroga Community Bank is located in the Quiroga district, and the group members meet every 15 days.

Erita is 51 years old, and lives in Quiroga. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are now grown, and one of whom lives at home. Erita's husband is a merchant. 

Erita is a very hardworking woman who has always held a job because she likes earning her own salary and supporting her family. She makes a living operating a small business selling sweets at a stand in the city center of Calceta. Her stand is right next to her husband's stand, where he sells a wide range of refreshing beverages. Her most frequent customers are those people who are traveling to nearby cities. Erita works seven days a week, from 7:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon, and she buys her merchandise in Junín. She has over 25 years of experience in her trade, and enjoys her work, especially because she gets to work alongside her beloved husband.

With the support from this loan, Erita plans to purchase merchandise to stock her business as well as her husband's business, so that he can buy syrup and fruit for making his juices and beverages.
