Erita has been a member of the Community Bank for three years now, and she is grateful for the support she has received there. Her dream is to stay healthy and happy so that she can keep working.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, sweets and syrup.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar is 45 years old and lives with his wife in their 3-room apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has worked in a steel factory in Darkhan for 9 years. He has 2 daughters who study at the university. His wife works as a cashier in the Central Post office. Their apartment is old -- it was built in the Soviet era and needs some repairs. His daughters' education is very important to him. That’s why he paid all of his saved money for their university tuition. 

He also wants to live in a comfortable apartment. He needs to improve his living conditions. He is asking for a 5.000.000 MNT loan to set a parquet floor, double-glazed windows and to change the wallpaper.

loans.use: to set a parquet floor and double-glazed windows and to replace the wallpaper in his apartment.

loans.name: Metrine Nasimiyu

texts.en:
Metrine's baby is now a ten-month-old baby. She still runs a beauty salon and cosmetic shop which has been doing well thus her additional monthly income. She started this business six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES42,000. 

She wants to purchase hair weaves, hair oil and gels, hair conditioners and shampoo and has requested a second loan of KES60,000. She will use the profit to open more branches of her business. 

Metrine dreams of being a great entrepreneur in the future and seeing her children get the best education.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, hair oil and gels, hair conditioners and shampoos for her salon.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 19-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and living with his parents and two siblings. His youngest sibling is the one cooperating with him to cover the family’s household expenses and take some responsibilities off of their father. Khoder has owned a car-washing shop since 2008. He started his business at an early age because of the bad life conditions they experienced. He provides his customers with good services in order to build an excellent relationship with them. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added cleaning tools and supplies to expand his business, in addition to a special machine to clean wheels. He notes that this will improve his work therefore his returns. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans to develop his business and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase added cleaning tools and supplies to expand his business, in addition to a special machine to clean wheels.

loans.name: Reynald

texts.en:
Reynald is a 33-year-old married man from Albur, Bohol. He has two children, ages four and five years old respectively. He is engaged in tuba (coconut wine) vending. He has been in the tuba vending business for eight years.

He has requested a loan of 22,000 to buy empty containers or gallons and tungog (mangrove tanbark: the dried bark of a certain kind of mangrove tree). It would help the natural fermentation in producing bahal (old tuba) and the bahalina (aged tuba). Reynald would like to expand his business by investing in other ventures to support his family as well as to save for the education of his children for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy empty containers or gallons and tungog (mangrove bark).

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and living with his wife, Manle, the mother of his three children who are still attending school. He is the one looking to satisfy the family needs and respond to their demands. Hussein started his own business in the year 2000. He works independently in the construction field and has more than a few projects to be accomplished. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required construction equipment in addition to a new cement machine that will allow him to carry on his work properly. Hussein is sure that in a short period of time he will be able to gain great experience and move out of the country, taking bigger projects with higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase required construction equipment in addition to a new cement machine.

loans.name: Laon

texts.en:
Laon is 45 years old and married. He supports a family of seven children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last nine years with a monthly income of KES. 40,000. 

He is servicing his second loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate the preparation of his farm and purchase of inputs. He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dream is to improve the family's living standards and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare the farm for planting.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a Lebanese single man. He is 26 years old. He is living with his one parent and four siblings who are all working. He seeks to manage his family’s life with the cooperation of his siblings. This is the reason why they are all working really hard to afford heavy life expenses. Four years ago, Bashir started his independent business. He has opened a cafe in his town where he sells popcorn, chocolate, soft drinks and of course coffee. He has his own and loyal customers who always meet at his place to have fun and enjoy their time. 

With his requested youth loan of Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l he will be able to purchase a new espresso machine for his café in addition to many other goods. This will increase the number of his customers and most probably his revenues. One of his greatest dreams is to collect money and make needed savings, especially if he might get married in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new espresso machine for his café in addition to many other goods.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is from the village of Kardenakhi of Kakheti region. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 19-year-old son. Lali works as a music teacher at the local village and gets a monthly salary. Besides her main job, she is involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, she produces Churchkhela (Traditional Georgian sausage-shaped candies, produced with grape must, flour and threaded nuts onto a string) and sells them at the local open market. In addition, Lali’s husband has a tractor and serves to local farmers to get a service fee for the job. 

Nowadays, the tires of the tractor are damaged and he is forced to stop the operations. Lali has requested a loan to purchase new tires for the tractor. After the tires are purchased, her husband will continue working and this will significantly increase the family income. With the increased income, Lali will improve the living conditions for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for the tractor

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old, married and has six children. She is a farmer and also owns a retail shop. She has been farming for the last ten years and she is very active. She learned how to save through the help of Faulu Kenya.

She wishes to be financially stable and also own a big retail shop. She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy ten bags of maize and farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and ten bags of maize.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is a 38 year old widow with two children living in Masindi –Uganda. She operates a photo studio and with the money earned she has been able support her family. She also gets an allowance since she is a political leader in her village. Her business is located on a busy street to easily attract customers. Jolly’s dream is to educate her children and set up a modern studio despite challenges of inadequate capital. She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Hien was born in 1958. She has three children who have gotten married. She and her husband sells groceries in a market to earn a living. Hien also collects metal scraps to make more money. She makes 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 dong (VND) per month. 
	
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 dong (VND) and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy beverages, canned food, biscuits, and candies for selling in her store. Her dream is to enlarge her grocery store.
	Other members which are part of Hien's Group include the following:
	 Xuyen has six children. She is a farmer. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy chicken feed. 
	 Duyen has three children. She raises pigs and sews clothes to earn a living. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to raise pigs for selling.
	 Tam has two children. She is a carpenter. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to learn more carpentry.
	 Tam has three children. She is a farmer who raises cattle. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy food for buffalo and cows.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned food, biscuits, and candies for selling in her store.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en: Calixta is a 62 year old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She is engaged in basket weaving. She earns three thousand PHP a month from basket weaving. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase wicker - (is a hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture). Wicker is often made of material of plant origin, but plastic fibers are also used, and palm. In the future, Calixta would like to expand her business by investing in other ventures to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy palm and wicker

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en: Raghida is a 32 year old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two children. In 2008, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own business. She produces a wide variety of homemade food which she sells to customers from her town and the neighboring villages. Her husband, who works in transporting vegetables all over the villages, represents the main income source of the family. Raghida offers support whenever needed. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to cover her children’s study fees. She states that the loan will allow them to achieve higher educational levels. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans in order to better support her children.

loans.use: to cover her children’s study fees

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mayra  tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, reside en compañía de su esposo y 2 de sus hijos en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de pimienta, Departamento de Cortés.
Mayra se ha dedicado a realizar oficios domésticos en su hogar. 
Hace 8 años que decidió contribuir  con su familia económicamente, estableciendo un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica, tal es el caso que actualmente ella cuenta con un mini mercado donde ofrece a sus clientes: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, variedad de pan, carnes, lácteos, abarrotería, golosinas y cosméticos.
Con el propósito de captar una mayor cantidad de clientes, ha solicitado  un préstamo por la cantidad 28,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de medicinas para enfermedades comunes, carnes,  lácteos,  embutidos, productos de limpieza, útiles escolares, refrescos y cosméticos.
Ella tiene la meta de fortalecer su negocio, ya que con las utilidades piensa preparar académicamente a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Mayra is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her husband and two of her children in an urban community of the Pimienta municipality in the department of Cortés.

Mayra takes care of the domestic chores in her home. Eight years ago she decided to help her family financially and started a business selling basic needs products. This is how she now has a minimart where she offers her customers rice, sugar, a variety of breads, meat, dairy products, groceries, sweets, and cosmetics. 

With the goal of gaining more customers, she has requested a loan for 28,000 Lempiras. She thinks she will use it to purchase medicines for common illnesses, meats, dairy products, sausages, cleaning products, school supplies, beverages, and cosmetics. Her goal is to strengthen her business because she wants to use the profits to prepare her children academically.

loans.use: to supply her business with medicines for common illnesses, meat, dairy products, sausages, cleaning products, school supplies, drinks, and cosmetics.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old, married and supports a family of five people. He is a maize farmer for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

He is servicing a second loan of KES. 25,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to purchase farm implements. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of soft drinks and other products like wheat flour, rice,  and sugar

loans.name: Viet's Group

texts.en:
Viet was born in 1986. He has a child who is 14 months old. His wife is a worker. Viet drives a taxi to earn a living. He makes 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month from it. His family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 dong (VND) per month. 
	
He has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the first cycle he would like to borrow 5,014,000 dong (VND) to buy his own taxi. His dream is to provide a good living for his family.
	
Other members which are part of Viet's group include the following: 
	  
Khanh is 36 years old. She has two children. She sells vegetables to earn a living. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 dong (VND) to buy vegetables for selling. 
	 
Ca is 55 years old. She has two children. She sells fresh fish to earn a living. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 dong (VND) to buy gas stove to cook fish.
	 
Van Anh is 26 years old. She has two children. She sells clothes for a living. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 dong (VND) to buy more clothes for selling.
	 
Thao is 24 years old. She has a child. She is a farmer. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 dong (VND) to buy food for chicken.

loans.use: to buy his own taxi.

loans.name: Banora

texts.en: Banora is a fifty one year old widow living in Kasese,Uganda. She has been farming for over twenty years and in order to get more money she has set up a stall in the market where she sells her output directly to consumers. Like most farmers she has the challenges of unpredictable weather which can lead to low yields and lack of appropriate preservation. She hopes to buy land, build a house and expand her business to new areas. Banora did not get enough output this season due to a prolonged drought and is unable to adequately supply her loyal consumers and thus has to buy from other farmers so as not to lose her customers. Banora is requesting a loan to buy cabbages, tomatoes, maize and other vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and maize (corn) to sell.

loans.name: M'thuranira

texts.en:
M'thuranira is aged seventy three. He is a  farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his wife. He has six children who have all cleared school. He has been in farming for over thirty years producing potatoes, milk and cereals that he sells to the people around his locality.

He is requesting for 30,000 KES loan from juhudi kilimo for purchasing poultry. From selling them he will earn extra income that will help improve his livelihood. He plans to have an incubator in the next five years that will help him have higher scale production .

High costs of feed and pesticides are his major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1976. She has two children, who are learning at secondary school. Her husband and she make and sell traditional Vietnamese popcorn in a market to earn a living. Dung makes 3,000,000 dong (VND) a month from this. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 dong (VND) per month.
 
Dung has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 dong (VND) and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy corn to explode popcorn. Her dreams are to open a popcorn workshop, and that her children grow up well.

Other members who are part of Dung's Group include the following:

Hien was born in 1971. She has two children. She is a vegetable supplier. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy and sell vegetables. 

Hong was born in 1967. She has five children. She sells fresh fruits to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy fruits from a wholesale market to resell.

Hien was born in 1990. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to raise pigs to earn more money.

Bay was born in 1969. She has two children. She is a fresh fruit supplier. She would like to borrow 5,152,000 dong (VND) to buy fruits from a wholesale market, which she will resell.

loans.use: to buy corn to explode traditional Vietnamese popcorn.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a married lady, 28 years old. She and her husband have four children aged 13, 10, 7 and 5 years. She keeps livestock in their farm and has been in operation for a period of six years, earning an income of 12,000 monthly.

She is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of 50,000 KES. She repaid the previous loan successfully.  She intends to use this new loan amount to purchase additional livestock to keep in the farm.  

She will use her profits to satisfy the needs of her family. She wishes to live a bright future with her family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 32-year-old, married woman, mother of two children, living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and sells charcoal to earn a living. She has challenges, including high rent, poor storage facilities, and price fluctuations. Notwithstanding these challenges, she has dreams to build a permanent house, to expand business to new areas, and to buy land for farming. Christine is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise, such as salt and sugar, to resell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as salt and sugar, to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, who is now 54 years old, used his previous loan to buy seedlings and animal feed. His business did well and he has managed to repay his previous loan. He has grown tremendously and has saved his money through Faulu Kenya. 

He dreams of having a herd of six dairy cows and becoming an established farmer. He needs a loan of 42,727.50 KES to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is a single mother of three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). She has a retail shop selling cosmetics and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 1500000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of weaves, braids, cream relaxers and Vaseline. She sells to all categories of people, but at retail prices. She works seven days out of every week and works in a shop which she rents. 

Her major business challenges include electricity, defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics In Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked cosmetics shop and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and electricity.

loans.use: to buy more Vseline, cream relaxer, braids, and boxes of weaves.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira, 35 years old, is married and has four children, all of them in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past five years, she has been selling coconuts at retail from her home. Thanks to her experience, she currently has a lot of customers, which permits her to have good sales. She also knows where to go to get good coconuts at low prices in order to sell them later.

Subira is looking for a loan in order to buy more coconuts and thus face the season with a good inventory. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich was born in 1965. She has two children who are employed, one as a worker and the other as a car repairer.  Bich and her husband collect metal scraps to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy and collect more metal scraps to recycle. She always wants to enlarge her workshop.

loans.use: to buy and collect more metal scraps to recycle.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is responsible for looking after her 3 children. She operates a phone accessory shop and the business has enabled her to meet her basic needs and those of her family.

Due to the current campaign for digital migration and evolving technology, the business is lucrative.  There are challenges of theft and high license fees levied by the local authorities.  Annet has personal goals of educating her children up to the university level and expanding her business to new areas. Annet is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yannina Fernanda

texts.es:
Yannina es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una joven muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Yannina se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yannina trabaja como asistente en una empresa auditora de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yannina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de laptop, la cual le servirá de mucho para realizar sus trabaos académicos y laborales, así pues Yannina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Yannina is a 19 years old, single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic young woman who has a huge desire to succeed thanks to the efforts and support of her family. Yannina is currently studying to become an accountant. 

In her spare time she likes to distract herself by watching TV and sometimes she will cook a delicious lomo salteado [traditional Peruvian meat dish] to enjoy with her family. 

With a lot of effort and determination, Yannina works as an assistant at an auditing firm in her city. She starts her work day early every morning. She works approximately ten hours a day. She believes it is going well due to good performance and she is treated well by everyone. 

Yannina is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help she will be able to buy a laptop, which will help her with her studies as well as her job. This way she can keep working and striving to achieve her dream to be a successful professional and run her own business.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy vive en casa propia sola; sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, tiene un puesto de ventas en la zona Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz, ella se dedica a la venta de calzados para niños, con esta actividad ella se mantiene y cubre todas sus necesidades.

El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (compra de calzados).

Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente buena en el pago se sus cuotas. Fue parte de Kiva en tres oportunidades.

Su sueño fue tener un puesto fijo y lo logró, ahora quiere expandir sus ventas a diferentes departamentos.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy lives alone in her own house. Her children are grown and independent. She has a vending stall in the District of Gran Poder in the city of La Paz. Nancy sells children’s shoes and her business enables her to support herself and pay for all of her necessities. This loan will be used as investment capital for buying shoes.

This is the 12th time she has requested a loan from IMPRO. Her credit history qualifies her as a good client since she has a done well with her payments. She has had three opportunities to participate with Kiva.

Her dream is to have an established vending post and was able to achieve it. Now she wants to expand her sales to various departments.

loans.use: to buy more children's shoes.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Mrs. Bolormaa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in an apartment in Han-Uul district, Mongolia. Her husband, Munhbaatar, works as an electrician in a private company. Her daughter, Bilguun, is a college student. Mrs Bolormaa has been working at a food retail business on a rental stall since 2010.  She is planning to open her own food retail business and purchase her own stall instead of renting it. She is a hardworking and diligent person. She needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase inventories to sell at retail price.

loans.use: To purchase inventories to sell at retail price

loans.name: Felicita Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Felicita, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad y una hija vive en su casa. Su esposo es jubilado.
 
Doña Felicita es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, vende productos de la marca Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cuatro días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella enseña su revista para que sus clientes escojan lo que necesitan, deja a crédito y cobra en dos o  tres cuotas de acuerdo a como lo prefieran sus clientes. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y las cremas, lleva en este negocio ya 5 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos de belleza. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben tanto ella como sus compañeras. 

Sus sueños son tener una boutique y llegar a ser directora de Yanbal.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Quiroga meets every fifteen days in the Quiroga parish of the town Calceta, where the people largely dedicate themselves to agriculture, raising animale, and selling their products.

This is where Felicita, who is fifty-seven years old, married, and has three older children and a little daughter live in their home. Her husband is retired.

Felicita is a housewife who dedicates herself to sales in order to obtain her own income. She sells Yanbal brand products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works four days a week and sells door-to-door. She shows her catalog so her clients can pick out what they need. She leaves a loan and covers two or three of the fees as her clients prefer. What she sells most are the perfumes and creams. She already has managed her business for five years and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other beauty products. She is a founding partner of the Communal Bank and also its president. She likes it because it it provides so much help for her friends and herself.

Her dream is to have a boutique and become the director of Yanbal.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Saviour

texts.en: Saviour is a 34-year-old married man with 3 children aged 2, 4 and 5 living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in buying and selling produce like maize, beans and millet. He is also a civil servant and earns a monthly salary. With the money he earns, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land. Price fluctuation and the seasonal nature of the product are his major challenges. Like all good fathers, he dreams of seeing his children graduate from university and have a sustainable income generating activity such as housing estates. Saviour intends to use the loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Airport. She is 26 years old and single with a 5-year-old child who is in school. Ruth stopped her education at 9th grade. For the past eight years, she has been selling rubber dishes in her community. Ruth says she spends most of her time with her business since her business helps to sustain them. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (plates, bowls, cups) for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (plates, bowls, cups) for her business.

loans.name: Bintu B.

texts.en:
Bintu B. is 34 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have three children between the ages of 14 and 26, who live at home and are currently in school.

For the past six years she has been selling fashion clothes in the local market. She started this business by selling on a table in front of her house with 1,000 LRD that she received from her fiancee. Her profits are used on food and school fees. She is happy with her business because the business helps her and her family. Most interestingly, she was able to buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan to purchase fashion clothes (blouses, jeans and trousers) for her business. She plans to expand her business, help her children, and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fashion clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his family.

He has a grocery store in his home which he runs himself. His store sells baked goods, soft drinks, cleaning products and foodstuffs.

Thanks to this business, he and his family have moved forward in life and can support their household and pay for any unforeseen expenses.

With the loan, he wishes to expand his business by purchasing inventory in order to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, soft drinks, cleaning products and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is 23 years old, single and lives in Airport with two children aged 4 and 9 who are in school. She has been selling body cream, powder and soap for the past five years now, and learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, powder and soap for her business. She enjoys her business because it makes her independent. In the near future, she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, powder and soap for her business.

loans.name: Flerida Aracely

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar vive la señora Flerida, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 12 y de 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Flerida realiza el crédito tanto para su negocio como para el negocio de su esposo, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende helados Pingüino, colas, jugos y ciertos bocadillos de picar, mientras que  su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y porcino, ella tiene más de 13 años con su negocio y con los créditos  ha podido mejorarlo conforme ha ido pasando el tiempo, en la actualidad ha comprado varias mesas y sillas donde sus clientes llegan a servirse y esto gracias a los créditos que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más helados, sodas y ganado para el negocio del esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 11 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local en el centro de la ciudad de Calceta.
texts.en:
The parish of Quiroga, in the city of Calceta, is a place where many people work in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.  The Quiroga Communal Bank meets here every fifteen days.
 
This is where Mrs. Flerida lives.  She is 33 years old and married.  She and her spouse have three children, aged 13, 12 and 2.  The oldest two are in school.  Her spouse is a merchant.
 
Mrs. Flerida is requesting the loan both for her business and for her spouse's business.  She has a business in her house, from which she sells Pingüino ice cream, colas, juice and snacks.  Her spouse buys and sells cattle and pigs.  Mrs. Flerida has had her business for more than 13 years, and with the loans, she has been able to improve it over time.  Now, thanks to the loans she received from the bank, she has bought various tables and chairs where her customers come to be served.
 
This loan will be used to pay for more ice cream, sodas and livestock for her spouse’s business.  Mrs. Flerida has been in the communal bank for more than 11 years, and she likes it because she has been able to improve her business with the loans.
 
Her dream is to have a business in the center of Calceta.

loans.use: To pay for ice cream, sodas and livestock.

loans.name: Hospecia

texts.en: Hospecia is a 50 year old, married woman from Antequera,Bohol. She has five children. She is engaged in basket weaving. She sells native baskets. She has been in the basket weaving for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more materials for weaving, like wicker (hard, woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture. Wicker is often made of material of plant origin, but plastic fibers are also used), and nito (palm). In the future, Hospecia would like to augment to other business ventures to support her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to weave more baskets to sell.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married and 40 years old. She has two children.

She started a food stall business four years ago. She has had a regular flow of customers to sustain her business.

She is requesting a loan of Ksh 50,000 to purchase some ingredients like wheat flour, maize flour, oils, etc. Salama hopes that her business will expand to support the needs of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some ingredients like wheat flour, maize flour, oils, etc

loans.name: Jacklen

texts.en:
Jacklen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Jacklen is a 54-year-old woman. She is a housewife and a mother to one son. Her husband earns a pension which is low and not enough to cover the family's need.
Jacklen wants to offer better house living conditions to her family, so she is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a refrigerator which the family will use for preserving food at their house. Taking this loan will create healthy and suitable living conditions for Jacklen and her family. 


About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: Buy refrigerator for home use

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en: Dzame lives with her husband and two children. She runs a fish selling business, a business that she has been running for the last four years. The business is open to the public from 2pm until 8pm. Her advantage is the good location she has. She’s requesting a loan to buy more stock of fish for sell.  Dzame's goal is to improve her family’s living condition, to prosper with the business and to be able to overcome any problem that arises at home

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 54, lives with her life companion and their children. She has a small store where she sells basic necessities such as grain, flour, eggs, bread, soap, and other items. Fatuma has been in business for several years and has gained valuable experience that has been useful in obtaining more income. She sells from her home and already has many customers who prefer to do business with her because she offers quality products, affordable prices, and excellent service. Fatuma is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and has many goals that she wants to accomplish.

Currently, she wants to increase her inventory but she does not have enough capital to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can buy basic grains, snacks, instant products, flour, beverages, soap, and other items.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Inaem

texts.en:
Inaem is from northern Israel. After high school, she received her bookkeeping certification and has worked for many years as a part-time bookkeeper’s assistant. While she does her job well and is respected, the salary is minimum and comes nowhere to meeting her family’s income needs. Now that her children are grown and beginning their own families, Inaem was determined to create a microenterprise and ensure a secure economic future. She wanted to make sure she and her husband not only get by every month but can live with dignity and help their children. Inaem studied cosmetology and took certification courses. Earlier this year she opened a cosmetics salon in her home. The salon has a separate entrance, which allows her to keep costs low, since the business is located in her home, but ensure privacy with the separate entrance. She has gained a strong reputation for professional treatments with high quality products at competitive prices.

Inaem needed this loan to purchase a high frequency cosmetic device, an epilator, steamer, treatment bed, and a cosmetics and material cart.

Inaem continues to work as a bookkeeper's assistant. She applies her professionalism and knowledge to develop her microenterprise. One day Inaem wants to open a complete cosmetics salon.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sr. De Qoyllority Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Sr. de Qoyllorty” en la comunidad de Muñapata del distrito de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. (La comunidad de Muñapata se encuentra ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco). Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios por ejemplo; crianza de animales menores, venta de leña, venta de comestibles, venta de miel, venta de cosméticos y venta de comida. 

(La señora Flora está levantando la mano en la fotografía). 
Flora vive en la comunidad de Muñapata donde realiza diferentes tipos de actividades. Una de sus actividades económica principales es la crianza de animales menores y la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Flora requiere el préstamo para mercadería como sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz por lo parte tambien comprara animales menores como cuyes. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank “Sr. De Qoyllority” which is located in the community of Muñapata in the District of Urcos, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco. The community of Muñapata is located 35 minutes away from the city of Cusco. The members have worked together as a Communal Bank for several years and are well-organized. They view each moment as an opportunity to move forward, so they strive each day to provide a better future for their children. The members participate in business activities such as raising small animals, selling firewood, selling food products, selling honey, selling cosmetics, and selling meals.

In the photograph, Sra. Flora is the woman with her hand raised. She lives in the community of Muñapata and engages in different business activities. Among her main business activities are raising small animals and selling basic necessities. She has been in business for several years and has done very well. Flora is taking this opportunity to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar. She will also buy small animals, such as guinea pigs.

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been given to them and promise to complete their respective payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar, as well as guinea pigs to raise.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha  48, is a mother of five children, married and living at West Point. Her children are between the ages of 19 and 31. Three of her children are independent, while the other two stay with her at home, and are attending school. Martha has a table in her community where she has sold rice, pepper, onions, vita, palm oil, cooking oil, and tomatoes for the past eight years. She makes a profit when she sells because she is the only one that has a food market in the community. She is proud of her business because with the profits she can buy more goods, and pay the educational expenses of her children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, vita, and palm oil to increase her sales. Her plan is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nanzugu

texts.en:
Nanzugu sells fish. She lives with her family, that is made up of her husband and five children. She learned her business from her aunt before she was married and she works everyday of the week. One of her advantages is that she already has a customer base. A risk that she encounters is climate change.

She needs a loan to buy fresh product: fish, as well as cooking oil for frying her fish before she sells it from her home. Nanzugu hopes to improve her family life by providing stability, and in the future to open a kiosk.

loans.use: to buy fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 64 years old, married and has four children. She is a farmer who sells poultry and farm produce of mangoes and oranges. She has been farming for the last twelve years. She is very hardworking, and since she became a client of Faulu Kenya she has improved her living standards.
She hopes to be a main supplier of fruits in the surrounding towns and institutions through the financial support of Faulu Kenya. She needs 100,000 KES to buy chicks, chick mash, and pesticides for the mango and oranges trees.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chick mash, and pesticides for the mango and orange trees.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son and one daughter.

Elena lives in Biet Lahia district near to Jabalia Refugee Camp. Elena and her husband are planning to have their own project: to purchase a taxi to transport passengers from one area to another. Elena and her husband have an amount of money which is not enough to cover all the costs. So she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her, and her husband, complete the purchase of the taxi that her husband will drive. This will offer Elena's husband a stable project and create a profitable income source, which will improve the family's income positively.

Elena is photographed next to the taxi.

loans.use: to complete the purchase of a the taxi.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gaby como de cariño le dicen es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable paltica que ha pasado por varias situaciones dificiles Gaby tiene 33 años de edad es una mujer separada, con su actual pareja formo una familia con dos niños. Gaby tiene un club de productos herbalife, lleva teimpo ya en la actividad y la inicio porque fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de un club estonces le parecio muy buena idea y fue como empezo a incorporase a un club tomando charlas, capacitaciones etc. Hace unos meses que finalmente intalo su local en San Felipe del Progreso, esta vez esta solicitando un credito a la institucion para comprar de Té, Aloes y malteadas para su venta, platica que le gusta mucho su atender a sus clientes y mas que nada que ayudarlos porque para eso se fundo Herbalife para ayudar a las personas.platicaq ue no tiene ninguna dificulatad para la venta de sus productos aunque le gustaria tener mas clientes llegar a 100 para poder tener una vida mas comoda para ella y para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gaby, as she is affectionately known, says that she is a hardworking and responsible woman who has gone through many difficult situations. She is 33 years old and separated from her spouse. Gaby and her current partner have their own family with two children. She formed an Herbalife club and spends time in this business. Gaby started her business after a friend invited her to join a club and at that point she thought that it would be a good idea. She formed her own club after attending seminars, training sessions, and other events. A few months ago, she finally opened her shop in San Felipe del Progresso.

Gaby is now requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad so that she can buy teas, aloe vera, and shake mixes to sell. She says that she greatly enjoys serving her customers, but most of all, she wants to help them since Herbalife was founded on the premise of helping people. Gaby says that she has not had any difficulty with selling her products. She would like to reach more customers so that she can get to the 100-mark, since this would allow her and her children to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of Herbalife products.

location.town: El Tunal San Felipe del Progreso.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Airport, is 22 years old, and single. She has an eight year old child, who is in school and at home. For the past five years, she has been selling body cream, powder, spry, and soap in the local market. She is thankful to God for the financial output for her child. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, powder, spry, and soap for her business. Her plans are to educate her child and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, powder, spry, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 46 year old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has six children.The eldest child is twenty, while the youngest is four. She is engaged in basket weaving. She sells native baskets made of buri (palm). She earns four thousand pesos a month by doing the basket weaving. She has been in the basket weaving business for twelve years.

Flora requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchased materials like buri (palm), and wicker (hard woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture. Wicker is often made of material of plant origin, but plastic fibers are also used). In the future, Flora would like to invest in other ventures to improve their status of living, and also to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy buri and wicker.

loans.name: Julio Apolonio

texts.es:
Don Julio, es de la comarca la Cruz, Teustepe casado tuvo 5 hijos con su esposa, los que ya están casados .Él se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde que tenía 15 años. Lo que cultiva  lo vende en mazorca para hacer güirilas (tortilla hecha de maíz dulce) o elotes cosidos dice que así se vende a mejor precio. Las tierras donde cultiva le fueron dadas por el gobierno para realizar las labores de siembra lo hace con ayuda de un mozo y la cosecha la vende en la misma comarca.  
Hoy  Julio necesita este crédito para comprar el abono  y pagar el arado del terreno para sembrar el maíz. El crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá sembrar el maíz y comprar todos los insumos y el abono para obtener buen rendimiento.  También dice que este año que viene quiere diversificar la producción con la siembra de chile.
texts.en:
Don Julio is from the region of La Cruz, Teustepe. He and his wife have five children, all of whom are married.

Julio has been growing corn and beans for 15 years. What he produces is sold in Mazorca for making “güirilas” (tortillas made from sweet corn) or roasted corn on the cob. He says that is able to sell for the best price. The land that he cultivates was given to him by the government for the planting he accomplishes with the help of an assistant and for the harvested crops that he sells in the same region.

Today Julio needs a loan so that he can buy compost and pay to have his land plowed for planting corn. This loan will be a great help since he will be able to plant corn and buy all the supplies and compost needed to obtain a good result. He says that he also wants to diversify his production this year by planting chile peppers.

loans.use: to buy compost and to pay to have his land plowed.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Desde que tenía 10 años Pascual se ha dedicado a la producción de café y fue su padre quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para que pudiera llevar a cabo esta actividad. Pascual es soltero y viven con él 3 sobrinos quienes le ayudan a realizar los trabajos necesarios en su finca de café. a Pascual le gustaría cambiar su producción de café convencional a café orgánico con la ayuda de los asesores de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco”. Para la siguiente cosecha él necesita un crédito para poder pagar a los trabajadores que contratará. Entre los planes que Pascual tiene están el de resembrar parte de su terreno pues las plantas con que cuenta ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida productivo. También tiene otro terreno sin sembrar y le gustaría utilizarlo también para producir café y así aumentar su producción. Además del café Pascual también produce maíz y limón. Pasando la cosecha a Pascual le gustaría hacer una presa en su terreno para las épocas de sequía.
texts.en:
Since the age of 10, Pascual has engaged in coffee production. It was his father who taught him everything he needed to know so that he could carry out this activity. Pascual is single and lives with three nephews who help him with the necessary tasks around his coffee farm. He was able to switch from growing conventional coffee to organic coffee with the help of the consultants from Unión Regional de Huatusco.

For the following month, Pascual needs a loan so that he can pay the workers he plans to hire. He intends to replant a portion of his land since the existing crops have completed their productive life cycle. He also has another plot of land that is untouched, so he would like to make use of it for growing coffee so that he can increase his production.

In addition to coffee, Pascual grows corn and lemons. When he is not working the land, Pascual would like create a stock pond on his property for periods of drought.

loans.use: to hire workers for planting coffee.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Yeredon  ont  en moyenne 44 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente  de condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, Abi  (1ere personne debout avec foulard bleu clair) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 200 kg d’oignons frais 3 sacs de sel 5 paquets de maggi    auprès des demi gros a Kimparana. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Abi espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women who compose the Yeredon group are all married in extended traditional families. On average, they are 44 years old and have seven children each. They all live in a village called Niazekan, located in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, marriage and kinship.  They buy and sell condiments.

In order to boost their businesses, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first solidarity loan.

Abi, first from the left and wearing a light blue scarf, is planning to use her loan to buy 200 kg of fresh onions, three bags of salt and five boxes of maggi bouillon cubes from semi-wholesalers in Kimparana. 

She sells for cash, from her home, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

Abi is expecting average monthly profits from this loan to reach 12,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity and also used to meet the needs of the household.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Estrellas De Sajama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE SAJAMA”  iniciará el trigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Cascada, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de centro, venta de libros, venta de masitas y empanadas, venta de dulces, venta de refrescos, venta de café, venta de cereales, tejido de macramé, venta de abarrotes, venta de rellenos, taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un familiar que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de preparación y comercialización de masitas; cuenta que este negocio lo inicio cobn la venta de galletas hace años, posteriormente aprendió a realizar algunas masitas mismas que fueron éxito en su negocio y para especializarse en esta área fue a un instituto a diversificar su comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de herramienta (compra de batidora) que adquirirá de las personas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo implementará en su negocio para la elaboración de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el préstamo sin garantía y consultorio.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas de Sajama" Communal Bank will begin its thirty-second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Regional Office. It is made up of twelve members led by a board of directors with Ana serving as president. The communal bank's members support themselves with a variety of businesses, including sewing petticoats, book sales, sale of "masitas" [small savory pastries in a variety of flavors] and "empanadas" [savory stuffed pastries], candy sales, juice sales, coffee sales, grain sales, macramé-making, grocery sales, sale of "rellenos" [stuffed mashed potato fritters], and a sewing workshop.

The loan that the group will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs like Ana. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago, having been invited by a relative who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business preparing and selling masitas. She says that she started this business years ago by selling cookies. Later, she learned to make some masitas, which were a hit in her business. To specialize in that area, she took classes to diversify her sales.

The loan that she will now take out is for the purchase of equipment—like a mixer—that she will buy from wholesale sellers and then set up in her business for the preparation of her products. Her work allows her to generate income to support herself and her family economically, since she is a single mother of one son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the collateral-free loans and the advice.

loans.use: to buy an electric mixer.

loans.name: Chicas Inolvidables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHICAS INOLVIDABLES”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de quinua, venta de ropa, producción de papa, venta de verduras y frutas, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que trabaja en la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción y venta de quinua; cuenta que este negocio lo ejerce hace años, emprendiendo el mismo con una asociación comunitaria que comercializa dicho producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la cosecha lo comercializará al exterior. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella está casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Chicas Inolvidables" (Unforgettable Girls) will begin its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro-Woman) as part of a central focus in Patacamaya. It is composed of nine workers and is directed by a board of directors where Juana is president. The businesses that move the the communal association workers forward are diverse, including the sale of quinoa, the sale of clothing, potato production, sale of fruits and vegetables, and sale of cattle.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesses where Juana is a worker. She notes that it is her fourth cycle as a part of Pro Mujer. She was invited by the invitation of a promoter who works at the institution and came to visit her in her house. She now has a business for producing and selling quinoa. She has practiced this business for years, undertaking the same business with a community association that commercializes said product.

The loan that she will take out is to raise capital for the sale of seeds, which she will acquire from the fairs in the town of El Alto and later will harvest to sell outside. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her home in all ways possible because she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Yereta N°1 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les  femmes du groupe Yereta N°1 ont  en moyenne 37 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments de tous genres. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,  Rokia  (1 ère femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche) excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 paquets de maggi 2 boites de concentrée de  tomate,  3 sacs de sel de cuisine et une grande quantité d’épices. Elle s’approvisionne à la foire de Kimparana et effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Rokia espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly in traditional extended families, the women of the Yereta N°1 group are on average 37 years old and have 7 children. They all live in the village of Niazekan in the area of Segou (4th administration region of Mali) and know each other through neighborhood ties, professional activities, and kinship. They practice in the buying and selling of all kinds of condiments. 

With the goal of satisfying the needs of their customers who are more and more numerous and demanding, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their first group loan.

Rokia (the first woman standing on the right) excels in the selling of condiments. She is highly sought after in the business. She expects to use her loan to buy 10 packets of Maggi, 2 boxes of tomato puree, 3 bags of kitchen salt, and a large amount of spices. She procures her goods at the Kimparana market and makes her sales in cash, retailing to a mixed group of customers. 

With this loan, Rokia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to help her husband take care of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Marie Paule

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 32 commerçante. Elle fait fait l'élévage des poulets et porcs qu'elle revend une depuis 1 an déjà  elle fonctionne à merveille mais son capital n'est pas élévé alors, elle  est obligé à chaque fois d'attendre que le stock acheté pour élever grandisse, pour le vende avant de racheter de nouveaux poussins et porceletd d'où la rupture de stock quotienne qui cause l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle tout le temps. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante mais aussi de réaliser un plus gros profit. Le benéfice que lui apportera ce crédit l'aidera à agrandir son activité( augmenter le nombre de poussins et porcelets) et aussi à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 32-year-old woman who raises chickens and pigs to resell. She has been doing this for one year already and it is going well. However, she does not have much capital, so she is obligated each time to wait for the stock she buys to be raised and sold before she can buy new piglets and chicks. This causes interruptions in her stock which causes her customers dissatisfaction quite often.

She is asking for this loan to buy a large quantity [of piglets and chicks], which will allow her not only to satisfy her already growing customer base, but also to earn more profits. 

The profits from this loan will help her to increase her business (by increasing the number of her chicks and piglets) and also to support the everyday needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chicks

loans.name: Bibien

texts.fr: Bibien est une femme de 43 ans séparée, mère de 4 enfants.Elle gère un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 10 ans déjà où elle vend des boissons hygiéniques et de la nourriture.Elle a acquise au fil du temps une expérience dans le domaine ce qui lui a permis de gagner une clientèle considérable. Malheureusement,la petitesse de son stock ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement la demande de sa clientèle ce qui crée par conséquent une diminution importante de celle-ci ce qui entraîne de ce fait la baisse de ses ventes et donc de ses bénéfices. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons . ce qui lui permettra de retenir et gagner la clientèle mais plus précisément d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. benefice qui lui permettra d'une part d'agrandir et d’aménager sa structure et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Bibien is a 43-year old woman who is separated and mother to four children. She has been managing a bar in one of the capital's districts for the past ten years and she sells healthy drinks and food there. Over time she has acquired experience in this field and this has enabled her to build up a significant customer base. Unfortunately her limited stock does not allow her sufficiently to meet customer demand; this has led to a significant decrease in customer demand and in turn to a decrease in her sales and profits. She is thus requesting this loan so that she can buy more crates of drinks. This will enable her to retain and increase her customer base, and more significantly to increase her sales and profits, which in turn will enable her to expand and refurbish her bar and also provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of crates of drinks.

loans.name: Lugwe

texts.en:
Lugwe is 49 years old and has six children. He is married to Mgumba, who works as a farmer.

To support their family, Lugwe started a goat-meat business at home with just two goats. He sells at the market, mostly to the people who buy for slaughter in the slaughterhouses. He has gained a respectable number of customers through friends and relatives in the past four years.

He requires a loan to increase the number of goats to meet the growing demand. In the future, he wants to further expand his business, which will enable him to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Last Stop Group

texts.en:
Last Stop is made up of four traders who sell different items, including foodstuffs, vegetables, detergents and material. 

Samuel, the leader of the group, sells material. He is standing second from the left in the photograph. Samuel lives with his wife and two children who are aged 14 and eight and who are both studying. His dream for his family is to give them the best so that they have a good profession in the future. 

He has been selling material for 8 years now in a kiosk on the road side. His work schedule is from the morning to evening. The business is located in a strategic area which attracts many potential customers. He buys the material and supplies it to customers in the township. He needs the loan in order to buy more material to be able meet the demand and the competition in the local market.

One of his goals is to continue with the business in order to generate more income to guarantee him quality of life.  

The group needs a total amount of GHC 2,400 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more material to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from Gurjaani district of East Georgia. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband, two children (two and 12 years old), parents-in-law and a brother-in-law. Irma’s father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Her husband works as a singer and gets a monthly salary. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they sow onions on the family-owned land. In addition, Irma purchases nuts and produces Churchkhela (traditional Georgian sausage-shaped candies, produced with grape must, flour and nuts threaded onto a string) which is sold in the capital city. Irma is very hard-working young woman, with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to cultivate the plot of land and purchase onion seeds. The loan will help her to provide financially for her needs. She will sow onions on her agricultural land and with proper seasonal work she will be able to get a good harvest to sell at a good price. This will increase her income and Irma will renovate her house to improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to cultivate a plot of land and purchase onion seeds.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Maysa is a 43-year-old woman, she is married and a mother to two sons and two daughters. She is a housewife and her husband is employed. However, he gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the costs.

Maysa needs to change her old bedroom furniture, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture. This will enable Maysa and her husband to enjoy healthy and comfortable sleep and improve their living conditions.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For twenty years he has been trading in produce, mainly maize and beans. He started by growing his own crops, then sold then and got capital to buy in bulk from other farmers. 

His challenges include price fluctuation and inflation which erodes most of the profits. His dreams are to build a permanent house for residence as they are currently living in a mud-wattled house and setting up a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round.

Frank is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Frank Yamundu Group

texts.en:
Kevina is a 48-year-old hardworking woman living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop for ten years and also practices farming. She faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation, which negatively impacts her projected profits. Kevina's personal goal is to build a house for residence, while her business goal is to have a wholesale shop.

Kevina is a member of a group where each member guarantees the others in accessing credit. That is why there are many members in addition to those who requested the loan. 

Kevina intends to use the loan money to buy salt, soap, sugar, onions, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, sugar, onions, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 61-year-old hardworking lady with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been running a confectionery business since 1995, which she started with the aim of earning a living and paying school fees for her children. 

Florence is serving a number of customers including schools, supermarkets, and the general markets with a variety of eats. She is facing a challenge of unreliable workers and high labor turn over. Besides that, she is aiming at expanding her business to new areas. 

Florence intends to use the loan to buy a pressing and sealing machine used in packaging.

loans.use: to buy a pressing and sealing machine used in packaging.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Ms Kosar is a 47-year-old married woman. Eight years ago, she started her own business of a general store. When her husband got severely ill, she did not lose hope and initiated her business to answer the needs of her family members. With the passage of time she has retained many customers and now enjoys dealing with a good number of customers every day.

She is a mother of three children, one of whom is school-going. She dreams to provide a good and quality education to her other children as well. She needs to cover everyday expenditures and educational expenses. For this, she is required to improve her business and has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR in order to buy stocks of grains, sugar and flour. She needs to keep her business fully stocked so as to satisfy the demand from her customers, increase sales, and improve her earnings. 

She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to cover the expenses of her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grains, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Desde hace 10 años, Maria en condiciones de mujer viuda y madre de 4 hijos adultos, sale desde muy temprano al mercado a comprar ranchos, víveres y productos de la canasta familiar,  para vender en su tienda, ubicada en la linda e historica ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, a los clientes de su propio barrio y de zonas aledañas a él. Sus compras las realiza de contado y en pequeños volumenes  y por ello debe ir al mercado varias veces a la semana. Los compradores de Maria, son principalmete sus propias vecinas, amas de casa, que adquieren los articulos de la canasta familiar, en pequeñas cantidades para comsumirlos diariamente. Este negocio fué idea de su esposo, ya fallecido, y con el ha logrado continuar generando ingresos para el bienestar de su hogar; al principio solo vendia  productos fritos en pocas cantidades, pero viendo la necesidad de la gente, fue agregandole, víveres poco a poco y luego refrescos, bebidas y hoy  tambien vende mercancia variada, principalmente cosméticos y articulos de perfumería. En la actualidad necesita aprovechar la fiestas de fin de año, época en la cual sus ventas se incrmentan y su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente, para responder a su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará arroz por bultos, aceite en pimipnas, productos de belleza y cervezas, que son los que en general tienen un mayor consumo, entre sus clientes en este fin de año, lleno de festividades familiares, donde en los hogares comparten comidas, alimentos y bebidas, para celebral la navidad y la noche buena
texts.en: For 10 years, Maria, the widowed mother of 4 adult children, has gone to the market very early to buy food, groceries and basic family basket products to sell in her store. It is located in the historical city of Cartagena de Indias. The customers are from her own neighborhood and from the nearby areas. She pays for her purchasing up front and in small volumes and that's why she has to go to the market several times a week. Maria's customers are mainly her own neighbors, housewives who acquire the basic family basket items in small quantities to consume daily. This business was her late husband's idea. With it, she has been able to continue generating income for her household's wellbeing. At first she only sold small quantities of fried food, but when she saw what people needed she expanded adding groceries little by little and later snacks, beverages and now she also sells varied merchandise, mainly cosmetics and cosmetics. Right now, she needs to take advantage of the end of year holidays when her sales increase and her working capital is insufficient for responding to the customers. This is why she is turning to a Kiva loan. With it, she will buy sacks of rice, containers of oil, beauty products and beer. These are generally the most popular products with her customers towards the end of the year with family parties and shared meals, food and drinks to celebrate Christmas and Christmas Eve.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice, 1 container of oil, snacks, crates of beverages, and beauty products.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is 50 years old. She has six children and is widowed. She lives with her family in a neighbourhood in the town of Samburu. 

For three years, she has been making a living selling household items from her small grocery store, where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, bread, over-the-counter medicines, sugar, and other items. The grocery store is located at her house and she already has a good clientele. The main challenge is that she sells few products and therefore earns little income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu.

The loan she is requesting is for 40,000 KES and she will use it to supply her business with staple food products to be able to improve her income in order to help her family. Her plan is to grow her business and, thus, have a variety to offer her customers and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, sugar, rice, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 37 years old, married to Alice and supports a family of six members. He operates a butchery and a cafe and has been running the business for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is requesting a second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the profits to enlarge his business. 

His dream is to put more effort into his business and to diversify into large scale farming to better his living standard.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for his cafe.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
