Margret is a hardworking married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. For ten years she has been running a retail shop. She started the business after a fruitful maize harvest that she sold to nearby schools. 

Inadequate capital is affecting the business, but her dreams are to expand her business into a wholesale one and to educate her five children. Margret is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
El Sauce es un municipio que pertenece al departamento de León, es un poblado altamente activo que se caracteriza por tener personas trabajadoras que en su mayoría se dedican a la docencia porque les apasiona y aportan a su país en su desarrollo económico ya que enseñan a leer y escribir a miles de jóvenes que son el futuro de Nicaragua.
Tal es el caso de la profesora Verónica que tiene más de veinte años de brindar todo su empeño y dedicación en esta actividad desde muy joven le ha permitido educar a sus hijas y tener su propia vivienda.

Hoy en la actualidad tiene su casa casi con todas las condiciones adecuadas gracias a los diferentes financiamientos y a su salario pero tiene la necesidad en este momento de repellar toda la casa para tener mejores condiciones y calidad de vida.

Está necesitando un crédito para pagarlo en 16 meses para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra con el que responde con su salario y espera y confía en Dios le apoyen con su solicitud que su propósito es no quedarle nunca mal.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a town that belongs to the department of León. It is a town highly characterized as having hardworking people. Most of them work as teachers because they are passionate about it and they contribute to their country's economic development, since they teach reading and writing to thousands of young people who are the future of Nicaragua.

Such is the case of the teacher Verónica. She has more than twenty years offering all of her hard work and dedication to this activity. Since she was very young, it has allowed her to raise her daughters and own her own home.

Right now her house has everything it needs thanks to the different loans and her salary but she needs to re-plaster the whole house right now to keep it in better condition and have a better quality of life. 

She is needing a loan to pay off in 16 months to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay for labor. She will pay for it with her salary and trusts in God that you will support her with her request because she never wants to let anyone down.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for class materials and to do home improvement.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is married, with five children, three of whom go to school. She has a retail shop selling sugar, soap, salt, bread and beans. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, salt, soap, beer and soda. 

She has been doing this for 10 years, selling on a retail basis only. She generates additional income through rental houses. Her major business challenges include the transportation of commodities from Kikuubo in Kampala to her shop, thieves and defaulters. 

She hopes to own a fully stocked wholesale shop and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes electricity, water and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap, beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman of 50 and a mother of four children. She is a dairy farmer and has been in business for 32 years. She gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Margaret's third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase a dairy cow. In future she wants to be a successful dairy farmer in her village.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 38-year-old married man and a father of four daughters. He lives with his family in a small village. For three years he has owned a small grocery store, which has been profitable and the only source of income for his family. It is the only grocery store where he lives, and it has many loyal customers. Despite this, the store needs support from time to time to cover its costs.

Hamzeh is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar, dairy products and canned food. This will increase sales and increase Hamzeh's income, so he will be able to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy needed groceries for his store.

loans.name: Elí De La Cruz

texts.es:
El Sauce está ubicado a 90 km al occidente de León, es un pueblo con una población bastante grande que se caracteriza por tener actividades meramente ganaderas y comerciales donde abunda la leche, cuajada, crema, queso y producen lo que es el maíz y frijoles.

En el habita desde que nació don Elí de la Cruz, un señor de 69 años que se ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar arduamente para darles el pan de cada día a su familia, es originario de una comarca de dicho municipio donde se dedicaba a la agricultura y trabajó muchos años en la corte de caña.

Con el paso de los años y para tener una mejor calidad de vida se trasladó a vivir al Sauce donde instaló dos molinos para brindar este servicio a los pobladores en un barrio donde no contaban con este beneficio. Este molino lo que hace es triturar el maíz para elaborar las tortillas que es el principal alimento del plato Nicaragüense. 
Cuenta con la ayuda de dos nietos quienes habitan con él y viendo la posibilidad de crecer en su negocio tiene la meta de comprar otro motor de molino para instalarlo en otro barrio potencial el cual será atendido por uno de sus nietos por lo cual necesita la ayuda de kiva a través de Ceprodel para que le otorguen un crédito de $ 695.00 para pagarlo en 12 meses con la ganancia del mismo Molino.
texts.en:
El Sauce is located 90 kilometers west of León and i a town with a pretty large population known for livestock and sales of milk, curd, cream and cheese and also for producing corn and beans. 

Elí de la Cruz lives here, a 69 year old man that has spent his whole live working hard to put food on the table each day for his family. He is from a region of the municipality that is focused in agriculture and he worked for many years cutting sugar cane. 

With the pass of time and to reach a better quality life he moved to El Sauce where he installed two mills to bring this service to the people of a neighborhood who do not have this benefit. The mills pulverize corn to make tortillas which are a staple of Nicaraguan meals. 

He has two grandchildren who live with him and is looking into the possibility of growing his business. He has a goal to buy another mill motor to install in another potential neighborhood which will be attended to buy one of his grandchildren. For this reason he needs Kiva's help through Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan of $695.00 which will be paid over 12 months with the earnings of his mills.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his mill.

loans.name: Flor De Cempazúchitl Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Cempazuchilt esta es una comunidad donde la mayor parte de los habitantes hablan la lengua mazahua los habitantes de la comunidad, son seis integrantes del grupo los cuales todos tienen una actividad como Artemio y Martha invertiran en borregos, Teresa invertira en Cerdos, Jacinto en vasos de licuadora y Abel en pollos. estos mismos integrantes son los que eligieron el monbre del grupo y lo eligieron porque en la casa del representante donde se reunen, sembro flores de cempazuchitl, esta flor se utiliza para adornar las ofrendas que se ponen el dia de muertos o en los panteones.
Don Alfredo quien tambien forma parte del grupo es un hombre de 39 años de edad sin duda un hombre muy responsable, siempre sonriendo ante cada situacionque está casado con la señora María del Carmen con la cual tuvo 7 hijos de los cuales actualmente sólo 3 de ellos dependen aún de él. Don Alfredo solicita este crédito ya que él se dedica al comercio de plásticos, en específico a la venta de vasos para licuadora en el cual tiene 6 años de experiencia, cada 8 o 15 días que necesita mercancía él va a una comunidad muy cerca de su pueblo llamada San Agustín Mextepec donde se surte de lo necesario, él va casa por casa ofreciendo sus productos y en ocasiones los vende en el tianguis, él decidió emprender este negocio ya que el trabajaba en la ciudad de México y se terminó el trabajo y quedó desempleado y él necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia, “El único problema casi siempre es la falta de dinero” comenta don Alfredo, dice que también se dedica a la siembra en hortaliza y lo que más siembra es silantro, rabano, coliflor, brocolí, el señor Alfredo es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que necesita un impulso económico, un préstamo de KIVA sin duda lo ayudo mucho ya que gracias al anterior prestamo pudo poner una pequeña tiendita donde vende lo necesario esta muy contento por este logroa ya que es una manera de mejorar la caliadad de vida de sus hijos y de su esposa quien aun dependen de El.
texts.en: The Flor de Cempazuchitl [Yellow Marigold] group is a village, the majority of whose inhabitants speak the Mazahua language.  The group is made up of six members, all of whom have a business:  Artemio and Martha invest in sheep, Teresa in pigs, Jacinto in blender goblets and Abel in chickens.  It was these same members who chose the name of the group, because the representative in whose house they meet grew cempazuchitl flowers, which are used to decorate offerings on the Day of the Dead or are placed on tombs.  One of the group's members, Alfredo, is a 39-year-old man who is obviously very responsible and always cheerful, whatever the circumstances.  He is married to María del Carmen, with whom he has had 7 children, only 3 of whom are currently still dependent on him.  Alfredo is applying for this loan as he is in the plastics trade; in fact, he has six years' experience of selling blender goblets.  Every 8 or 15 days, when he needs stock, he goes to a nearby village called San Agustín Mextepec when he stocks up with what he needs.  He goes from door to door trying to sell his goods and, occasionally, sells them at the street market.  He decided to set up his business as a means of supporting his family after his job in Mexico City finished and he was left unemployed.  "The only problem is almost always lack of money" says Alfredo, who says that he also grows vegetables, mainly coriander, radishes, cauliflowers and broccoli.  Alfredo is a very hardworking and responsible person who needs a financial boost.  A loan from Kiva would undoubtedly help him tremendously as his previous loan enabled him to set up a small shop where he sells essentials.  He is very happy with his achievement since it is a way of improving the quality of life of his children and wife who still depend on him.

loans.use: To buy blender goblets and to stock his small shop which sells bread, cold drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Derickson

texts.en:
Derickson, 31, lives alone in a rental house in the town of Samburu. He is a single visionary man. He’s been managing his carpentry shop for five years. He learned how to manage the shop with his father, who taught him to make wood furniture. He currently works in it full-time.

He’s requesting loans to buy several types of wood, such as olive, cedar and pine, to increase inventory and have on hand things he needs. This will help him to do his work with no setbacks.

His hope is to expand the shop into a large salesroom.

loans.use: to buy wood like olive, cedar and pine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 49, is from Olkalou and is married with five children who are all in school.

Peter has a butchery business that he has been operating for the past 13 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a cow to slaughter to add to the inventory in his butchery.

He hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a man of 30. He is married to Ann and a father of two children. He is a carpenter in Kiambu and has been doing carpentry for ten years now. His  monthly income is 50,000 KES.

This will be Gerald's second loan with KADET LTD. He paid the other loan successfully and without difficulty. He wants to be a successful businessman in Kiambu.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 48 years old and divorced. She lives with her three daughters in the town of Samburu, Kenya. 

Ten years ago, Rose set up her own business at home, where she makes men's, children's and women’s clothing such as dresses for all occasions, skirts, blouses, coats, uniforms, etc. She has always worked in this business, as it was something she learned at a very young age and is now her source of income.

With the loan of 20,000 KES she has requested, Rose plans to buy raw materials such as fabrics, threads, needles, accessories, buttons, etc. She will use these to make clothing and therefore provide better customer service. Rose’s goal is to have a larger business and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabrics, threads, needles, accessories, buttons, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
La señora Gisela vive en casa de sus padres en un departamento que le dieron en anticrético, tiene un hijo, trabaja con su movilidad, el nivel de educación es secundario, ocupa un cuarto en acabado de ladrillo, la casa está ubicada en la zona San Martín de la Ciudad de la Paz. Gisela ya no vive con su esposo, pues se separaron.

Gisela, trabaja con su micro bus prestando servicio de transporte automotor de carga por carretera, con el cual genera sus ingresos, para el pago de alimentación, luz, agua y otros servicios básicos de ella y su hijo en el anticrético donde vive.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de repuestos de su movilidad (compra de un par de llantas, líquidos de frenos y transmisión, nuevo filtro de aire), el sueño de Gisela es mejorar sus ingresos para su comodidad de vida y en un futuro tener casa propia.

Es la décima segunda vez con IMPRO  y la octava con KIVA, que tiene los créditos, y está muy satisfecha con el crédito.
texts.en: Gisela lives in her parents’ house in an apartment that was given to her in anticrético. She has a son. She works with her vehicle, and she has a high school education. She occupies a brick room, and the house is in the San Martín area of the city of La Paz. Gisela no longer lives with her husband because they are separated. Gisela works with her micro-bus providing land cargo transportation. This generates her income to pay for food, electricity, water, and other basic services for herself and her son in the anticrético where she lives. She needs the loan to buy replacement parts for her vehicle (to buy a pair of tires, brake and transmission fluids, and new air filter). Gisela’s dream is to improve her income to make her more comfortable and to have a house in the future. This is the 12th time with IMPRO and the eighth time with Kiva that she has had loans. She is very happy about the loan.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for the vehicle she uses to transport cargo.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert used his previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell.

He is a 36-year-old married man with three children. The family is living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For four years he has been operating a retail shop, and with the income earned he has been able to provide for the family. He has the challenge of limited funds to meet consumer demands. His dream is to become a wholesale trader. 

Robert is requesting this loan to buy bread, sugar, and rice to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, and rice to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Kamugenyi Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 42-year-old married man with four children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He works six days a week on his farm and grows tea, maize and beans. He has been farming for 14 years. He also earns a side income from his retail shop, which he started in order to meet his daily expenses since farming is seasonal.

His major challenge is a lack of modern farming equipment to farm extensively. His dreams are to buy a tractor and use modern farming methods.

Lawrence is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides and to pay workers. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and pesticides and to pay workers.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 37 years old and married to Esther. He is a father of three children.

William sells shoes in Kiambu. He has been in this business for five years now. He earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

This will be William’s first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more shoes for resale. 

In the future, he wants to diversify his business and open a supermarket so he can become a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 31 years old and single. He does dairy farming to earn a living. He has been farming for six years. He also sells shoes to generate more income.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Michael has been able to boost his business. He hopes to grow his business in the future. He needs a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Livingi

texts.en:
Livingi is a 38-year-old man with six children who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years he has been trading in a local brewery business. With the income earned, he has been able to pay the school fees for his children and buy land.

His business challenges are a lack of inadequate capital to facilitate the business and customers not paying on time. 

Livingi would like to educate his children up to the university level and expand his business to the city where there is a ready market. He intends to use the loan to buy local brews to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brews to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jeniffer, 32 years old, married to James and a mother of three children, has been selling new clothes in Kiambu for three years now. She earns a monthly income of about 10,000 shillings.

This will be Jennifer’s first loan from KADET LTD, with which she plans to buy new clothes for resale. In future, she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for monthly tuition fees and to buy materials.

loans.name: Kaija

texts.en:
A 45-year-old father of four children living in Kagadi, Uganda, Kaija has been operating a retail shop selling food for three years now. His major challenges are customers not paying on time and price fluctuations.

Having used his previous loan to purchase more food items to sell, Kaija is requesting a loan to purchase maize and beans to sell. He would like to diversify his business to include a supermarket, and dreams of educating his children and buying a car.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single young man. This photo was taken inside his barber shop.

For the past three years Mohammad has had a barber shop, which is the only shop of this kind in the place where he is. He has a good reputation among customers, which has been profitable for his business. He has a lot of loyal customers, but the shop needs some support to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new barber kit, which has tools such as different types of hair scissors, a collection of hair brushes, and hair and face creams. This will improve his work and satisfy the desires of his customers, which will lead to increased demand from his customers and an increase in income.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new barber kit.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas has been running a retail shop - a business he ventured into four years ago - and now earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Silas has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES to purchase two bales each of baking and maize flour, boxes of biscuits, cooking fat, washing detergents, and tissue paper. 

The anticipated profit from this business will help him purchase more stock. He hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase two bales each of baking and maize flour, boxes of biscuits, cooking fat, washing detergents, and tissue paper.

loans.name: Levekato

texts.en:
Levekato is a married woman with 5 children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. Fifteen years ago she decided to trade in clothes in order to support her growing family. She started as a market vendor and, after accumulating enough capital, she rented a house and set up a boutique. Her love for fashion also prompted her to start the business. She mainly sells men shirts. 

Inadequate capital to meet the different tastes and preferences of her customers is her major challenge. Her dream is to own a fashion school. 

Levekato is requesting a loan to buy clothes to re-sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to re-sell in her shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a lady of 43 years, married to George, and a mother of five children. She does dairy farming in Kiambu and has been doing so for fifteen years now. She gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Jane's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for her children. 

In future she wants to be a prosperous business woman.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred, age 33, lives in West Point. She is a single parent with three children between the ages of 1 and 9. Only two of her children are in school. 

For the past seven years she has been selling ladies' and children's slippers in the open square of the market. One difficulty she faces is low sales during the rainy season. She makes a profit because of the fashion slippers that she sells. 

Winifred is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' and children's slippers. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' and children's slippers for her business.

loans.name: Consulate

texts.en:
Consulate, a 26-year-old mother of two children, has been operating a salon business for five months now, having begun it with savings accrued from her teaching job. Inadequate capital and high transport costs are factors affecting her business growth.

Having used her previous loan to buy cosmetics for her salon, Consulate is requesting a new loan for the same purpose. She wishes to expand her business into other new markets and buy land for growing crops. Consulate also has a dream of building a permanent home and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for the salon.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie is 24 years old, married and has two children, who attend school. She works very hard to provide for her family.  For the past two years, Maggie has been selling different types of local fruits and vegetables near the market. She currently has a lot of customers, which permits her to have good sales. She also knows where to purchase  good fruits and vegetables at low prices.

Maggie is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fruit and vegetables and face the season with a good inventory. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, kale,and cabbages.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар  мужчина в возрасте  50 лет.   Он женат , и имеет единственного сына.  К сожалению он не смог дать сыну образования и в данное время его сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках.  Сын Анвара каждый месяц по возможности присылает своим родителям денежные средства.   Жена Анвара  дома занимается  шитьем   национальных подушек и курпачей (матрас) .  Сам он по специальности стоматолог,дома имеет стоматологическое оборудование и   принимает клиентов у себя дома.  Но все что  он  зарабатывает все  уходит на проживание семьи.  Так как сейчас осень и начинается дождливый сезон  Анвар хочет отремонтировать крышу своего дома так как крыша уже два года протекает.  На полученный кредит хочет купить строительные материалы и побыстрее отремонтировать крышу до зимы. Анвар  заранее благодарит МДО «Арванд» за поддержку.
texts.en: Anvar is 50 years old, married, and has one son. Unfortunately, he was unable to afford to pay for an education for his son, so his son currently works in the Russian Federation and tries to send money to his parents whenever possible. Anvar's wife works from home sewing traditional national pillows and mattresses. Anvar is a stomatologist and treats his clients at home where he has all the necessary equipment. However, all his earnings go towards supporting his family. Now that the rainy weather of autumn has arrived, Anvar wants to repair the roof of his house because it has been leaking for the past 2 years. He will use the loan money to buy construction materials to fix his roof before winter. Anvar thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to  purchase building materials

loans.name: Munyasya

texts.en:
Munyasya is 51 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, he farms and sells vegetables, mainly kale. He has been in the business for six years. He also does livestock farming for more income generation.  

He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. This is because he has been trained in business management skills. He needs a loan of 10,935 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet used the previous loan to buy office supplies to sell. She is a hardworking woman aged 31 who is married with four children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She runs a stationary business, which she has operated for nine years. She got capital from her husband to start the business. She wishes to educate her children up to the university level. Her business is affected by price fluctuations, and her dream is to trade in wholesale. 

Harriet intends to use the loan to buy books, pens and paper to sell.

loans.use: to buy books, pens and paper to sell.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина молодая женщина в возрасте 25 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих  детей.  Занимается она у себя дома откормом скота так как не имеет образования.Она  в наличии  имеет 5 голов мелко рогатого скота.  Этому виду  деятельности ее научили родители.  Ее муж работает на стройке, помощником мастера. И в свободное время старается помогать своей жене.  Мадина старается развивать свой бизнес по животноводству так как  основной доход от этого. На полученный кредит Мадина хочет приобрести скот  и тем самым увеличить поголовье скота.  Она очень благодарна Арванду, что с помощью таких организаций люди с низким и средним уровням жизни могут осуществить свои планы и улучшить свои условия проживания.
texts.en: Madina is a young woman of 25. She is married and has 2 children. She raises cattle at home because she does not have an education, and her parents taught her animal husbandry. She began with 5 head of livestock. Her husband works in construction as an assistant foreman, and in his free time, he helps his wife. Madina is now trying to develop her business, as this is the main source of income for the family. She will use the loan money to buy more livestock to increase her herd. She is very grateful to Arvand for assisting low- and middle-income people to realize their plans and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy  cattle

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба  женщина в возрасте 40 лет.    Замужем, имеет 3 детей.    Она   вместе с мужем   более  12 лет занимается  откормом скота.   В наличии имеет около 7 голов мелко рогатого скота. Махбуба содержит скот у себя дома и она  очень хорошо разбирается в преимуществах своего дела, знает когда закупать и продавать скот.  Также у них  есть сад  где её муж выращивает фрукты и овощи.   Весной  и  летом  её муж продаёт фрукты на базаре от своего урожая.  Старший сын Махбубы находится в РТ на  заработках и каждый  месяц по возможности отправляет денежные средства свои родителям. А младшие ее дети  пока  учатся в школе.  Махбуба  на полученный кредит планирует купить скот  и откормив до весны продать за хорошую цену. Заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. For over 12 years, Mahbuba and her husband have been keeping livestock, and presently have around 7 sheep and goats. Mahbuba keeps the animals at her home. She is an expert in the intricacies of her business and knows well when to purchase and when to sell livestock. In addition, the family has a garden where they grow fruit and vegetables. In spring and summer, Mahbuba's husband sells their harvest at the market. Their eldest son is presently working in Russia and, if possible, sends money to his parents every month. The younger children currently attend school.

Mahbuba plans to use this loan to purchase livestock and, having fattened it during the winter, to sell it at a good price in the spring. She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen used the previous loan to buy maize, groundnuts and beans to sell. He is a 27-year-old married man who has been running a produce store for 13 years, having got start-up capital from farming. Inadequate capital is affecting the business.  

He would like to expand his business to other areas within the district and educate his three children. 

Stephen intends to use the new loan to purchase groundnuts to sell since the demand is very high.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts  to sell.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Djekafo  ont  en moyenne 48 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la quartier Lafiabougou se San dans la région de Ségou  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente d’habits de poissons et font de la restauration. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 12eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents.
Madame,   Kadia  (1ere debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) excelle dans la restauration. Elle est très sollicitée dans le quartier de Lafiabougou et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de farine de blé, 10 bidons d’huile de 5 litres et du bois de chauffe.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Kadia  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
de 52000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women of the Djekafo group, the majority of whom live in large traditional families, average 48 years of age with six children each. They all live in the Lafiabougou se San district of Ségou and met through neighbors, their professional activities and relatives. They buy and sell clothes and fish, as well as carrying out restauration activites. 

With a view to satisfying their ever-growing and increasingly demanding customer base, the members of this group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their 12th group loan, having repaid the previous loans in full.

Kadia, (who is standing on the far right of the photo) excels in the restauration business. She is in great demand in the district of Lafiabougou and its surroundings. She is planning to use her loan to buy ten sacks of wheat flour, ten five-liter containers of oil and firewood. She sells for cash and on a retail basis to a diverse customer base. 

With this loan, Kadia is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 52,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her husband in providing for the various household needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont  en moyenne 46 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de DALLAN dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de produits cosmétiques, d'habillements, de tasses plastiques et de diverses marchandises. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  4 eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts  précédents.
Madame,   TENIN  présidente de l’association (2ème femme debout de la droite vers la gauche photo) excelle dans la vente de cosmétiques et de bijoux. Elle est très sollicitée à DALLAN  et ses environs. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux douzaines de parfum 5 douzaines de crème pour la peau surtout en cette période de froid  et une grande quantité de bijoux à Bamako.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame TENIN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 16500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Danaya group, the majority of whom are married and living in large traditional families, average 46 years of age with three children each. They all live in the village of Dallan in the region of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and got to know each other through neigbhbors, their professional activities and relatives. They buy and sell cosmetics, clothing, plastic cups and various other goods.

With a view to satisfying their ever-increasing and more demanding customers, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fourth group loan, having repaid in full the previous loans. 

Tenin, who is the president of the association (standing second from the right in the photo) excels in the sale of cosmetics and jewelry. She is in great demand in Dallan and the surrounding areas. She is planning to use her loan to buy two dozen perfumes, five dozen body creams (particularly for this cold period) and a large quantity of jewelry in Bamako. She sells for cash, on a retail basis and on credit to a diverse customer base. 

With this loan, Tenin is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 16,500FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her activity and to help her husband in providing for the household's needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Diana

texts.ru: Диана очень добродушная, вежливая, предприимчивая, трудолюбивая. Торговая точка Дианы расположена на центральном рынке. Она торгует женской и мужской одеждой, носками, колготами и штанами. Благодаря удачному расположению торгового места Дианы и хорошей покупательской способности, ее бизнес идет успешно. Кредит понадобился для закупки зимних вещей: теплых носков, колгот, кофт и штанов.
texts.en: Diana is very kind, polite, enterprising and hard-working. She has a sales outlet at the central market where she sells both menswear and womenswear, including socks, tights, and pants. Thanks to the good location of her outlet and the purchasing power of her clients, her business is successful. Diana is seeking a loan to buy winter clothing: warm socks, tights, and pants.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing: warm socks, tights, sweaters and pants

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 60 years old, married and has four children.  

To earn a living, he raises and sells goats. He has been in the business for 12 years. Previously, he used to sell charcoal.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and improved his living standards. David has requested a loan of 21, 363.75 KES to buy goats.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 53 years old, married and has four children. 

He does livestock farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money. He has also used his previous loans from Faulu Kenya to boost his business.

He has requested for a loan of 53,156 KES to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь использовала предыдущий кредит для постройки новой теплицы, что позволило ей получить дополнительную прибыль. Несмотря на трудности, присущие бизнесу Любви - падение цен на томаты, болезни, плохие погодные условия - она настроена оптимистически и считает, что усердный труд - ключ к решению любых проблем.
На этот раз Любовь просит предоставить  ей кредит для ремонта и переоборудования своих четырех теплиц. Она хочет подготовить их к началу сезона и успеть до посадки помидор.
texts.en: Lubov used her previous loan to build a new greenhouse which allowed her to increase her income. Despite all the difficulties inherent in Lubov's business - falling prices for tomatoes, diseases, bad weather conditions - she is an optimist and believes that hard work is the key to solving any kind of problem. This time, Lubov is seeking a loan to fix and renovate her four greenhouses. She wants to prepare them for the start of the season, before it is time to plant tomatoes.

loans.use: to repair and renovate greenhouses

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 34-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda.

He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for 10 years. 

In order to supplement his meager salary he decided to venture into produce buying and selling. The business has been very lucrative. 

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet demand are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a food store in town.

Edward is requesting a loan to buy maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce needs to invest more in her vegetable business, which is why she’s requesting a new loan to buy water pipes. She wants to be doing some irrigation on her vegetables during the dry season to continue producing fruits and vegetables. The previous loan allowed her to improve and increase her inventory and profits to support her family and provide their food and their schooling.

loans.use: to buy water pipes.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua continues selling medicines. She says that the business is doing well. Since the previous loan, her living standards have improved. 

However, she needs to make further home improvements. She wants to have piped water in her house. She is asking for a loan to buy water pipes and cover installation costs. 

Her aspiration is to have a prosperous business, improving her family's financial situation, since this will allow her to offer her relatives better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy water pipes and cover installation costs.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a dedicated woman who has the urge to move forward. She is happy for the support she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. 

With this new investment, she wants to expand her business by buying more chemicals and seedlings with which she is sure to produce more farm produce.

Caroline hopes to continue providing a better life to her family. The previous loan had a great positive impact on her.

loans.use: to buy more pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help pay for renovations, painting the room, a dividing wall, manicure and pedicure stations, table and client chairs.

loans.name: Fernanado Rafael

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Fernanado compró pescado y lo vendió así mismo con ello completó el dinero con el cual compró un congelador. Hoy su negocio está mucho mas elegante y maneja con cuidado la cadena de enfriamiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento con el que comprará en mayor volumen pescado, aprovechando el alto consumo de bocachicos, vagres, lebranche,  en el fin de año, lo cual proyecta un aumento en sus ventas. Así mismo comprará 2 nuevas lavadoras, para ampliar su servicio de alquiler de maquinas para lavar, con ello sus vecinos se sentirán mejor atendidos y el ganará un poco mas. Fernando dice a sus finaciadores: "gracias por el apoyo que me han brindado para seguir adlante con mi negocio; espero que puedan seguir ayudando a todos los microempresarios en sus prouectos."
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan Fernando bought and sold fish, with which he got together the money to buy a freezer.  Now his business is much more elegant and he carefully operates the cooling chain.

Currently he's asking for another loan to buy fish wholesale, making the most of the high consumption of bocachico, catfish, and mullet at the end of the year, which projects an increase in his sales.  He also will buy two new washing machines to expand his washing-machine rental service so his neighbors will feel better served and he will earn a bit more.

Fernando says to his lenders: "Thank you for the support you have given me to get ahead with my business.  I hope you can continue helping all the microentrepreneurs with their projects."

loans.use: to buy fish and two new washing machines

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 31 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in Paynesville South. For the past two years she has been selling men's jeans and trousers in the market. 

Abigail is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more men's jeans and trousers.  With the profit generated from the business she buys more goods and helps with the expenses of the home. Her plan for the future is to buy land and build house.

loans.use: to purchase men's jeans and trousers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul used his previous loan to buy a bull for slaughter in his butcher shop. He earned more income, which he used to boost his farming business.  

He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He needs a loan of 74,013.75 KES to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine wants to stock her vegetable stall and to make improvements to it. She is requesting a new loan to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to continue offering a variety to her customers. She believes this investment will afford her a lot of work for a period of time.

With her previous loan, Christine made improvements to her business. At the current level of sales, she has been able to provide well for her family and buy some items for the home. She hopes to continue making improvements through these means.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  She is from Antequera, Bohol. Rosalie raises hogs, which she has been doing for 12 years. Her husband is a carpenter.

Rosalie is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feeds for the pigs and materials for the construction of a pig pen such as cement and wood. In the future, she would like to invest in other business ventures to support her family as well as save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and materials such as cement and wood.

loans.name: Perlas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLAS”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eva es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: trenzado de mantas, tienda de refrescos, tejido de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eva es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de trenzado de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al trabajar en un taller de tejido, posteriormente decidió emprender su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo distribuirá a las tiendas a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The  “PERLAS”  ["pearls"] Community Bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana central office. The group is made up of ten members and is governed by a Board of Directors, the president of which is Eva. The members' businesses are varied and include: blanket plaiting, a drink store, blanket weaving, a grocery store, and cheese sales.

This loan will benefit these businesspeople. Eva says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a promoter from the institution. She has a sewing business and plaits blankets. She tells us that she learned this work from working in a weaving workshop and later decided to open her own workshop.

This loan is for an increase of working capital (the purchase of wool). She will buy the wool from the wholesalers. She sells her finished products to stores who make orders. This work allows her to generate an income to support her household where possible. She is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training and the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre  femmes du groupe djiguiya ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier  de Santoro de la ville de San dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de  diverses marchandises. 
 les membres du groupe sont des habitués de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  4eme   prêt solidaire.
Madame, ASSA  (2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite) excelle dans la vente de tissus wax. Elle est très sollicitée dans la ville de  SAN et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 rouleaux de pagnes auprès des grossistes de SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame assa  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All four of the women in the Djiguiya group are married and live in large, traditional families. The mean are for the group is 41 years old, and each of the women has, on average, four children. They all live in the Santoro neighborhood of the city of San in the Ségou region (4th largest administrative region in Mali). The four women met each other through neighbors and family. They sell various goods.

The group members have worked with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, on several occasions. They are now on their fourth group loan.

ASSA (2nd from the left in the photo) excels in the sale of waxed fabrics. She is in high demand in the city of San and its surroundings.

She plans to use the loan to buy 2 rolls of pagnes from wholesalers in San. She sells her goods retail for cash to a clientele made up of both men and women.

With the loan, Assa hopes to earn a mean monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and help her spouse support their family.

loans.use: to buy panges

loans.name: Jean Hamilton

texts.es:
Jean es un joven de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa junto a sus padres a quienes apoya con el fruto de su trabajo. Jean es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo estudio la carrera de ingeniería ambiental, pero actualmente se encuentra trabajando como empleado en el municipio de su ciudad, el realizar los trabajos de archivos de documentos y labora alrededor de 10 horas al día, asimismo también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y ofrece su mercadería a los compañeros de trabajo; él cree que le va bien porque es amable y sobre todo respetuoso.

Jean esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar ropa como pantalones, polos, short, entre otros y de esta manera tener mayor variedad de productos, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jean is a young 22-year-old who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his parents whom he supports with his income. He is a young man with a great desire to get ahead. He worked very hard as a student, studying environmental engineering. However, at the moment he is working as a municipal employee in his city of residence. He archives documents and does other work for about ten hours a day. He also has a small clothing business. He sells clothing to his coworkers. He believes that this business is going well for him because he is kind and, above all, respectful.
Jean is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support they have provided he will be able to buy clothing such as pants, polos, shorts, and other items. This way, he will have a greater variety of products and be able to improve his income. He will be able to keep working toward his greatest dream: "To have my own home".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (pants, polos, shorts, and other items).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers and pay his workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is presently residing happy and peaceful with his family. He is 46 and blessed with three children. Jimmy is involved in a farming business which is planting rice in their field. Through the business, Jimmy is able to send his children to school, though it is not the only source of income for the family. With his determination to improve their living and quickly respond to his family's necessities, Jimmy plants vegetables for additional income generation. He believes that education is his only treasure to give to his children. That’s why he is doing his best to further support them and finish their college education.  

Jimmy continues planting rice. He is already preparing his rice field to plant. Jimmy needs additional capital to buy farm inputs. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. He hopes that applying a complete amount of farm inputs will lead him to a better yield and income as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hae

texts.en: Hae is 44 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately 2 USD daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) runs the taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about 4 USD each day. Two of her children are construction workers. They earn about 6 USD per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Hae is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase farmland to use for farming. This purchase will help her obtain more land to grow rice and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for farming

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Moeurn is 27 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than 2 years, earning approximately 3 USD daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about 3 USD each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Moeurn is requesting a loan of 750 USD to purchase a rice grinding machine for rental. This purchase will help her generate more income for her family. In the future, she would like to purchase piglets to breed and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a rice grinding machine for rental

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: Jose compró ropa para damas caballeros y niños, con su anterior credikiva con el cual quedó muy satisfecho, porque aumentó sus ventas, pues tenia muy surtido su negocio. En la actualidad se propone aprovechar el último bimestre del año, para hacer su mejor venta, pues en esta época usualmente se incrementan sus pedidos, generadores de  utilidades   y esto a él lo entusiasma. Esta es la razón por la cual con su nuevo credikiva comprará ropa en todas las líneas y para todos los gustos, pues desea que las familias que lo visitan,  se vistan en las festividades de fin de año, con la mejor ropa que solo se vende en su negocio. Su meta mas adelante es realizar mejoramientos locativos a su vivienda y por eso dice a sus financiadores: Gracias por el apoyo, porque a  través de este crédito han crecido los ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en: Jose was very satisfied with his previous loan because increasing his stock resulted in increased his sales. He used his loan to buy clothing for men, women, and children. He currently wants to make the most of the last two months of the year and make his best sales yet. This is the season where his orders normally increase-and his income as well. This is exciting for Jose. He will use this new loan to buy clothing of all brands and for all tastes. He wants the families who visit his store to be able to get outfits for the end of year festivities. He only sells the best at his store. His goal for the future is to make improvements to his store. For this reason, he says to his lenders: Thank you for the support, because through these loans my household income has increased.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all brands for all tastes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional bridal gowns and dresses needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juliet hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional bridal gowns and other merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Andrilita

texts.en:
This is Andrilita. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of photo supplies and cell phone accessories to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of photo supplies and cell phone accessories to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Andrilita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of photo supplies and cell phone accessories needed in her business

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran is 53 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are employed.  She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Ran sells papaya salad and Khmer noodles, which she has been doing for over 10 years. She earns about $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. Her children earn about $6 per day. 

Ran is requesting a loan for $1,500, which she will use to purchase a tricycle to transport sugarcane juice, meat balls, and papaya salad to sell. This purchase will help her earn additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle to use for carrying sugarcane juice, meatballs, and papaya salad.

loans.name: Serigne Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne Moustapha est un jeune étudiant célibataire qui vit au Sénégal et pratique parallèlement  à ses études le commerce de prêts a porter depuis 3 ans. Il n’a aucune charge mais veut développer son activité de commerce afin d’augmenter son fond de roulement. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour s’approvisionner en prêts a porter destinés à la vente.
texts.en: Serigne Moustapha is a young single student who lives in Senegal. Along with his studies, he has been running his business selling ready-to-wear clothing for the past three years. It would take Serigne Moustapha little additional work to expand his business once he has an increase in his working capital. He is a member in one of the branches of UIMCEC, where he has already successfully repaid his two prior loans. Serigne Moustapha is currently requesting a loan of 100,000 XOF, with which he plans to purchase a supply of ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Aguilas De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DE CORAZON”  iniciará el decimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carpintería, servicio de comida, salón de peinados, taller de imprenta, venta de calzados, venta de jugos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de unas amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de comida que es un negocio familiar y ella lo sigue trabajando desde hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y carne) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “AGUILAS DE CORAZON”  Communal Bank is about to start its eleventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes office. There are eight members and the group is governed by a board of directors. Señora Lidia is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: carpentry, food services, a hair salon, a printing workshop, shoe sales, and juice sales.
This loan will help these small businesses. Lidia tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for nine months. She joined at the invitation of some friends who were already members. She runs a food business. It is a family business and she has been working there for years.
She will use this loan for an increase in working capital (the purchase of vegetables and meat). She will acquire these products from the wholesale stores. After making her food, she will sell it. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family. She is married and has one child.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou habite au Sénégal et évolue depuis 17 ans dans le secteur de la menuiserie. Il est marié et prend en charge les paiements des factures de meme que les charges de la dépense quotidienne. Il commence tous les jours ses activités a partir de 8 h le matin jusqu'à 18 h le soir. Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de sa localité d’habitation et a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 prévu pour la réparation de son véhicule. Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité, accroitre ses revenus et en fin parvenir a améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son vœu futur est d’être propriétaire d’une industrie de menuiserie.
texts.en: Mamadou lives in Senegal and has spent the past 17 years working in the field of carpentry. He is married and is responsible for the payment of bills as well as the daily household expenses. He begins his daily activities starting at 8:00 am and works hard until 6:00 in the evening. Mamadou is a member of his local branch of UIMCEC, where he has already fully repaid his two previous loans. He is currently requesting a loan of 300,000 XOF, which he plans to use for the repair of his vehicle. Mamadou's goal is to further develop his business, increase his revenue, and ultimately improve the health and nutrition of his family. His wish is to someday be an owner in the industry of carpentry manufacturing.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Yorsely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yorsely de 35 años, tiene una sala de belleza y planea hacer inversiones a su negocio porque comprará tintes, shampoos, enjuagues y alisadores, que son los productos que ella usa más frecuentemente en su negocio. Yorsely tiene mucha experiencia en su trabajo, porque estudió en 2 academias de belleza, y después trabajó 3 años en una peluquería, aunque hace 12 años, trabajaba  a domicilio, generaba ingresos de esta manera y con ello  poco a poco fue adquiriendo los implementos necesarios, para su propia sala de belleza. Ahora, Yorsely ofrece cortes de cabello, blower, tintes, manicures, pedicure, y también vende productos de belleza, después de asesorar profesionalmente a sus clientes en lo que tiene que ver son su imagen personal y profesional . Sus clientes son vecinos del sector y amigos que le refieren cada vez más clientes.
En la actualidad Yorsely  está aplicando a un credikiva y espera lograr con él, un mejor surtido de productos como tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, alider de cabello y  productos capilares y cosmeticos para aumentar sus ventas para  generar más ingresos. Ella sueña con brindarle un ambiente confortable a su clientela y por ello le gustaría lograr una mejor presentación de su negocio, para  finalmente  comprar una casa propia para su familia, que la integran su esposo y los gemelos de 8 años de edad.
texts.en:
Yorsely is thirty-five years old.  She has a beauty salon and plans to make investments in her business.  She will buy hair dyes, shampoos, rinses, and hair straighteners/relaxers since these are the products that she uses most frequently in her business.

Yorsely has a lot of experience in her work because she studied at two beauty schools and later worked for three years at a hairdresser's shop.  Twelve years ago, she was making house calls, generating income in this same way.  Little by little, she acquired what was needed for her own beauty salon.  

Now, Yorsely offers haircuts, blow-drying, dyes, manicures, and pedicures, and she also sells beauty products.  She professionally advises her customers on their personal and professional image.  Her customers are neighbors in the community and friends that have been referred to her, increasing  her number of customers.

Currently, Yorsely is applying for a Kiva loan and hopes to gain a better assortment of products, like dyes, shampoo, rinses, hair straighteners/relaxers, and haircare products and cosmetics to increase her sales and to generate more income.  She dreams of offering a comfortable atmosphere to her customers.  She would like to advance the image of her business so that she can finally buy her own house for her family, where she would live with her husband and eight-year-old twins.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, hair straighteners/relaxers, and haircare products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi es una joven de 19 años, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. Deysi vive al lado de sus adres a quienes apoya con el fruto de su trabajo como obrera en un fundo de su ciudad, ella debido a sus pocos recursos económicos tuvo que dejar de estudiar la carrera de ingeniería forestal, ya que no le alcanzaba para los gastos de los mismos. Pero nos comenta que se esfuerza cada día para poder salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades.

Deysi está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda de sus padres ya que colocara falso piso ya que actualmente es de tierra y ha tenido problemas de salud por ello, de esta manera ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su sueño el cual es terminar su carrera y ser el orgullo para sus padres”.
texts.en:
Deysi is a 19 year old young woman who lives in the district of Santiago in Ica, Perú. She lives with her parents whom she supports with the fruit of her labor as a worker on an estate in her city.  Due to scarce financial resources, she had to stop studying to be a forestry engineer because she was unable to meet the expenses required. However she says that she works hard every day in order to get ahead despite the problems she faces.

Deysi is very grateful to Kiva lender because, thanks to their help, she will be able to improve her parents’ home: she will install a raised floor because now there is simply a dirt one and there have been health problems because of that. 

Deysi said that she will continue struggling to make her dream a reality, which is to finish her studies one day and make her parents proud of her.

loans.use: to install a raised floor in her parents' house.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALMERAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de plásticos, venta de canastas, venta de ropa de cholita, venta de utensilio de cocina, venta de verduras y papa, venta de recogedoras de basura, elaboración de papas fritas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de unas amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de utensilios de cocina que es un negocio familiar desde hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de utensilio de cocina) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “PALMERAS”  Communal Bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes central office. There are eight members and the group is governed by a board of directors of whom Señora María Eugenia is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: plastics sales, basket sales, traditional clothing sales, kitchen utensil sales, vegetable sales, dustpan sales, and making french fries.
This loan will benefit these businesspeople. María Eugenia tells is that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of some friends who were already members. She has a business selling kitchen utensils. This business has been in her family for years.
She will use this loan for an increase of working capital (the purchase of kitchen utensils). She will buy these products from the wholesale stores and later sell them from her storefront. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a soft-drinks retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more soft drinks to sell to customers.

NWTF is re-listing Jean's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, sardines and other groceries for her variety store business.

NWTF is relisting Catalina's business profile  in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha is 32 years old, married and has four children. She resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker and her husband is a construction foreman, earning about $11 each day. Additionally, he is a fisherman who generates extra income for the family. Chantha is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase fishing equipment. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to use for fishing.

loans.name: Ma. Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ma. Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending and tricycle transportation businesses. Ma. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like bread, soft drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Ma. Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Flor De Pera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PERA”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez y nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Florentina es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de fruta, producción de verduras, venta de fruta, venta de verdura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Florentina es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que trabaja en la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción y venta de frutas; cuenta que este negocio lo ejerce hace 35 años, iniciando con un pequeño terreno aprendiendo este de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la cosecha lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella está casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor de Pera” (Pear Flower) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center.  This group consists of 19 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Florentina as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as producing fruit, producing vegetables, selling fruit, and selling vegetables.  

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, such as Sra. Florentina, who is a member of the group.  She says that this is her second loan cycle since joining Pro Mujer.  Florentina says that she received an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her house.  At the moment, she has a business that involves producing and selling fruit.  She says that she has been in this line of work for 35 years and started out with a small plot of land.  Florentina learned her trade from her parents.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used as operating capital for purchasing seeds.  She will buy the seeds at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  After her harvest, she will sell her products at the fairs.  Working in this manner enables her to support her household.  Florentina is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Florentina says that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Las Vecinas De Humachua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VECINAS DE HUMACHUA”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos: venta de abarrotes, costura, venta de fruta, venta de verduras, venta de cerveza, tienda de barrio, artesana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de polleras y mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su padres hace años y decidió realizar su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Las Vecinas de Humachua” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Focal Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board presided by Teodora.  The communal bank members have a variety of business among which are found: grocery sales, sewing, fruit sales, vegetables sales, beer sales, neighborhood store and crafts.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen one of which is Teodora.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s been part of Pro Mujer having been invited to join by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a business sewing shirts and blankets.  She relates that she learned this business from her parents years ago and decided to set up her own workshop.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She’ll buy fabric in wholesale stores and sell what she makes in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home the best way possible since she’s single and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health service.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Cojña Pampita Group

texts.es:
