loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Felista's Group

texts.en:
Felista's group is comprised of 2 hard-working women. Felista is 23 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Felista has been working hard to manage her retail shop, in which sells sugar,rice, and salt. 

To help expand her business, Felista has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more commodities such as cooking oil and sugar for resale, and will help Felista to generate greater profits and pay for school for the children. Felista hopes that in the future she will be able to develop the business. 

Felista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more commodities such as cooking oil and sugar for resale

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Sandagsuren is 33 years old, married, and has two cute boys. He lives with his family in an outer district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, which is lacking in basic infrastructure. His boys attend the local kindergarten and primary school. 

He works as a plumber at the Railway University, while his wife works at a local private company. Over the past few years, his house has become very old, and this year he plans to renovate the interior, with the help of this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate the interior of his aging home.

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en: Nyamdavaa is 32 years old, a humble, helpful and open-minded person. He lives with his mother and seven-year old daughter. His daughter, Enkhjin, attends secondary school. He has been working as a driver in a local company since 2011. He is hard worker, but his salary is not enough to support his family. He wants to increase the family income. Nyamdavaa says, “As a father, I would like to be financially able to provide a good education and meet other necessary expenses for my daughter until she is grown up. Also, I would like to expand a new business and to purchase our own apartment for my family in the future." He already paid part of the money for his minivan, but he still owes 4,000,000 MNT to the seller. The reason he is asking for this loan is to pay the rest of the money for his van. He will run a transportation business and carry people along one of the remote bus lines in Ulaanbaatar City.

loans.use: to start a new minivan business.

loans.name: Finangnon

texts.fr: Finangnon est âgé de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Finangnon est marié à Cécile, une marchande. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les divers besoins besoins du ménage.Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Finangnon mène comme activité depuis trois ans, la vente des fournitures de couture et des disques compact (CD). Finangnon s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, et d’accroître son revenu, Finangnon désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Finangnon sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Finangnon is 33 years old and lives in Benin. Finangnon is married to Cecile, a merchant. The couple has four children, all in their care. The couple lives together with their children and together takes care of the various household needs. In order to provide for the family's various expenses, Finangnon has sold sewing supplies and CDs for three years. Finangnon stocks up in Nigeria. In order to meet his customers' demands, and to increase his profits, Finangnon wants to increase his stock. To do this, Finangnon is asking for the first time for a loan from Alidé. This loan will certainly allow him to increase the level of his business and to make a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and CDs.

loans.name: Sègla Raoul

texts.fr: Sègla Raoul est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Sègla Raoul est marié à un certain Edwige. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, trois sont leurs propres enfants. Sègla Raoul vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Sègla Raoul mène comme activité depuis onze ans, l’électronique et le dépannage dans sa région. Secondairement à cette activité, Sègla Raoul vend des appareils de sonorisations et des postes téléviseurs. Sègla Raoul s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sègla Raoul sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Sègla Raoul is 34 years old and lives in Benin. Sègla Raoul is married to Edwige. The couple has four children in their care, all in school. Of the children, three are their own. Sègla Raoul lives together with his wife and children and provides for the various household expenses together with his wife. In order to provide for the family's various expenses, Sègla Raoul has worked in electronics repair for 11 years in his area. In addition to this work, Sègla Raoul sells PA systems and televisions. Sègla Raoul stocks up in Nigeria. In seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his turnover and revenue, Sègla Raoul is asking for a fourth loan from Alidé. This loan will certainly allow him to raise the level of his business and to make more profits. His previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy PA systems and televisions.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en: Ka is 42 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fried bananas and breeding pigs for more than seven years, earning approximately $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Ka is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase groceries to sell. In addition, a part of this money is used to by feed for the breeding pigs. This money will help generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husbandry business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase grocery to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This borrower would like to remain anonymous. She is a 28-year-old Iraqi woman who is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Despite her young age, she has 11 years of experience with the small sewing and tailoring activities and she is constantly looking for opportunities to improve her business. In the past she successfully took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to replace her old sewing machine and purchase fabric and raw materials. Having repaid the previous loan she now took a new loan to renew her work area and improve her work conditions.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts for her son's business selling motorbike parts.

loans.name: Fanik's Group

texts.en:
Fanik is a young Iraqi woman. She is 23 years old, married and the mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Fanik is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Fanik has two years of experience with her small home-based sewing and tailoring activity, making custom order dresses and household items made of fabric, such as curtains and drapes, sheets and towels. She would like to improve her work and take more orders. As the city has frequent and random power outages, Fanik finds it difficult to plan her work time. To be able to plan better and work more hours on the sewing machine, she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine to work with, as well as a table and a chair to make her work area a little more comfortable. To be able to pay for these purchases, Fanik took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients who are unable to provide a guarantor and who are therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine for her home-based business.

loans.name: Fanny Enriqueta

texts.es:
La señora Fanny tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos. Reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Fanny tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de alimentos y abarrotería donde vende: granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, productos de higiene y limpieza, manteca y golosinas.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar la agricultura junto a su esposo.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  préstamo por la cantidad de  10,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de carnes, embutidos, lácteos, azúcar, condimentos, refrescos y detergentes.
Considera que al surtir bien el negocio, sus clientes aumentaran junto con sus ganancias.
Ella tiene como meta agrandar el local y así poder ofrecer mas productos a su clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. Fanny is 29 years old, in a common-law relationship with her husband, and has two children. She and her family reside in a rural community in the town of Nueva Frontera, Department of Santa Barbará.

Fanny has been selling food products and groceries for two years. She sells basic grains, meats, soft drinks, hygiene and cleaning products, lard, and snack foods. Fanny previously worked as a farmer alongside her husband.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of meats, sausages, dairy products, sugar, condiments, soft drinks, and detergents. She says that if her business is well-stocked, then she will gain more customers and increase her earnings. Her goal is to expand her shop and offer more products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meats, sausages, dairy products, sugar, condiments, soft drinks, and detergents.

loans.name: Karla Susan Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora Karla Susan Edelmira esta casada, tiene 34 años de edad, con 4 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, curso la educacion secundaria, logrando graduarse como maestra de educacion primaria, inicio un negocio de pasteles, con el apoyo de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 11 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pasteles, harina, leche, huevos, saborizantes, etc, su propósito es tener mas  capital y mas en el futuro tener un local formal, ya que actualmente vende ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Karla Susan Edelmira is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children, 3 of whom attend school.  She has a high school education, and she graduated with a specialization in elementary education.  She started a cake business with the support of her parents, and she's now had 11 years of experience with it.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make cakes, including: flour, eggs, milk, flavorings, etc.  Her goal is to have more capital and eventually get her own shop, as she currently sells from place to place.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make cakes

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna is 47 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a construction worker for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman. He earns about $10 each day. Three of her children are garment workers. They earn about $10 daily. Due to lack of funds, Vanna is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to build fences for clients. This money will help her husband earn more profit. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her youngest child earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build fences for clients.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La joven  Lourdes tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera,  reside en una comunidad urbana del municipio Santa Bárbara, Departamento de Santa Bárbara.
Lourdes se ha esforzado por estudiar su educación secundaria, hace 6 meses decidió establecer su negocio de pulpería donde vende maíz, frijoles y arroz, azúcar, sopas instantáneas, carnes y productos de limpieza.
Con el propósito de surtir mas su negocio, ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad 15,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de lácteos, condimentos, embutidos, golosinas y refrescos.
Lourdes piensa que al tener surtido su negocio tendrá más oportunidades de aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias.
A futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y con las utilidades lograr completar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 22, is single and lives in an urban community in the municipality of Santa Bárbara, which is in the department of Santa Bárbara.  

Lourdes worked hard to get her high school education.  Six months ago, she decided to start up a grocery store business where she sells corn, beans, rice, sugar, instant soups, meat and cleaning products.

She decided to request a loan for 15,000 Honduran lempiras so that she could stock up her store with more products.  She plans to use the loan to buy dairy products, condiments, sausages, snacks and beverages.

Lourdes thinks that if she can stock up her store, she will have an opportunity to increase her sales and earnings.

In the future, Lourdes wants to expand her business and use the profits to complete a university degree.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, staple consumer goods such as grains, snacks, common medications, and personal and household cleaning products

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells soft drinks and water.

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to upgrade her stock and buy more lemonade and juice for resale, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and support the family needs. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to to work hard and build a house.

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to upgrade her stock and buy more lemonade and juice for resale.

loans.name: Ilsen Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Ilsen tiene 21 años y tiene  2 hijos que son de las edades de 4 y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior variedad de lencería, su puesto se encuentra en una de las zonas más concurridas  de la ciudad de Santa Cruz este préstamo es su octava secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Ilsen  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería por mayor para su negocio su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería le gusto mucho la atención que le dimos y la forma en que Kiva trabaja, la Sra. Ilsen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia aun así no pierde ánimo para sacar adelante a su familia,  va a utilizar los beneficios comprando mas ropa de interior debido a que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año, habrá más demanda y así de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos, lo  único que ella quiere es que sus hijos progresen y estén sanitos ya que su mayor preocupación es su familia.
texts.en:
Ilsen, 21, has 2 children aged 4 and 8.  She has a business selling a variety of underwear and lingerie.  She has a stall located in one of the busiest areas in the city of Santa Cruz.  This will be her 8th loan with the institution.  Ilsen will use this loan to buy merchandise at wholesale for her business. The reason she is requesting a loan is that she lacks the capital to buy merchandise for her business.  

Ilsen really likes the attention that we give her, and the way that Kiva works.  Ilsen faces challenges in her business such as the competition.  However, she never loses the drive to get ahead with her family.  She will use the profits to buy more undergarments, as the end-of-year festivities are approaching which will mean more demand.  This way, she can increase her income.  

The only thing that Ilsen wants is for her children to advance in life and be healthy, because her main concern is for her family.

loans.use: to buy lingerie at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy equipment for making furniture.

loans.name: Ruth Ann

texts.en:
Ruth Ann is 56, married and has four children. You never see in her face that she has a problem or difficulties in life. She keeps on smiling even when she carries burdens. Through farming and a retail business, she is able to send her children to school. Three of them are degree holders and have their own jobs. Ruth Ann is striving to help her youngest child, who is graduating, take an information technology course. Even though she is financially supported by her children, she doesn’t want to rely on them.
Ruth Ann is determined to gain additional income aside from the retailing of canned goods, soft drinks and spices. So, she is also selling fashion accessories like bracelets, earrings, necklaces and rings to her costumers. At present, Ruth Ann has many costumers buying her accessories because of their good quality. Sometimes she cannot respond quickly to her costumers demand because she is lacking capital. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy materials for Swarovski jewelry making. She hopes to sell more and earn more. She looks toward the success of the business and children as well.

loans.use: to buy material for Swarovski jewelry making.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 57-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She is engaged in a buy-and-sell RTW (ready-to-wear) business. She sells t-shirts, pants, blouses, and shorts for both men and women. She has been in this business for five years and earns 3000 pesos a month.

Conchita requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as t-shirts, shorts, pants, and blouses. 

Conchita would like to invest to other business ventures to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts, shorts, blouses, and pants to sell.

loans.name: Dlxwaz's Group

texts.en:
Dlxwaz is a 37-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children. She is a hairdresser and has her own beauty salon for hair and make-up. She has seven years experience with the business and has built a nice clientele. 

Dlxwaz knows the importance of keeping her customers satisfied as well as the importance of offering new, modern services to stay competitive in the city. As such, she is constantly making improvements. In the past, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to buy an air conditioning unit and  to replace the tables in the salon. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, she now is seeking a new loan to make further improvements to the salon and to buy a facial steamer and some raw materials.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve the salon and to buy a facial steamer and some raw materials

loans.name: Gabi

texts.en:
Gabi is a 60-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been a specialist repairing car bodies for 50 years. Gabi was only 10 years old when he first started working, not having a normal childhood like others. He works hard to provide for his family's needs. Gabi's work is hard and needs an increased physical effort. He is getting old which is why he must do his best now to increase his income to insure his old-age living needs. Gabi always dreams to improve his work, so he requested a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. With the loan capital, he will be able to buy a used car that needs to be repaired and sell it. This will help him to start a small car-trading business. He'll also buy spare parts and special tools for his business.
His wide experience with Al Majmoua loans and in his business has brought him positive outcomes. Gabi is grateful for Kiva and Al Majmoua for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy a used car that needs to be repaired and sell it to start a small car-trading business.

loans.name: Katan's Group

texts.en:
Katan is a 33 year-old married Iraqi woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Katan is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has five years experience with the small home-based business activity. To be able to offer better quality products and a variety of services to her customers, she would like to replace her sewing machine for a newer one and buy some quality fabrics and raw materials. To pay for these purchases she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replace her sewing machine for a newer one and buy some quality fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Kuña Joaju, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora  Dila.  Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con once integrantes, donde todas ellas quieren poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra. Dila tiene una despensa, y comenta que por medio de su negocio ayuda a su familia y tiene para poder darles todo lo que necesitan. Ella es muy sacrificada y cuenta que todo lo que tiene ha sido por medio de su sacrificio. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas y comestibles para su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Joaju" committee was formed on the initiative of Señora Dila. This is their first loan and, with eleven members, they all want to be able to reach the highest level of the program. 

Señora Dila has a grocery store, and says that through her business she helps her family and has enough to be able to give them everything they need. She is very selfless and says that everything she has is due to her sacrifice. She is asking for this loan to buy food and drink for her business.

loans.use: to buy food and drink.

loans.name: Suma's Group

texts.en:
Suma is 24 years old and a married Iraqi married woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Suma is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has two years experience with the little home-based sewing and tailoring business which she would like to improve. In addition to replacing her old sewing machine she would also like to buy an embroidery machine to offer a larger selection of services to her customers and use more creativity with her customer orders. To be able to make these purchases and pay for the machines, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. 

All three members of this group are under 30, so this qualifies as a "youth loan."

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replacing her old sewing machine and buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda loves to plant vegetables and considered it her hobby. Her hobby led her to make it a business. She started planting vegetables in their backyard until she realized that her income from vegetable vending is good. Then she decided to plant vegetables on a small portion of their farm. She is now 45 years of age and still operates the business.  
Imelda raises her three children and sustains their needs in school through her business. She needs to apply exact amounts of fertilizer to her vegetables so they grow faster and have good production. Imelda wants to borrow PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer and pay for the cost of labor in thinning the grass. She hopes to have better production and great earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the cost of labor in thinning the grass.

loans.name: Srey Nak

texts.en: Srey Nak is 28 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband has an umbrella rental in the market. He earns about $5 a day. Srey Nak is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase timbers to build a new house. This money will help her obtain a convenient house for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build a new house

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 20 years old.  He is single and lives with four family members, one of whom is employed.  Abdallah owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2009 and now he has an employee. He built a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to install an external ceiling for the shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling for the shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Burgilmaa

texts.en: Burgilmaa is a 45 year-old woman who lives with her husband, daughter and grand-daughter in their own apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2006, she has been supplying goods upon order to the largest department store, Nomin, in Ulaanbaatar. Her apartment is very small. She planned to build her daughter a new house with wall insulation and to install an electric heating panel to assist or replace the coal-fired stove in winter. Now she needs to buy some building materials and an electric heating panel for building her daughter's house.

loans.use: to buy some building materials and an electric heating panel for building her daughter's house.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Sokchea, 37, is married and has five children. She grows rice as the main business for the family’s income, while her husband complements the family’s income by working as a paid construction worker in the local area. Having been in the business for ten years, they can earn about 15,000KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs, and manage to save about 3,000KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Sokchea is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 160,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine for her family’s use. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine for an improved life.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a proper latrine

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is from Iraq. He is 24, single and lives alone.

Zakariya owns a mobile phone shop where he also sells phone accessories. He opened his business in 2011 and now has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Zakariya is applying for a 1200 USD youth loan through ACSI to buy an air-conditioner and more shelves for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his parents and family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and more shelves for his shop.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La señora Rosalía es nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, vive actualmente en la zona Guaracal,  Ella sigue con la actividad de eloaboracion y venta  de pan casero y empanadas, y los comercializa en su mismo domicilio y también reparte a diferentes tiendas de su zona ya que es muy conocida por la buena calidad de sus productos, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior credito ya que el horno le fue de mucha utilidad y en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de harina y mateca para la elaboracion de sus riquisimos panes y empanadas.
texts.en: Rosalía was born in the city of Santa Cruz but currently lives in the Guaracal zone.  She continues with her activity of making and selling home-made bread and turnovers.  She sells them at home and also delivers them to various stores in her zone because she’s well-known for the good quality of her products.  She relates that she did very well with the previous loan because the oven was of great use to her.  On this occasion she requests the loan to buy flour and shortening to make her delicious bread and turnovers.

loans.use: to buy flour and shortening.

loans.name: Edgar Leonidas

texts.es: Edgar vive en la ciudad de Machala provincia de El Oro, El tiene 50 años de edad. Actualmente se encuentra soltero no tiene hijos. Edgar por la falta de empleo que enfrenta el país no podía conseguir un trabajo estable pero un día el mejor amigo lo llevo a vender productos medicinal llamado HERBALIFE. Ahora está en esta empresa de productos naturales. El trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos HERBALIFE y arreglar su casa. Su meta es tener un local propio para la venta de sus productos
texts.en: Edgar lives in the city of Machala in El Oro Province.  He’s 50-years-old.  He’s single and has no children.  Because of the lack of employment opportunities in the country he had been unable to find a stable job so one day his best friend took him to sell a medicinal product called Herbalife.  Now, he’s part of this natural products firm.  He works Monday through Saturday from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon.  He wants to use the loan to buy Herbalife products and to fix his house.  His goal is to have his own locale in which to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years Shamim has been working hard to manage her food business, selling food like matooke (a Ugandan plantain dish) and sweet potatoes.

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more matooke and cassava and will help Shamim to generate greater profits and buy more basic needs. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to grow the business.

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more matooke and cassava for her food business.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 19 years.  He is single and lives with a family of three members, two of whom are employed. 
Haidar is a photographer. He started working in this field in 2006 and after having a good experience, he established his own business. He now has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $1500 Youth loan to paint the store and buy some materials specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to paint the store and buy some materials specialized for his work.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Juliet has been working hard to manage her salon, which sells hair pieces and cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire more material to run the business, such as hair extensions, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and pay for her needs. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to sustain the family. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to acquire more material such as hair extensions, to expand the business.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An was born in 1969. She has two children who are a student and a soldier. Her husband is a worker. His salary is about 4,000,000 VND. An raises chickens to earn a living. Her salary is about 3,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 
	She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy food for raising chickens. She wants to use the benefits to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy food for raising chickens.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Victor vive en la ciudad de Machala de la provincia de El Oro es soltero no tiene hijos. La necesidad económica que había en su hogar y la falta de empleo  en el país,  tomo la decisión de comenzar con un negocio independiente. En la actualidad Victor es comerciante ya que sale todas las mañanas a una escuela cerca de su sector y afuera de esa escuela vende sus productos como revista, cuadernos, adornos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar revistas, cuadernos, etc. Su meta es tener un local propio para vender su mercadería.
texts.en: Victor lives in the city of Machala in El Oro Province.  He’s single and has no children.  The economic need at home and the lack of employment opportunities in the country led him to start his own business.  He’s a merchant who goes out every morning to sell products like magazines, notebooks and decorations outside a nearby school in his neighborhood.  He wants to use the loan to buy magazines, notebooks, etc.  His goal is to have his own locale to sell his products in.

loans.use: to buy magazines and notebooks.

loans.name: Nubia Vicenta

texts.es: Nubia tiene 40 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hijos de 10 años que estudia en una escuela pública por su sector. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer emprendedora es por eso que dio la apertura a su negocio de venta de cosméticos. Ella trabaja sola de 8 de la mañana hasta la 5 de la tarde.  La forma de trabajo es recorrer diversos lugares de la ciudad ofertando los productos entre amigos y conocidos. Nubia  por el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en cuanto a la delincuencia y espera poder continuar de esta manera. Con el crédito piensa comprar, artículos de belleza como labiales, sombras, perfumes, cremas etc. Su sueño es poder tener un local propio de venta de cosméticos
texts.en: Nubia, 40, is married and has a ten-year-old son attending a local public school.  She’s always been an enterprising woman which is why she opened her business selling cosmetics.  She works alone from 8am until 5pm.  She works going to various places in the city offering her products among friends and acquaintances.  For the moment, Nubia has had no problems associated with crime and hopes to continue this way.  She’s thinking of buying beauty products like lipstick, eye shadow, perfume, creams, etc. with the loan.  Her dream is to have her own shop to sell cosmetics in.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, 46, is married and has three children who are students. For the past sixteen years her husband and she have sold seed, fertilizer and pesticides to farmers to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,500,000 VND a month.

Hue has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In her last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy more fertilizer, seed and pesticides to sell in her store.

Hue wants to use her profits to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticides to sell in her store.

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en: Batsuren is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter of three months. He has a job in a local company. He was doing the job for three years. However, the salary was not enough for his and his family's needs. He decided to quit his job and started his own taxi business. His business is growing well, and the income is increasing lately. He said it is more profitable than the fixed salary. He is a very hardworking and honest person who always cares for his family. He needs to keep his car in good condition so that he can continue to earn a living. Therefore, he is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order for him to make the necessary repairs and to replace parts on his car.

loans.use: to make the necessary repairs to his car and to replace parts.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family. Imad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2002 and now he has an employee. He built a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3000 loan to renovate the shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Juliet is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Juliet has been working hard to manage her salon, which involves hair styling and cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire more materials to run the salon, such as hair extensions, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and pay for her needs. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to sustain a family. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to acquire more materials to run the business, such as hair extensions.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men was born in 1959. She has three children. The oldest child has gotten married. One child is a carpenter, and one child is an electrician. Her husband raises doves. His income is about 2,500,000 VND. Men raises poultry to earn a living. She has done this job for 25 years. She gains from it 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Men has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the most recent loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for raising chickens and ducks. She always wants to enlarge her poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy food for raising chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 39, is married and has two children. He is the only provider for his family.

In 2006 Ali began work as a shoemaker. Six years later he is now experienced in this field and has earned a good reputation in his local community. He has an employee.

Ali is requesting an 1800 USD loan from ASCI to buy a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past two years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to get more clothes to sell, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and expand business so that profits will go to pay school fees. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to get more clothes to sell

loans.name: Alba Carmita

texts.es: Alba tiene 57 años de edad es madre soltera tiene hijos mayores  de edad que  son independientes. Cuando  su ex pareja la abandono ella tuvo que ver la manera de cómo llevar los gastos de su hogar y fue entonces ya hace 15 años atrás que decidió implementar una tienda de víveres en general ya que por  su barrio  no había ninguna tienda de  víveres. En la actualidad ella trabaja de lunes a domingo de 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 e la noche. Con el préstamo Alba comprara arroz, aceite, azúcar etc. Su meta es poder tener un mini market para así poder incrementar sus clientes
texts.en: Alba is 57 years old. She is a single mother and has adult children who are independent. When her ex-husband abandoned her, she had to find a way to meet the household expenses, and it was then, already 15 years ago, that she decided to set up a store selling groceries in general, since there was no grocery store in her neighborhood. She presently works from Monday to Sunday from 8 in the morning to 9 in the evening. With the loan, Alba will buy rice, oil, sugar, etc. Her goal is to be able to have a mini market so that she can thus increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, etc for her store

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y su pequeña hija de dos años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Miriam no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar para ayudar a su madre en la crianza de su ganado.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Miriam se dedica a la ganadería, ella  cuenta con 4 vacas reproductoras y 1 vaquillona, las cuales alimenta y cuida con mucha dedicación, adicionalmente vende leche, Miriam se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable.
Miriam se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vaca; de esta manera Miriam espera poder aumentar su ganado y en poco tiempo desea poder tener un establo grande, así pues Miriam espera poder lograr su sueño de tener su propia línea de productos lácteos y poder darle la educación necesaria para que su pequeña hija algún día sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Miriam, 19, is a young woman living in the city of Cañete in Imperial District with her parents and little two-year-old daughter who she loves and is her reason to live.   She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Unfortunately, Miriam was unable to study a professional career because she had to start working very young helping her mother raise cattle.

With much effort and dedication and thanks to support from her mother, Miriam works in animal husbandry.  She has four breeding cows and one heifer she feeds and cares for with much dedication.  She also sells milk.  Miriam feels good doing her work and believes she does well because she’s very responsible.

Miriam is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a cow so Miriam will increase her herd size; she’d like to have a large stable in a short period of time so she can reach her dream of having her own line of dairy products and be able to provide her little girl with the necessary education for her to become a good professional someday.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Norberto Wilfrido

texts.es: Norberto tiene 49 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos. El hace 10 años atrás recibió un curso de electricidad y fue ahí donde aprendió todo lo referente a las cosas de ferretería por lo que ahora dio la apertura a un local  de ferretería. Con el préstamo quiere comprar martillo, cemento, llaves etc. Su sueño es tener una familia e imcrementar su negocio para aumentar su clientela.
texts.en: Norberto, 49, is single and has no children.  Ten years ago he took a course in electricity and that’s where he learned everything related to hardware and now he’s opened a hardware store.  He wants to use the loan to buy hammers, cement, wrenches, etc.  His dream is to have a family and expand the business to have more customers.

loans.use: to buy a hammers, cement, wrenches, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Veronica esta soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, cursó los grados de educacion secundaria, graduada como contadora, se dedica al comercio específicamente a la comercialización de útiles escolares, inicio este negocio como dependiente de mostrador y hasta  el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mercadería, consistente en productos para Liberia: papelería y útiles, cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, cartulina, etc. Espera en el futuro contar con una super librería y con todo lo necesario, y así tener muchos clientes.
texts.en: Rosa Veronica’s single.  She’s 23-years-old and attended secondary school.  She graduated as an accountant and works in commerce, specifically selling school supplies.  She started this business as a counter employee and to date has two years’ experience.  She’s requesting a loan to buy merchandise consistent with bookstore products: stationery supplies and school supplies, notebooks, books, pencils, construction paper, etc.  She hopes in future to have a super bookstore stocked with everything necessary and thus have many customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar, 43, is married and has four children. He is the only provider for his family.

In 2010 Haidar opened a small grocery store where he sells soft drinks, juices, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He is now experienced and has earned a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from ASCI to pay the annual rent on his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his shop.

loans.name: Mayra Irene

texts.es: Mayra tiene 28 años de edad es casada tiene 1  hijo que estudia en un colegio público cerca de su casa. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio de su ciudad. El esposo de de Mayra le abrió un negocio en su casa el cual es una tienda de venta de víveres. Ella trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las  8 de la mañana  hasta  las 9 de la noche. Con el préstamo  comprara arroz, azúcar, aceite. Su meta es tener una casa propia y que su negocio siga creciendo
texts.en: Mayra, 28, is married and has a son attending a local public school near her house.  Her husband works for the city.  Mayra’s husband opened a home-based grocery store.  She works Monday to Sunday from 8am until 9pm.  She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and oil.  Her goal is to own a house and that the business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz tiene 58 años de edad es casada tiene hijos que son mayores de edad que son independientes. Luz comenzó hace 10 años atrás en ponerse una tienda por su sector ya que vio la necesidad de sus vecinos por lo que no había ninguna tienda. Ella comenzó vendiendo atún, aceite, colas. El sueño de Luz es tener un mini market . Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar víveres en general como  aceite, azúcar, arroz, etc.
texts.en: Luz, 58, is married and has children who are now independent adults.  Luz started ten years ago with a neighborhood store because she noticed her neighbors’ need because there were no stores around.  She started off selling tuna, oil and soft-drinks.  Luz’s dream is to have a minimart.  She wants to use the loan to buy foodstuffs like oil, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 69 años y desde que era pequeño comenzó a trabajar en las fincas de café de su padre. A la edad de 23 años se casó con Agueda y a los 24 años se independizó por completo de su padre para poder producir su propio café. Antonio y Agueda son socios de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco”, organización en la cual entregan toda su producción de café año con año para que sea procesada y exportada. Para la siguiente cosecha Antonio necesita un crédito para realizar labores de limpieza en sus fincas. Este crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha. Antonio y su esposa cuentan con un vivero de café en el que producen la planta que siembran en sus fincas. Pasando la cosecha le gustaría invertir en su vivero para poder ampliarlo y así poder vender planta de café a los productores de la región.
texts.en:
Antonio, 69, began to work on his father's coffee farms when he was young.  At the age of 23 he married Agueda and at 24 he became completely independent from his father so he could grow his own coffee.  Antonio and Agueda are members of Unión Regional de Huatusco, an organization to which they deliver their entire coffee production every year to be processed and exported.

For the next harvest Antonio needs a loan to clear the weeds from his farms.  He'll pay back the loan at the end of the harvest.

Antonio and his wife have a coffee nursery where they produce the plant they grow on their farms.  After the harvest he would like to invest in his nursery to be able to expand it and sell coffee plants to the producers in the area.

loans.use: to clear weeds from his farms

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 43-year-old woman from Albur, Bohol. She is a single mom with two kids. The eldest child is 7 years, while the youngest is two months old. She operates a store selling Avon products, like lotion, perfume, deodorant and powdered soap. In addition to selling Avon products, she sells load (prepaid cell phone minutes) to customers who use the Smart, Sun and Globe networks. She also raises hogs. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to finance all of her businesses:  she will purchase more Avon products, acquire more load to sell, and buy more piglets to raise. Esterlita would like to expand her business in the future, by investing in other business ventures.  She wants to meet the needs of her two children, as well as to save for their education.

loans.use: to purchase Avon products, buy piglets to raise, and acquire load (prepaid cell phone minutes) to resell.

loans.name: Layitan Pascaline

texts.fr: Layitan Pascaline est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Layitan Pascaline a peu fréquenté l’école. Layitan Pascaline est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Layitan Pascaline mène comme activité depuis dix huit années, la coiffure dans son atelier. De façon secondaire, Layitan Pascaline vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Layitan Pascaline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Layitan Pascaline sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Layitan Pascaline is 38 years old and lives in Benin. Layitan Pascaline didn't complete much schooling. Layitan Pascaline is married to a man named Pierre. The couple has four children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are in their care. In order to provide for the various needs of the family, Layitan Pascaline has worked as a hairdresser in her studio for 18 years. On the side, Layitan Pascaline sells hair extensions and cosmetics. Layitan Pascaline stocks up in a city in Benin. In seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and her revenue, Layitan Pascaline is asking for a fourth loan from Alidé. This loan will certainly allow her to raise the level of her business and to increase her profits. Her previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Félicité Lydia

texts.fr: Félicité Lydia est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Félicité Lydia ne vit plus avec son mari. Félicité Lydia est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Félicité Lydia vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses divers besoins. Afin d’assurer ses diverses charges, Félicité Lydia mène comme activité depuis dix huit ans, la coiffure dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Félicité Lydia vend des mèches et des tissus. Félicité Lydia s’approvisionne dans des villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Félicité Lydia sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Félicité Lydia is 44 years old and lives in Benin. Félicité Lydia doesn't live with her husband anymore. Félicité Lydia is the mother of three children, all in school. Félicité Lydia lives alone with her children and provides for their needs by herself. In order to provide for her various expenses, Félicité Lydia has worked as a hairdresser in her studio for 10 years. Concurrently with this business, Félicité Lydia sells hair extensions and fabric. Félicité Lydia stocks up in cities in Benin. In seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and revenues, Félicité Lydia is asking for a fourth loan from Alidé. This loan will certainly allow her to raise the level of her business and increase her profits. Her previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and fabric.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen was born in 1971. She has two grown children, who are working as a soldier and a laborer. Her husband is a porter and an iron worker. His income is about 6,000,000 VND. Yen raises chickens to earn a living. She gains from it 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.
 
Yen has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the most recent loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for raising chickens. She wants to use her profit to enlarge her chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy food for raising chickens.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Robert is an agriculturalist with a dry produce business he has been running for four years. He began this enterprise with capital obtained from growing maize and beans. Robert says that inadequate capital is the factor most affecting his business.

Robert is requesting this loan to buy maize and beans to sell. He dreams of buying a car to help in the transportation of produce to bigger markets and constructing a house in which to reside.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix up her family's home.

loans.name: Wilfrido Leonardo

texts.es: Wilfrido vive en las Orquideas sector norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil . Está  casado no tiene hijos. Su esposa trabaja vendiendo gaseosas, agua desde su casa. Wilfrido comenzó hace 7 años  vendiendo llavero  con un grupo de amigos. En la actualidad el se independizo y ahora los vende solo, una de sus mayores dificultades es la competencia que existe, pero él sigue adelante. Con el préstamo el quiere comprar imágenes, telas, cordones, llaveros etc. Su meta es arreglar su casa y comprarse una impresora para imprimir las imágenes para así poder vende más llaveros.
texts.en: Wilfredo lives in the Orquideas area north of the city of Guayaquil.  He is married but does not have children.  His wife works selling soda and water from their home.  Seven years ago Wilfrido began selling keychains with a group of friends.  At present, he has become independent and sells them by himself.  One of his greatest difficulties is the competition that exists, but he continues to move ahead.  With the loan he wants to buy pictures, fabric, cord, key rings, etc.  His goal is to repair his house and buy a printer in order to print the pictures so he can sell more keychains.

loans.use: to buy pictures, fabric, cord, key rings, etc

loans.name: Nyaibanda Savings & Credit Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 47-year-old, married man who has five children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main business is farming, which he does for eight hours per day, six days a week. He has been farming for five years. Peter also buys and sells goats and cows, as an additional source of income. Like most farmers, he has challenges that affect the outcome of his efforts -- for example, price fluctuations and unpredictable weather. His personal goal is to educate his children up to the university, while his business dream is to buy land and farm extensively. 

Peter intends to use the loan facility to pay workers who are cultivating his land, and to buy seeds for planting. He is a member of the above-mentioned group, where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to pay workers to cultivate his land and to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Art's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched-roof house in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Art is aged 37 years and married. She has four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers, who have been in farming on 2 hectares of farmland to make a living for ten years. From the current business, she is able to earn about KHR 14,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Art’s group consists of five members who live in the same village and she is in her first loan with VisionFund. Now leading her group to seek for a loan of KHR 200,000 each, Art will use her portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use so as to improve a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
Karar is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 24 years, single, and lives with a family of seven members, one of who is employed.

Karar owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He differentiated his business by adding frozen meat. He established his business in 2004 and now he has an employee. He built good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Kimeang's Group

texts.en:
Kimeang is a 28-year-old farmer who lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Bovel district of Battambang province. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She has been growing rice on one hectare of farmland. Having been in this occupation for eight years, she is able to earn almost 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Kimeang’s group consists of two members who are first-cycle clients with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan of 200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a latrine, including a latrine bowl and tile draining. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a healthy latrine for her family's use so as to create a hygienic standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a latrine.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is from Martvili district of West Georgia. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two infant grandchildren. Madona works as a physics teacher, and her daughter-in-law is an English teacher at the local school. Both of them get a monthly salary. Besides her main job, Madona is involved in agricultural business. In particular, she grows nuts and different kinds of vegetables on the family-owned land. The family owns a vineyard as well. They pick the grapes in the late summer and sell them locally. In addition, Madona runs a small dairy farm, and with the received milk she produces cheese products, which are sold in their village. She works hard to do her best for the family.

She requested a loan to purchase a car. Madona and her husband will use it for taking their harvested products and cheese to nearby villages, where they can sell them. This will significantly decrease their costs of transportation, and as a result the family will be able to make some savings for house renovation. Madona awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use in her agriculture business, transporting farm products to markets.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 39-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. For four years he has been dealing in phone accessories and with the income earned he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. Since the government is in support of digital migration the business is very lucrative and his dream is to expand to new areas and also build a permanent house for residence. Gerald is requesting a loan to purchase more phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, vive con su familia actualmente, el solicito un préstamo para la comprar de insumos. El desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café  para que permanezcan en buenas condiciones, y finalmente obtener un producto de buena calidad. Este  agricultor que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado encaminar su proyecto con mucho éxito hasta el día de hoy y de el cual dependen para salir adelante, no dispone del dinero necesario para la compra de estos, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Leonel is 38 years old, married, has 5 children, and lives with his family. He is requesting a loan to buy inputs for his coffee trees. Leonel wants to assist his coffee trees so that they can remain in good condition and produce a crop of good quality at harvest. 

This farmer, who with much effort and dedication has managed to undertake a very successful project up to the present, depends on his coffee crop to get ahead. But Leonel lacks the money necessary to purchase these supplies, and for that reason, he is requesting a loan. This will be his 1st loan with FUDECOSUR. Leonel has no other loans with state banks, and FUDECOSUR will offer the loan with the best facilities and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: buy inputs to boost his coffee crop.

loans.name: Eva Catarina

texts.es:
La señora Eva Catarina es madre soltera, tiene 40 de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijos el cual esta estudiando, se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, para hombre y mujeres, inicio este negocio gracia a que tenia necesidad de contar con ingreso para su sostenimiento familiar, y hasta ahora lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para ampliar su negocio de venta de cosméticos, de las marcas AVON, LeCleire y Scentia, espera en el futuro tener un capital mayor y una tienda con local formal.
texts.en:
Señora Eva Catarina is a single mother. She is 40 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has one son who is in school. She sells cosmetics for men and women. She began this business since she needed to have an income to sustain her family, and so far she has had four years of experience.

She is applying for a loan that she will use to expand her business of selling Avon, LeCleire, and Scentia brand cosmetics. In the future she hopes to have bigger capital and a store with a formal location.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Akimou

texts.fr: Akimou est âgé de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Akimou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Akimou est marié à un certain Mariam. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés. Akimou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Akimou mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, le dépannage. De façon secondaire à cette activité, Akimou vend de l’huile de palme. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Akimou sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Akimou is 38 years old and lives in Benin.  He did not attend school.  He is married to a woman named Mariam.  The couple has four children, some of whom are in school.  Akimou lives with his wife and children and shares the household expenses with his wife.

In order to cover the various expenses of the family, Akimou has been working as a repairman for about ten years.  In addition to this activity, he also sells palm oil.

Eager to meet the needs of his customers and to increase his turnover and income, Akimou is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.  This loan will surely help him to boost his level of activity and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy cans of palm oil.

loans.name: Christian N.

texts.en: Christian, 31, is a single parent and lives in West Point with her three children. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 15. She would like to provide the best education to her children, but lacks the financial support. For the past five years she has been selling Lapper (country cloth) at the market. She received the initial capital from her husband to start this business, and she learned to sell from her mother. She makes a profit when she sells. With the profit generated from the business she buys more goods and attends to her children's needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Lapper (country cloth) for the business. Her plan is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more Lapper (country cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Ms. Tasleem is a 52-year-old married woman with eight family members in her house. Her husband runs a fruit and vegetable vendor business and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past year. She offers various goods for daily use, such as cleansing products and grocery items. She knows the art of retaining customers and enjoys dealing with them. 

Tasleem is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. She has gradually improved her business through the support of the Kashf Foundation, and she has been in association with Kashf for seven years.  Currently, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to fully stock her store with grocery items, such as grains, sugar and flour. This will enable her to cater to more customers repeatedly, which will ultimately improve her earnings.  She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as grains, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Ms. Tahira is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She runs a small shop of bangles and jewelery items with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Tahira’s husband.  She always has a great collection of jewelery to offer, and she is quite familiar with the tastes and demands of her customers. Tahira operates from 10 am until 8 pm every day except Sunday. Her husband also assists her in his free time so that she can manage to perform the household activities as well.  

She has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more packs of bangles in different colors and jewelery items, such as earnings, rings, etc. In this way she would able to increase her net income through increased sales. She dreams of expanding her business and providing a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To buy more packs of bangles in different colors and jewelery items, such as earnings, rings, etc.

loans.name: Nooshaba

texts.en: Ms. Nooshaba is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Nooshaba’s husband. They have 15 years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market where he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy more packs of salt, biscuits and beverages for the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en: Ms. Sabreen is a 46-year-old married woman.  She has excelled in the business of hand embroidery for 17 years. Her husband is a property dealer. She also encouraged her mother-in-law to join her business; both of them are earning 8,000 PKR per month. Sabreen has become famous for providing unique embroidery designs and patterns to her customers.  The income earned from this business is spent on the education of her four children who all attend school. With the support of Kashf she has increased her monthly income. To cope with the orders of her customers, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase raw materials, such as reels of thread and packs of sequins, pearls and glittery material. She dreams of providing her children with a good quality education to enable a prosperous future.

loans.use: To purchase raw material, such as reels of thread and packs of sequins, pearls and glittery material.

loans.name: Isiah

texts.en: Isiah wants to invest in his existing business. He is a dedicated man who does not believe in failure. He sells tree seedlings and has been selling them for several years.  Isiah is requesting a loan to buy more seedlings for his business to sell. He has a good testimony for his previous loan. It greatly transformed his living standards and he can now enjoy the benefits of the business.

loans.use: to purchase tree seedlings

loans.name: Lucila Maribel

texts.es:
Lucila vive en la ciudad de Ica, tiene 33 años de edad y es una joven con muchas ganas de vivir y sobre todo demostrar que puede salir adelante a pesar de la adversidad, Lucila es madre soltera, cada día le brinda todo su amor a sus 2 hijos a los cuales adora y sobre todo daría la vida para poder darles una vida digna y hacerlos personas de bien. Día a día Lucila trabaja con mucho esmero en su pequeño negocio  de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día en su negocio desde hace ya 4 años y se siente muy orgullosa y contenta con lo que hace por ello ella cree que le va muy bien en el negocio.

Lucila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como leche enlatada al por mayor, azúcar, fideo, arroz por saco, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in the city of Ica. She is 33 years old, and she is a young woman with a great will to live and above all to show that she can advance in spite of adversity. Lucila is a single mother. Every day she offers all her love to her two children, whom she adores, and above all she would give her life to be able to give them a life of dignity and raise them to be good people. Day after day Lucila works with much effort in her little grocery business. For four years now, she has worked about eight hours a day in her business, and she feels very proud and happy with what she does. For this reason, she believes that things are going very well for her in her business.

Lucila is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the great help that they have offered her, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as wholesale canned milk, sugar, pasta, and rice by the sack, among other items. In this way she will be able to have a greater variety of products and improve her income. Thus she will continue striving to make her greatest dream a reality: "to give a good education to her children and improve their quality of life."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (canned milk wholesale, sugar, pasta, rice by the sack, and other items) for her store

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Ms. Sadia is a 25-year-old married woman with five family members in her house. Her husband is running a small business and earns insufficient income to support his family. She has been successfully running a beauty parlor at the corner of her house for the past 2 years. She is very familiar with the techniques of makeup and hair styling, which is why the number of her customers is increasing day by day. However, Sadia is facing difficulties in catering to her customers due to a shortage of products and basic tools.  For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation for the first time to purchase more packs of cleansers, makeup kits and hair rollers. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to meet her parlor requirements. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To purchase more packs of cleansers, makeup kits and hair rollers.

loans.name: Sylvie Ayodélé

texts.fr: Mariée à un imprimeur du nom de Loth, Sylvie Ayodélé est âgée de 40 ans. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Sylvie Ayodélé et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Sylvie Ayodélé a peu fréquenté l’école.
