Il y a près de quinze ans que Sylvie Ayodélé vend divers articles et des fournitures scolaires à son domicile. Sylvie Ayodélé exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sylvie Ayodélé s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sylvie Ayodélé sollicite un deuxième crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le prêt antérieur reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Sylvie Ayodélé is 40 years old and married to Loth, who works in a print shop.  The couple has five children, some of whom go to school.  All five children are their dependents.  Sylvie Ayodélé lives with her children and husband and shares with him the various household expenses. 

Sylvie Ayodélé didn't complete much schooling.  She has now been selling various goods and school supplies from her home, for almost fifteen years.

She is passionate about her activity, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children.  She buys her goods locally.

Eager to meet the needs of her customers, she is requesting a second loan.  This loan will help her to better meet her customers' expectations and to make more profits.  Her previous loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy various goods and some school supplies.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan is 34 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has worked in a massage shop for more than five years, earning approximately $6 a day. Her husband is a fisherman who earns about $5 a day. To improve her family’s finances, Chan is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help her husband generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a tuk tuk, a motorized rickshaw, to use in their transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
For the past three years, Jorge has worked as an independent practitioner offering emotional and psychological counseling for educational institutions. He is often consulted by the judicial system to counsel inmates. Prior to this, he worked for 14 years with multiple schools and colleges in his hometown of El Paso. 

As the second youngest of nine children, Jorge says that, ever since he can remember, he has always been interested in people and curious as to why humans act the way they do. He received a master’s degree in counseling from the University of Texas at El Paso before working with different agencies. Then, he decided to venture out on his own to allow for a flexible schedule and larger financial opportunities. 

As opposed to other counselors, Jorge says he offers to work nights and weekends. “I don’t like to pull kids out of school,” he says. He doesn’t recall how many people he’s worked with, but says he currently sees 35 patients weekly and employs a biller. This Accion Texas Inc. loan is Jorge’s third with the non-profit microlender. He is using the funds for working capital, gas expenses and supplies.

Jorge’s business doesn’t have a website, social media page or even a mention in the city’s phone book, but successfully operates on word of mouth from people like probation officers and pediatricians. He says, without the loan, he would still be in business but without the financial security to fully and securely operate.

loans.use: to pay for gas expenses and supplies for his counseling business.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Bayarsaikhan is 47 years old and  lives with his wife, mother and a 12-year-old son in his three-room apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. His wife has started to work as an assistant doctor at a local company. His son attends a secondary school. Bayarsaikhan has been working as a freestyle wrestling coach since he graduated from the professional university in 1992. From 2006-2012 he worked as the state coach for the Olympic participants of Mongolia. Once his mission was completed, he returned to his hometown. He rented out his apartment while he was working in Ulaanbaatar. Now his apartment is in disrepair due to several other people who had rented his apartment. Therefore, Bayarsaikhan is planning to make some improvements to his apartment, such as changing all electricity cables to prevent fires, installing double-glazed windows and an electric radiant floor heating system, and thickening the house walls to stop heat loss. Bayarsaikhan said that the government gave him this apartment in 2002 in gratitude for his contribution to the development of freestyle wrestling in Mongolia. Therefore, he loves this house very much. The loan Bayarsaikhan is taking out will be used to maintain his house in order to stop the heat loss through the windows and walls. Also, he mentioned that his dream is to bring the Olympic gold medal in freestyle wrestling to Mongolia .

loans.use: to make repairs to his house in order to stop the heat loss through the windows and walls

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo, 49, is the mother of four children between the ages of 12 and 26. She is married and lives in Airport. Three of her children live with her and are in school, while the other child lives outside the home and is independent. She received the initial capital from her husband to start this business. For the past six years, she has been selling flour, sugar, milk, butter, eggs and sugar in the market. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she can repay her loan and help her husband with the households expenses. She has requested this loan to purchase more sugar, flour, eggs and milk for the business, and she hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, eggs and milk for the business.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Salam prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. Thus, the photo is of her husband, Basil, who has the picture inside his shop. Salam is a 24-year-old young woman, who is married and a mother to one son and one daughter, who are below 4 years of age. Salam and her family live in a small village. Her husband has owned the barber shop for eight years, and it has been the only one of its type in the village.  Salam and her husband consider the shop a profitable project. It has many loyal customers, but also it needs more support from time to time, to cover the costs. 

Salam is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing a new barber kit, installing mirrors, and obtaining some necessary cosmetics, such as hair and face creams. These purchases will improve the shop's work and satisfy customers, which in turn will increase the family's income. They will then have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new barber kit, install some mirrors, and buy men's hair and face creams, for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina, 44, lives together with her friend and six children, who are between the ages of 3 and 27. Four of the children stay with her at home and are in school. The other two children live outside of the home and are independent. For the past sixteen years she has been selling body cream, body  powder, body wash, both men's and women's spray, hair grease and hand cream. Marina learned to sell from her friend, and she makes a profit. She has many customers. She uses the profit to buy goods and to support her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, body wash, hand wash, and both men's and women's spray for the business. Her plan is to provide her children with a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, body wash, hand wash, both men's and  women's spray for the business.

loans.name: Suliman

texts.en:
Suliman is a 36-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons and two daughters. His wife is a housewife.

For the past three years, Suliman has had a small sewing workshop, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. Now it needs more support to cover the costs. Suliman wants to meet the increasing demand from customers in less time, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN. He will use the loan to cover the cost of purchasing another sewing machine. This will improve his work and satisfy his customers. It will also increase the amount of work he can do each day, which will improve his income. As a result, he will be able to create better living conditions for the family. Suliman is photographed inside his sewing workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Cissy's Group

texts.en:
Cissy's group is comprised of hard working women. Cissy is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, she has been working hard to manage her boutique, which trades clothes. 

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Cissy to generate greater profits and be of assistance to her husband. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to have a good business. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is married and has been blessed with three children. He has been running his hog raising business for 9 years while his wife takes charge of their variety store. Hard work and determination are Jose's guiding principles in running his business. 

Jose would like to improve his hog raising and corn field businesses, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000. He will use this loan to buy hog feed and a portion will be used to maintain his corn field. With this loan, he will be able to produce quality hogs that will give him enough income for his family's well being and children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and maintain his corn field.

loans.name: Misael

texts.en:
Misael is 37 years of age and married with three children. According to Misael, farming is the primary source of income for people within his local community. As the crop season starts this month, he and his wife plan to prepare and cultivate the farm plot he manages so he can keep his business profitable.

The income Misael gained from farming has been used in raising hogs. He is thankful because it's been one year since he has run this kind of business. Now, he has raised four hogs to be fattened for sale. Misael's wife is a store owner. He is really grateful because his wife is supportive in generating funds to have a better way of living and a viable source of income.

Misael would like to buy hog feed, but his capital intended for hog raising was used in preparing his one hectare of corn field. So, he decided to borrow additional working capital in the amount of PHP 35,000. He will use this amount in buying hog feed and vitamins. He knows that using such livestock supplies, he could improve the weight of his hogs and keep them healthier to reach their optimum growth.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for his hog raising business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is married with three children, two of whom are young enough to still be in school. She also takes care of her late sister's child. For four years she's worked seven days a week selling charcoal, both retail and wholesale. Her major costs are school fees, rent, and feeding the family. She sells fruit and vegetables on the side to generate additional income. 

Prossy's major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. Her family resides in a rented house, where they have access to electricity but not to piped water, and she dreams to one day sell wholesale only and to build her own house. Prossy has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO, Kiva's loan partner, to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick, 25, is a farmer in Kitale County, Kenya, where he lives with his wife their young child. Nick he has been in farming for three years, producing vegetables and milk to sell at the local market. For extra income, he also runs an electronics shop.

Nick is asking to borrow 31,200 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow, whose milk will increase his income, thus boosting the family's standards of living and helping them educate their child. Nick appreciates the efficiency and helpfulness of Juhudi Kilimo, Kiva's field partner, in giving loans to local entrepreneurs. 

Though he faces challenges, such as poor road networks and unreliable workers, Nick is ambitious. In the next five years, his goal is to have an established farm on five acres of land, and to have bought three more dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saruul

texts.en:
Saruul, 25, lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His home is located in the boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. He has been living with his wife for 6 years and they have a two children, three and five years old, who go to the kindergarten.  Since 2007, Saruul has worked as a marketing manager at a private television company. His wife started working as an accountant in a media-related company in April 2012. 

In 2008, Saruul started building 70 square meter wooden house. He says that he has been building this house by only his family income; he doesn’t take any donations from either side of the family, parents or relatives, as would be usual in Mongolia. As a responsible young man who takes care of the environment and other’s health, he is using railway sleeper in order to make the warm house and to cut the usage of charcoal. Before the New Year, he plans to celebrate a wedding, so he is taking out the loan to complete his house to better accommodate guests. By doing this Saruul can build an energy saving house with less initial heat loss. Smoke from the charcoal burning stoves generates harmful chemicals and dust to the atmosphere. The Mongolian government is taking hierarchical steps to stop charcoal burning or at least minimize use to proper amounts, but charcoal is becoming the widespread fuel in use due to its cheap price.

loans.use: to complete his house using energy saving materials

loans.name: Maxson

texts.en:
Maxson is a 29-year-old single man supporting his four siblings. He sells cereal products, a business he started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 70,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase maize, beans, rice and green grams (mung beans) for sale. Profit he earns from his business will aid him in increasing his stock.

He hopes that in the near future he will be able to purchase a piece of land and build his own house, as well as educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase maize, beans, rice and green grams (mung beans) for sale.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is married and has five grown children between the ages of 21 and 30. One child lives at home while the others have left home and are on their own. She has a third-grade education.

For the past ten years Annie has sold used clothing such as ladies’ blouses and skirts. She makes a good profit as she sells clothes made of quality materials.

Annie is applying for an 18,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more used clothes to sell. Her ambition is to buy land and build a house on it.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito and his wife built their own small piggery three years ago, and he also manages five acres of corn field. The couple has been blessed with two children, the older of whom is in school, while the younger is still an infant.

Benito's goal in life is to produce quality hogs, so that he can have a stable business and earn a higher, more consistent income. With that goal always in mind, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000. He will invest the money in feed, vitamins, and vaccine for the hogs. Ensuring the pigs' nutrition helps Benito ensure better, more reliable profit throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu lives in Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of one school-going child. Mariamu owns a green grocery stall which she has been operating for five years. In this business, she sells greens, fruits, vegetables, cereals, etc. The family also earns some rent income from their rental houses.

Mariamu learned about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she faces include the seasonal business climate and lack of enough capital to expand the business. The latter issue she feels will be partly sorted by this new loan.  

Mariamu is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy vegetables in wholesale as well as retail stock such as soap and sugar, for example. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and to pay for her children’s school fees. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in wholesale, and retail stock such as soap and sugar

loans.name: Mashudi

texts.en:
Mashudi is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a single business man who has been running a motorcycle transport business for 4 years. Besides this, he is also a fish monger.

Despite the effect of unpredictable seasons and lack of security, Mashudi aspires to own a larger fleet of motorcycles for transport services in town.
Mashudi learnt of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of fish. He also wants to buy other motorcycles in the future.

Mashudi believes the additional income from this loan will help him plan for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 62 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa han dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante  a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Víctor pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para engreírlo, ya que este es su plato favorito.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación,  desde hace varios años Víctor trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de libros, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él también compra libros de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, Víctor puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien porque tiene buena acogida con sus clientes.
Víctor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de libros para abastecer su negocio; de esta manera Víctor espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor is 62 years old. He lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and their four children, whom he loves very much. They are his biggest motivation in life. Víctor is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. In his free time, he likes to read and eat his wife's special dish, "Ají de Gallina" (Peruvian chicken stew in a spicy, nutty cheese sauce), which she makes to spoil him since it is his favorite dish. 

Víctor and his wife have worked very hard to help their family get ahead. He studied Business Administration, and with much determination and dedication, Víctor has run his own small bookstore for many years now. Besides his inventory of books, Víctor also orders books requested by his customers. Each day he starts working very early in the morning and he often works up to 12 hours a day. Víctor believes that his business has gone so well for him because he is very welcoming with all his customers.

Víctor is very grateful for this Kiva loan because it will enable him to buy more books to stock his store. In this way, he hopes to increase his sales and, therefore, increase his profits. This will help him slowly grow his business.

loans.use: to buy books.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor. Manuel es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de administración y luego de ahorrar y sobre todo con muchas ganas de progresar logro iniciar su negocio de venta de computadoras, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 5 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Manuel esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar repuestos para computadores como placas madre, mouse, pantallas, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá mas variedad de productos para ofrecer y podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño” Tener su casa propia y una negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Manuel, 25, lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by its very warm and welcoming climate. Manuel is a young man who is eager to get ahead, and worked hard to complete his studies in Administration. After a lot of effort to save up, and above all with a strong desire to progress, he managed to start his own business selling computers. 

Manuel works around 8 hours per day, and can serve up to five clients daily. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very friendly to his customers, and is also extremely eager to succeed..

Manuel is very grateful to Kiva lenders and thanks to the help they have given, he can purchase parts for computers such as motherboards, mice, screens, etc. He will therefore be able to offer a greater variety of products, and will continue to fight each day to achieve his dream of "having my own home and a larger business."

loans.use: to purchase parts for computers, such as motherboards, mice, screens, etc.

loans.name: Flaure Mahoutin

texts.fr: Flaure Mahoutin (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à Désiré, un mécanicien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Flaure Mahoutin a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Flaure Mahoutin vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a quelques années que Flaure Mahoutin exerce comme activité, la vente des glacières et des cuillères de façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité, Flaure Mahoutin vend des tissus. Flaure Mahoutin exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Flaure Mahoutin s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Flaure Mahoutin sollicite un cinquième crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Flaure Mahoutin (raising her hand in the photo) is 37 years old and married to Désiré, a mechanic. They have three children, all in school and two still in their care. Flaure Mahoutin has left school after the primary grades. She lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. For several years, Flaure Mahoutin has been selling  coolers and spoons as a street vendor. In addition, she also sells fabric. Flaure Mahoutin is dedicated to her work, which allows her to provide for herself and her children. She stocks up in a town of Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and the need of increasing her working capital, Flaure Mahoutin is seeking her fifth loan. This loan will allow her to better respond to customer demand and earn a higher profit. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy   coolers and fabric [for resale].

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia, ella posee un comedor y vende todo tipo de platillos sopas, carnes, frijoles, arroz, lácteos, embutidos, entre otros, comercia desde el lugar de su residencia, tiene varios años de trabajar con el pequeño negocio y ha adquirido experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las comidas mas exquisitas, gracias al buen manejo de la venta siempre obtiene las mejores ganancias, la comunidad donde vive es muy transitada y ya tiene mucha clientela, aunque sus mejores clientes son los vecinos, todos la prefieren porque su producto es de calidad, a un precio accesible y sobre todo con el servicio mas rápido y limpio del lugar; Teresa es una mujer activa, decidida y muy dedicada a su labor, desea salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños por eso todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en el trabajo pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto espera, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, embutidos, pastas, bebidas, verduras, etc. Teresa de Jesús tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesús if forty-three and lives with her children in their house. She has a canteen and sells all types of soup, meat, beans, rice, milk, and sausage, among other things. She sells these from her home, and has worked for a number of years with this small business, through which she has acquired valuable experience which allows her to obtain better food. Thanks to the good direction of her sales, she always has the best earnings. The community where she lives is very busy so she has a lot of clients, although her best clients are her neighbors, who prefer her products for their quality, reasonable prices, and above all else her fast service and clean space. Teresa is an active woman who is determined and very dedicated to her work. She wants to move forward and fulfill her dreams. Because of this, everyday she works to her fullest because she knows that is the only way she might reach the success that she hopes for so much. In the last few weeks the demand for her services rose, and she wants to take advantage of this with a new investment, but she doesn't have sufficient capital to provide it. For this reason she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that would permit her to buy to buy basic grains, meat, milk, sausage, pasta, drinks, vegetables, etc. Teresa de Jesús has good references for pay and is very responsible. She assures that she will be able to settle the debt and at the same time has hope that she will keep her home economically secure.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, milk, sausage, pasta, drinks, and vegetables.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, who lives in Malindi, Kenya, is a water vendor. He is single. He supplies water to his neighborhoods; this idea came from the fact that there is a challenge of water delivery in the area. The water business has been running for two years. Besides this, he also owns a motorcycle, which he uses to ferry people around the area. He is employed.

A loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings will help George add more water kiosks and to buy a water tank. As the high cost of living all over has reduced the disposable income of many customers to such businesses, George intends to purchase more motorcycles in future.

He believes the income from the business will improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to add more water kiosks and to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 30, stopped her education in the 10th grade. She is married with two children, and they all reside in Airport. Her children are between the ages of 2 and 4. Because she lacks financial support, her children are not in school. 

For the past four years, she has been selling cooking oil, sugar, butter, eggs, milk and baking flour in the market. She received help from her husband to start in this business. Ruth makes a profit when she sells, because of the good location of her business. With the profit, she buys more goods for her business. 

Ruth has requested a loan to purchase more baking flour, cooking oil, sugar, butter and eggs for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more baking flour, cooking oil, sugar, butter and eggs for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and cremes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, all whom attend school. She owns a food cafe, a business she has been operating for two years. Apart from this, she earns a salary from her farming business. She is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school.

She learnt about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges she faces are price fluctuation and inflation. Margaret is applying for a loan of 21,950 Kenya shillings to buy an energy saving cooker and other retail stock, e.g. sugar, cereals and cooking oil. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and also to pay for her children’s school fees. 

Her plan for the future is to expand by opening another food cafe.

loans.use: to buy a cooker and retail stock, e.g. sugar, cereals and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica lives in Malindi, Kenya. She has two school-going children. Jessica owns a chemist/pharmacy which has been in operation for three years. She learnt of Milango from her friends. Jessica is also employed as a community health worker in the area of her business. She is applying for a loan of 85,900 Kenya shillings to add a new stock of drugs/human medicines. The challenges facing the business are competition from other suppliers and inadequate funds to stock the business. 

Despite all this, Jessica would like to open a wholesale trade in the near future. She believes the additional income from this loan will help improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to add a new stock of drugs/human medicines.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Josephine is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years Josephine has been working hard to manage her fish vending business which sells fish. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to procure more fish for resale, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits, increase capital and generate more profits. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the business. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to procure more fish for resale.

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Etaf is a 39-year-old woman, she is married and a mother to two sons and four daughters; their ages are between 14-2 years.

Etaf's husband is employed but earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Etaf is seeking to improve her family's home living condition, so she is requesting a $1500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing water tanks for her house. Taking this loan will offer to Etaf and her family pure and clean water to drink and to use for home purposes which will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks for home use.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 30-year-old lady who is married and has one child who is attending school. She has been taking care of the house as a housewife but she says that she wants to help her husband with the household expenses. Juliet wants to start a vegetable stall from her home. 

She anticipates a good return out of this investment since she sees opportunities in the neighborhood. She thinks this will generate income for her family by selling vegetables (i.e. mustard greens, tomatoes, string beans and chilies).

Juliet wants to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, kale, bananas, etc., to get started.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, kale, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 36 years old. She is a divorced mother of five children. She lives in Tiribe in the coastal region of Kenya. She wants to open a vegetable stall but she does not have enough capital to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. She is optimistic that she is sure to have good income to continue sending her children to school. She is waiting for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Zaituni has been working hard to manage her bar and lodging, which sells drinks and has accommodations. 

To help expand her business, Zaituni has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soft drinks and renovate the accommodation rooms, and will help Zaituni to generate greater profits and maintain the family expenses. Zaituni hopes that in the future she will be able to develop the business. 

Zaituni is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and renovate the accommodation rooms.

loans.name: Chigulu

texts.en:
Chigulu is a resident of Kongowea of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of one child who has not begun schooling. She runs a clothes shop, a business that she has been operating for two years.
 
She learnt about Milango through an employee and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are competition and bad debts. She believes that through this loan, she can improve the business. 

Chigulu is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to purchase some clothes to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on her living standards. She aspires to be a large scale supplier of secondhand clothes.

loans.use: To purchase some clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a resident of the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a charcoal business which has been in operation for the last two years. He also owns a motorcycle which he uses to ferry people and goods in the town.

He learned about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenge is the punitive measures at times enforced by the local administration on charcoal sellers.

Ahmed is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family and to pay for his child’s future school fee requirements. He aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Esther is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Esther has been working hard to manage her fast food business, which sells fried Irish chips. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy Irish potatoes and cooking oil to run the business much better, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and increase business sales. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes and cooking oil to run the business much better,

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He owns a business, providing transport through a motorcycle, which he has been running for four years. He is a single businessman. 

Despite the effect of unpredictable seasons, Onesmus aspires to own a larger fleet of motorcycles for transport services in the town.

Onesmus learnt of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 31,450 KES to purchase another motorcycle. He also desires to buy other motorcycles in the future.

Onesmus believes the additional income from this loan will help him plan for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María, vive en su vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijos menor de edad. Se dedica desde ya hace mucho tiempo a la crianza de pollos como su principal fuente de ingresos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada en su trabajo, honesta y responsable.  María recibe ayuda de su esposo que con grandes esfuerzos tienen el sueño de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. María se caracteriza por que da su mejor esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, por lo que se ha ganado el respeto y la admiración de familia, amigos y en especial de su clientela que siempre lo prefiere. Es por su gran compromiso de siempre entregar los mejores productos. María desde hace u tiempo desea ampliar su pequeño negocio es por eso  que decidió solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar más pollos y concentrado para que estos sean de la mejor calidad para su fiel clientela.
texts.en:
María lives in her own home together with her husband and her young children.  She has dedicated herself for a long time to raising chickens as her main source of income.  She is a very hardworking woman, dedicated to her work, honest and responsible.  María receives help from her husband.  They have the dream of giving their family a better quality of life with their great efforts.  María is characterized as giving her best effort to the activities that she carries out and for this she has earned the respect and admiration of family, friends and especially her customers that always prefer her business because of her great commitment to always deliver the best products.  

María has for some time wanted to expand her small business.  That is why she decided to apply for a loan from Integral to buy more chickens and chicken feed so that these are of the best quality for her faithful clientele.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and pay rent and rates to the Local Authority.

loans.name: Mwadama

texts.en: Mwandama is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in the town of Tiribe, Kenya. He has been selling goats for the past four years, selling at the market. The loan he is currently applying for is his second, and is for 30,000 KES. The loan is to invest in the purchase of more goats for resale. With this, he will take advantage of the season and succeed in increasing his income for supporting his family. His dream is to keep his business going, so that he can continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Allie

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Allie from Kandeh, Bo, in the Southern Province of Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children, 2 and 8. Before, he was a farmer. He started this business mainly to develop himself and his family, 

Now, Allie runs a bakery; he sells sweet bread and savory bread. He has been running this business for 10 years. He works at the business every day, 20 hour per day. His business is the only income he has. One of his major problems is that the heat of the oven is detrimental to his health, sometimes.   

Allie has requested a loan in order to expand his bakery and buy goods like bags of flour, sugar, salt and vegetable oil. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and increase his business. In the future, he plans to employ staff for his bakery. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to expand his bakery and buy goods like bags of flour, sugar, salt and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Abu    B

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Abu from Kandeh town Bo, Southern area, Sierra Leone. He is a married father of three children between the ages of 4 years and 15 years, all currently attending school.

Previously a diamond miner, after illness Abu decided not to mine anymore and began his clothing business in 2007 to generate income to support his family. Working nine hours per day and seven days per week, he says his enterprise is doing well.

Abu now requires a loan in order to buy bales of used clothing such as trousers, shirts and blouses. He hopes that the extra income arising from the loan will enable him to educate his children and improve his standard of living. In the future, Abu plans to expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing such as trousers, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Malindi area of Coast province. She is a mother of two school-going children. She operates a hawking business which has been in operation for two years now. She started the business through her own little savings. In this business she sells clothes, sanitary pads and cosmetics.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she is facing are the seasonal business climate, the high cost of purchasing stock and finding customers. 

Elizabeth is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of second hand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and for personal use. Her future plan is to buy a public service vehicle.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a resident of Malindi of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. Halima owns a food cafe, a business that she has been running for five years. The food cafe mainly offers evening meals to the residents of the town.

She learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of capital and fluctuating prices. 

Halima is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase cooking utensils and foodstuff like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of the family. She aspires to own a grocery stall and to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a resident of Malindi, Kenya and owns a business providing transport through a motorcycle, which he has been running for four years. He is a single businessman. Besides this, he is also employed as a fabricator in a welding/vehicle repair shop.

Despite the effect of unpredictable seasons and lack of security, Benard aspires to own a larger fleet of motorcycles for transport services in the town.

Benard learnt of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 31,500 KES to purchase another motorcycle. He also desires to buy other motorcycles in future.

Benard believes the additional income from this loan will help him plan for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a businessman living in Malindi town, Kenya. He owns a fruit and vegetable shop as a source of income. Omar began the business two years ago. He is single. 

Omar learned of Milango from his friends. He was introduced to Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to purchase new stocks of fruit and vegetables. His aspiration is to supply other major towns in the country.

He believes that the income will enable him to provide for his basic needs and purchase additional stock. His main challenge has been theft and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Mamie    Y

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mamie from Moriba, Bo, in the Southern Province of Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 15. Her children are currently attending school. Mamie owns a palm oil business. She started running her business at an early age, since she did not go to school. Her business is the only income she has. She works at the business every day, 10 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are the high cost of transportation and the poor road network.

Mamie requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open another store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор женщина 48  лет.  Она замужем имеет троих детей.   Занимается купля продажей детской одежды.  В начале своей деятельности Зулхумор торговала детской одеждой,  и оборот её бизнеса был небольшой.   Ассортимент товаров тоже был невелик но   Зулхумор год за годом увеличивала свой товарооборот сотрудничая с Арванд  и на полученные доходы выдала замуж дочь и  отремонтировала свой дом. Эти видом деятельности  она занимается  5 лет.  Зулхумор не хочет на этом останавливаться она старается развивать свой бизнес и на очередной полученный кредит планирует закупить новый ассортимент детской одежды.  Заранее благодарит  за поддержку.
texts.en: Zulhumor is 48 years old, married and has three children. She sells children's clothing. She began her entrepreneurial activity with a small assortment of merchandise and low sales volume. However, year after year, Zulhumor increased the volume of her sales with assistance from MDO Arvand and, thanks to her growing profits, held a wedding for her daughter and repaired her home. Zulhumor has been in this line of work for the past 5 years, and she doesn't want to stop developing her business further. Using her next loan, she is planning to purchase a new lot of children's clothing. She is grateful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie 28, lives in Airport with her husband, a security guard, and four children who are between the ages of 1 and 11. Three of her children are not attending school because she lacks the financial means to send them.

Winnie, who received a loan from BRAC Liberia to start her business, sells cooking oil, milk, eggs, butter, and sugar at the well-located community market. She has requested a loan to purchase more cooking oil, butter, sugar, eggs, and milk to sell. Her dream is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, butter, sugar, eggs, and milk for the business.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара умница, красавица и очень целеустремленная девушка. Ей  20 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители очень гордятся, что их дочь студентка 3 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета. Гулсара учится успешно и сдает все экзамены только на хорошо и отлично. Ее преподаватели говорят, что Гулсара это «студент имеющий путь к профессорской деятельности».  Так как ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебу, вы являетесь единственными людьми, кто может помочь ей. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulsara is a smart, beautiful, and very purpose-driven young woman. She is 20 years old and lives with her parents, who are very proud that their daughter is a 3rd-year student at the Tajik State University. Gulsara's studies are going well, and she gets only As and Bs on all her exams. Her teachers say that Gulsara is a "student with a potential to become a professor".

Since Gulsara's parents are unable to pay for her education, you are the only people who can help her. She is requesting this loan to cover her university tuition. Gulsara is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Deysi Janeth

texts.es: Deysi de 34 años de edad vive junto a sus 2 hijos es una mujer luchadora que con esfuerzo le ha brindado lo mejor a sus dos hijos que la han visto como su ejemplo ya que solamente ella les ha dado lo mejor de si. Es responsable, honesta y trabajadora se a caracterizado por ser trabajadora con esfuerzo posee un pequeño trabajo de costurera y gracias a Dios posee de abundante clientela la cual la prefieren por dar buenos precios y trabajar de una forma limpia y delicada. Deysi se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar materiales como hilo, tijeras, telas, y materia prima ya que ella no cuenta con el capital necesario  y siente que necesita pedir ayuda ya que es su única fuente de ingreso. Cuenta con el deseo que su crédito sea solicitado y pronto poder volver a su trabajo ya que por el momento lo ha dejado si trabajar porque no tiene como seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Deysi is 34 years old. She lives with her 2 children and is a fighter. With effort, she has offered her children the best. They see her as an example since she she has only given them the best of herself. She is responsible, honest and hardworking. With effort she has been able to have a small business sewing clothes. Thank God, she has a lot of customers who prefer her for her good prices and clean and dedicated work. Deysi has decided toask fort a loan from INTEGRAL to buy materials such as thread, scissors, fabirc and more since she doesn't have enough working capital. She needs the help because this is her only source of income. She wants to apply for the loan and return to work because she had to stop working becaue she had no way to continue.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, scissors, fabrics and more.

loans.name: Juldeh

texts.en:
Juldeh is 40 years old and married with 5 children between the ages of 2 and 20. He runs a general merchandise business in Kulanda, Bo, in the Southern Province of Sierra Leone. Four of his children are currently attending school.

He's been in this business for 25 years and sells cigarettes, sardines, toothpaste and bread within his neighborhood. He also earns income from renting out a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is that his purchasing power is very low.

Juldeh requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy stocks of soft drinks, pure water and bags of milk. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children and improve his family's level of living. In the future, he would like to expand his business more. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soft drinks, pure water and bags of milk.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es: Samuel de 38 años de edad vive junto a su familia y sus hijos, gracias a Dios viven en casa humilde pero propia, es un hombre muy trabajador ya que día a día cuenta con obligación de llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Es por eso que junto a su esposa poseen un negocio donde venden ropa interior y sandalias para mujer, su esposa le ayuda vendiendo lociones y es así como juntos velan por brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, dando lo mejor de ambos y así también tener la satisfacción que en su hogar no faltara el sustento diario.  Samuel desea incrementar mas su venta teniendo mas variedad de producto es por eso que decidió acercarse a INTEGRAL y solicitar un crédito para así comprar más ropa, sandalias en variedad y ropa interior. Cuenta con la satisfacción que nunca le ha quedado mal a nadie y este caso no será la excepción  agradece de ante mano la ayuda que espera recibir.
texts.en:
Samuel, age 38, lives with his family and his children.  Thanks to God, they live in a house that is humble, but it is their own.  He is a very hard-working man because he has the obligation of bringing home the daily bread every day.  That is why, together with his wife, they have a business where they sell underwear and sandals for women.  His wife helps him by selling lotions.  That is how, together, they ensure that they give their children a better future.  They both give their best, and they also have the satisfaction of supporting their household daily.

Samuel wishes to increase his sales by having a greater variety of products.  That is why he decided to approach Integral and request a loan.  He will buy more clothes, a variety of sandals, and underwear.  He has the satisfaction of never having left anyone with outstanding debt.  This time will not be the exception.  He is grateful in advance for the help he hopes to receive.

loans.use: to buy clothes, a variety of sandals, and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, beverages and other merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья – из Мелитополя. Она – замужем, у нее двое взрослых детей. Наталья торгует женским бельем и трикотажем в своем киоске на местном привокзальном  рынке. Имел огромный опыт работы в сфере торговли. 
Наталье необходима сумма в 10 000 гривен для приобретения сезонного товара под реализацию у себя на точке.
texts.en:
Natalya is from Melitopol.  She is married and has two grown children.  Natalya sells women's underwear and hosiery in her own kiosk at the local market near the railway station.  She has a lot of experience in sales.

Natalya needs 10,000 hryven (UAH) to buy seasonal merchandise for selling at her kiosk.

loans.use: to  buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Geovanny

texts.es: Con un préstamo de 26,250 pesos Geovanny ha podido comprar lineas de productos especializadas para el cuidado del pelo y un secador de pelo. a Geovanny le ha gustado estilizar el pelo desde niña, por lo que resultó natural que su primer empleo fuera como peluquera. Hace 10 años que inició su negocio propio, como una manera de poder estar más tiempo en casa cuidando a sus niños que ahora tienen 18 y 16 años. En la foto Goevanny aparece con una de sus clientes, quien aparece con sus facciones difuminadas, para guardar su privacidad. El esposo de Geovanny trabaja en el área de la construcción, por lo que sus ingresos no son estables. El proyecto inmediato de Geovanny es instalar un acondicionador de aire en su negocio. Desea enviar a sus hijos a estudiar en la universidad y apoyarlos con el costo de la misma.
texts.en:
With a loan for 26,250 pesos Geovanny has been able to buy lines of specialized hair care products and a hairdryer.  Ever since she was a girl, Geovanny has liked styling hair.  It was only natural that her first job was as a hairdresser.  

Ten years ago she started her own business as a way to be able to be at home more in order to take care of her children, who are now 18 and 16.  In the photo Geovanny appears with one of her customers, who appears with her face blurred to maintain her privacy.  Geovanny’s husband works in the construction area, and his income is not stable.

Geovanny’s immediate plan is to install an air-conditioner in her business.  She wishes to send her children to the university and to support them with the cost of doing so.

loans.use: to buy lines of specialized hair care products and a hairdryer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, foam rubber, fabric, and other supplies for his cabinetmaking shop.

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky, 49, is a widow who has been working very hard to manage her business. She has six children between the ages of 19 and 30. Only two of them live with her at home and are attending school. The other four children live outside the home and are independent. 

For the past twenty years, she has been selling raw fish at the community market. She makes profit because she always sells her customers' favorite fish, the cassava fish. With the profits generated from her business, she buys more goods and repays her loan. She is requesting
a loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to see her business improve.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 37 years old and widowed with 5 children, ages 7 through 20 years. She runs a used clothing business at Moriba town, Bo, in a southern area of Sierra Leone. She began this business because she needs to educate her children and take care of her family.
 
She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of used clothing within a busy market area. Her business provides her only source of  income. She says that the main challenge to her business is the high cost of transportation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bales of clothing, such as men's and women's jeans. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase this business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to open a big clothing shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothing, such as men's and women's jeans

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49-year-old Isata from Kulanda town, Bo,  in a southern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 10 years and 29 years. Three of her children attend school. 

Isata runs a palm oil business; she sells palm oil at her house. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. Her husband is a businessman,  and she also receives income from him.  Isata says that the main challenge to her business is that the road network to the place she usually purchases her goods is very poor 

Isata has requested a loan in order to  buy more local foodstuff such as gari (cassava flakes), pepper and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installment quickly and to increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a nice house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more local foodstuff such as gari (cassava flakes), pepper and palm oil.

loans.name: Sallu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Sallu from Kulanda town, in  Bo, a southern area of Sierra Leone. He is married with 4 children between the ages of 2 years and 18 years. His children attend school. He is seeking this loan because he wants to develop himself and his family. 

Sallu runs a clothing business.  He sells shirts, jeans, blouses, bags, and shoes.  He has been running this business for 10 years. He works at the business 8 hours a day and 6 days per week, and has two relatives that working for him. He also has a bike that he uses for transportation and to bring another income into the home. Sallu says that the major problems for his business are the high cost of transportation and, sometimes, low purchasing power of customers.  

Sallu has requested a loan to purchase more clothing such as shirts, jeans, blouses, bags and shoes. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and increase his business. In the future, he hopes to open a clothing factory. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more clothing such as shirts, jeans, blouses, bags and shoes

loans.name: Donsu Group

texts.en:
In 2009, these tribal women created a platform for themselves and formed a group of 10 members called Donsu where they can help one another to generate income for a better future. 

They live in a village in the hills of Manipur, which is in the northeastern part of India bordering Myanmar. Agriculture is still the main occupation in this part of the country.

The woman with raised hand is called Mathiuboniu. She is 25 years old and is a mother to a son, 6, and a daughter, 4. Both her children go to a private school which is 3 km from her village. In her new home she lives with her husband and one brother-in-law (21 years old). Her husband is a lorry truck driver by profession and the brother in-law is a trained carpenter.
 
In 2009, with her first loan of INR 5,000, she invested in ginger farming, employing her brother-in-law. With the good harvest she profited INR 15,000. Without spending a penny and with her husband's help, she invested in buying equipment and tools to open a carpentry workshop for her brother-in-law. Eventually, the carpentry workshop became a good investment for her. Today she can employ two more carpenters to assist her brother in-law. 

With her second loan of INR 10,000, she continued her ginger farming on a bigger scale. Unfortunately she was unable to reap a good harvest due to rodents and she suffered a great loss. However she was able to repay her loan from the carpentry investment.
 
She needs another loan and this time she wishes to venture into selling of ready-made garments. She plans to go to a border town of Myanmar and Manipur, a trading centre with all kinds of foreign goods. With the winter season approaching, she plans to invest and use her loan for warm clothes and blankets to sell in her shop.
  
Similarly, the rest of the group members have made steady improvement with their respective businesses and will use their loans to expand. The business of the members, apart from the agricultural sector, includes weaving, paan shop, laundry service, clothes, merchandise and selling of consumption commodities door to door.

loans.use: to buy garments, especially warm clothes and blankets to sell in her village.

loans.name: Kiuliang Group

texts.en:
Initiated by Geeta, with raised hand, Kiuliang is a 12-member group. The group belongs to the Naga tribe residing in a hill station village, in the state of Manipur, which is in the northeastern part of India.

Geeta is a mother to a son and a daughter. She lives with her parent-in-law and her husband. Her husband, Mazatpou, 32 years old, is a cultivator by profession. Her 8-year-old son goes to school at the nearby village, which is about 3 km in distance. The family's main source of income is through her weaving of traditional shawls and wrap-around skirts for ladies.
  
Her husband’s banana farm could never be of much significance in terms of profit calculation. Geeta said, “I have never had the chance to complete my higher education because my parents were too poor. Thanks to my mother, who taught me how to weave, today I can at least provide food and clothing to my new family through weaving. Every day before I sleep, I pray for my mother’s blessing so that I may weave enough to support my children to complete their higher education.”
  
She has been weaving using the back strap, which in the long run causes back problems. With the loan of INR 10,000 and with some of her savings, she plans to purchase one hand loom (a simple machine to weave) and employ two more to assist her in order to meet the high demand for her products.

The rest of the group members are mostly on the wrong side of their 60’s but still working very hard in order to survive. Most of them are abandoned parents. The group's plan is that the older one will invest together on ginger plantation.

loans.use: to buy a hand loom for her weaving business and employ two weavers to help.

loans.name: Jaime Benigno

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 37 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Jaime pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libre e gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Mariscos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Jaime trabaja como profesor de historia y geografía en un centro educativo de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y le gusta ayudar a los demás.
Jaime se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una laptop, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajos educativos, así pues Jaime espera poder brindar una mejor calidad de educación a sus alumnos y poco a poco desea poder alcanzar sus metas y su gran sueño de formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Jaime, 37, is a single man.  He lives in the city of Nazca.  He's a very pleasant, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire for self-improvement.  Thanks to his effort and the support of his family Jaime was able to study education.  In his free time he likes to watch educational programs on television, and sometimes he cooks a delicious seafood rice to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Jaime works every day as a history and geography teacher in a school in his city.  He starts work very early every day.  He can work approximately 10 hours a day, and he believes it's going well for him because he's very responsible and he likes to help others.

Jaime is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy a laptop to be able to do his educational work.  Jaime hopes that this way he'll give a better quality of education to his students.

Little by little he wants to reach his goals and his big dream of having his own family.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, 32, stopped her education in the seventh grade. She is single with two children, age 6 and 12, who are both in school. 

For the past 12 years, she has been selling rice by retail in the community market.

She is proud of her business because she makes a profit and feels independent. With the profit, she buys more goods and pays the educational expenses of her children. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice to sell by retail. Her dream is to educate her children and become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice to sell by retail.

loans.name: Noradyn

texts.en:
Noradyn is a 32-year-old married woman from Pangalao, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 13 and the youngest is 10 months old. 

She raises hogs. Her husband is a carpenter. She has been in the hog-raising business for two years. 

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase feed for the hogs and additional piglets, which will be very beneficial in order for her business to grow. 

Noradyn would like to invest in other business ventures to support her family while saving for the education of her children for their bright futures.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, 28, lives at Airport with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 1 and 9. She 
would like to give the best education to her children but lacks financial support. 

For the past six years, she has been selling raw fish in the market. She makes a profit when she sells because her customers love cassava
fish and bonnie fish. She uses the profit to buy more goods and contribute to the household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business.

loans.name: Faraj

texts.en:
Faraj is a 30-year-old married man without children.

For the past two years, Faraj has had a small workshop for repairing computers and selling computer accessories. It has been a profitable project and has good demand from customers.

Faraj wants to improve his work, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new repairing kit. A new repairing kit will improve his work and enable him to do it in less time. This will satisfy his customers and increase his income.

Faraj is photographed inside his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new electronics repair kit.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 49-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 24 and the youngest is 8. 

She sells fish and during her spare time she also makes dresses. She has been in both business for 20 years.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fish net and materials for dress making like cloth, thread, and zippers.

In the future, Magdalena would like to improve her business by investing to other businesses to support her family as well as to save for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish net and also materials for dress making.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 49-year-old single woman from Panglao, Bohol. 

She raises hogs. She has been in the hog-raising business for ten years. Aside from hog raising, she owns a sari-sari (variety) store.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional piglets, feed and merchandise for the sari-sari store like sugar, noodles, and canned goods. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to expand her business by investing in other business ventures to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feeds, additional piglets and merchandise for her sari-sari store.
